story:
GALA De KISA

"An Evening Towards Their Future!"


During our "civic" excursion this year in late December, we will host yet another special event for our children in lower rural of Hinche, Haiti and we are asking for your kind generous support.


* Our goal is $4,600 to sponsor this event for the children in Hinche!

KISA - "Kan Inisyativ Souverein Ayiti" a Haiti youth community oriented initiative started by "S.H.I" instilling in our Haitian children a sense of "sankofa" to our African roots as African descents through civic instructions, engagement, recreations, and nationalistic endowments for a better Haiti. 

It is important we remain consistent in the lives of our children while promoting an environment conducive to their learning, one that is nourishing to them and their growth be it socially and culturally.

Indeed we are asking for your engaging contribution into the lives of our children which will facilitate us in providing and/or obtaining...

*  A location and decorations,
*   Sound & visual equipments,
*  DJ & performers,
*  Meals, and prizes etc...

__There are many ways to help by spreading this campaign to friends, families, and/or fellowships on behalf of what this cause represents...

As your very own,


SOVEREIGN HAITI INITIATIVE - (S.H.I).

(404) 482 - 1622

SovereignHaitiInitiative@gmail.com


"STAND FOR HAITI'S TRUE SOVEREIGNTY, NOT RUSES OF DEPENDENCY AND OCCUPANCY!"

story:
Who's Agent O?

Agent O is me, Oana Calugar. I love tech entrepreneurs and I want to bring value to the startups I work with. 

I coach startups in my work with TechAngels, the Romanian based business angels network for financing tech startups. And I'm also part of the support team of a pure breed startup from San Francisco -- Weebly.

Because of my love for startups, I've been invited to receive the the official Lean Launchpad for Incubators/Accelerator training at Columbia University in New York. The seminar is offered to incubator / accelerator managers by Steve Blank and Jerome Engel. If you're working in a startup and don't know who Steve Blank is, go an read this now. 

The seminar is for those who want to use Lean LaunchPad method to build portfolios of new startups or new businesses inside existing companies.  I'll learn how to use the Lean LaunchPad and a rigorous "get out of the building" process to accelerate product/market fit and customer validation.  And I'll know how to adopt and adapt the Lean LaunchPad method for the startups I coach and for your incubator or accelerator.

While I'm coaching startups with the experience I have from working in IT startups and companies for the last 4 years and the knowledge from books for startups, I want to take it to the next level and bring an amazing knowledge in Europe too. I want to work with European startups, incubators and companies and help them take off. 

I can't just stand and do nothing seeing European startups fail because they lack customers and a proﬁtable business model. 

Your help is needed to bring the The LeanLaunchpad of launching startups to Europe. Agent O is counting on you. European Startups are counting on you! 

It's for the future of European entrepreneurs and our advantage for years to come. With a one-time effort, together we can bring the world's leading startup entrepreneurial education from US to Europe. 


This Mission Needs You 

I need around 3750,- EUR for the educational program and certification at Columbia University in New York, in September 23-24 2013.  

I'm putting my money in this paying for the flight (700,-EUR) and Visa (200,-EUR). 

If we are unable to reach the goal of 2750,- EUR within September 13th - I will not be able to go. I will not be able bring the the golden nuggets on building startups to European entrepreneurs. Startups will continue to fail with good products and no customers. No advantage for the European ecosystem for the next 10 years. 

If we manage to beat the goal, I promise to donate my time and my knowledge to European Startups and help them take off!

I'll share the insights shared with me during the Launchpad for Incubators/Accelerator training exclusively with you and help your startup, company or Incubator/Accelerator apply best entrepreneurial principles and tips.  

On the right side you'll see the assortment of unique rewards for you as a sponsor.


Why is Agent O fit for this mission

I'm very grateful for two things in life: 

  1. for my 5-year old son Tudor, who's healthy, curious and cheeky as he can be
  2. for the fact that I discovered my passion work and I can do it daily: working with tech startups and help them take off through investment, expertise and connections. 

Letting this gratefulness overflow into blessings around me and constantly learning the new ways to launch businesses from books, blogs and events, I obsessively share the lessons with founders and entrepreneurs. 

Lost in thought: How can I help startups define and follow their metrics?

I'm working to translate and publish Steve Blank's book 'The Fours Steps to the Epiphany' into Romanian. 

I organize events for startups and startup communities (How to Web Community Event, Startup Weekend and Girls in Tech). 

You can learn more about me and keep track of me on Twitter and LinkedIn.

 

Other Ways You Can Help the Mission 

I'll totally understand if you are not able to contribute. No worries!

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out about my mission.
  • Retweet fundraising and support posts on Twitter @oana_co
  • Share the link to this campaign and share the message on Twitter, on Facebook on email, in conversations with your founder friend, your boss, your mom or your colleague.

The more we reach, the more likely we can make this amazing thing for Europe happen. Click those share buttons and let's make people notice! 

Let's help European startups take off!

story:
The Smooth JavaSpot

Hey, my name is Robert. I created The Smooth JavaSpot to be a "comfort spot" a place to "really" relax and enjoy a great cup of Jo. I developed the concept so that it will provide a wonderful coffee house experience...a smooth java experience. Why Coffee and Art? They're both great for relaxation and conversation. Sipping on your coffee, enjoying a slice of cake while looking at artwork throughout the shop is so comfortable way to enjoy an hour or two of your day. I also feel it's a great opportunity to create a place to allow artist to showcase their work(s) "silently" and at the same time, offer the JavaSpot patrons a chance to always be within a gallery feel. The Javaspot's "JavaWalls of art" will be for all ages and backgrounds of artists. The JavaSpot will ultimately join the community together...people meeting people of all walks. I designed all the products, the website ( www.thesmoothjavaspot.com ) and all the graphics/logos. The website (products button will show you all the products). I intend on Mentoring Artist whenever needed. The JavaSpot will also have from time to time, a LiveArt  Portrait Session. I believe the LiveJavaArt Session will set us apart from all places, taking the "Smooth Java Experience" to a higher level. Why the strong focus on Art in this project description? It's a major part of the project, I feels it's important for Backers to know/see that I have a passion for art and some artistic ability. Coffee, internet access and wonderful products are just as important! :) It equally shares the spotlight (hence the provided website link for products). But the art portion is where I'm showing we can give back to the community. But, the JavaSpot isn't just for the Locals...It's a worldwide developing concept...One to reach out outline via the website and social networks to all who love art (and great coffee) products. Your contributions will make this a stronger and bolder reality!

Please see The Gallery for pictures of both product and my artistic ability.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding for The Smooth JavaSpot will help us to obtain quality coffee/expresso machines, blenders, products, the JavaCards and the point of sales equipment/software. The funding will help provide the inserts for a seriously great sign out front as well as the outdoor cafe furniture and the interior finish out. In return, we will be creating and making a bold statement that the community has something absolutely wonderful, that you helped to create The Smooth JavaSpot. The community will also see jobs being created as well as a chance to say that "we" made it possible for Artist(s) to have a platform to launch from. The "Perks & Rewards" for contributing are fantastic! Coffee products, "Premium Chocolate" and even Oil Portraits will be on the list for contributions. The value of an oil portrait in itself will far exceed the contribution, but the contribution to my dream far outweighs the offering of the Oil Portrait any day :)

All Contributor "Perk Levels" will be given a Free "Smooth Member JavaCard" with a Smooth Value surprise attached.

The Impact

Over the years, I've been a Mentor to At Risk Youth, donating my time to Police Departments in many cities, to include; Carrollton, Texas and Coppell, Texas (Chief of Police, Mac Tristan) and LT Chris Rory of the Dekalb County Georgia Police Department. Through education, mentoring and even Art, I've encouraged young people to strive for a better way, to respect their fellow man/woman and to aspire to greater opportunties and goals for their lives. I want The Smooth JavaSpot to continue offering these gestures...and now, not the just to the youth...but to all who need to be encourage that there is a better way. The JavaSpot will be a wonderful place to unite people of all walks. I'm a Veteran of The United States Air Force. I've worked and fought along side all walks of life, I've learned how teach without expecting reward, and how to give hoping that others will be inspired to do the same. Though a business is just a business to many, The Smooth JavaSpot also represents a launching pad to greater heights in uniting people. Your contributions will make this a stronger pledge to that notion.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: Your network(s) of friends, family and associates may be inclined to help in the moment, right now when I need you most. Please spread the word! Encourage those that can help, to understand that there's a greater destination through this window of opportunity for so many. I'm asking for your help today. Thank you!

story:
Bonjour! We would like to gather some funds to help with expenses of establishing our humble label as an official entity!


A musical fairytale...

Once Upon a Fruit Tart

Fruit Tart started as the faux-label name of my singer/songwriter persona, Rosa Diaz.  A fruit tart was the most beautiful scrumptious gift that a friend brought to my place once, when she came over to practice.  Because where there is music, there are always yummy treats.  At least, at my place.  I am currently blog content and material for a follow up to my 2012 release, WHIM. The album will be called For Boys Who Like Bukowski: A Healing Album for Broken Men.  I am still visioning the project and updates of research and documented ideas can be traced on the blog.  

Somewhere in Occitania...

The traveling musician archetype of the troubadour (and his female counterpart, the troibaritz) is our inspiration!  The artistic spirit of the High Middle Ages--romance languages, lyric poetry, multi-stringed instruments, chivalry and courtly love remain the main inspiration of the many a modern singer-songwriter and we seek not to differentiate between the high nobility, those of petty noble lineage, the merchants, tradesmen and the poor fisherman (or woman.)  The loose association and freedom that artists will have with Fruit Tart Records also calls upon this muse.  We are planning to set ourselves up to be some combination of creative group, collaborative, collective, co-operative and association.  We'll have to sit with a few legal experts and community organizations who have trudged through that mud before us before we can actually obtain a worthy legal standing that all artists in the troupe are happy with.  What Fruit Tart aims to be is a place to rest our heads, a place to "hold court" and solidify already existing collaborations and friendships among the community of creatives, a flag we can wear proudly, something to push our individual efforts forward maintaining as much freedom as possible while at the same time nurturing the artistic community ethic that has aided us in growing our gifts. 

Introducing our Creative Types!

We've gathered a beautiful community of artists and creatives who would like to "hold court" here at Fruit Tart and affiliate with us. 

Lounging and strumming her lute at the other end of the castle courtyard is Dylan Jane.  Her troupe of sometimes-y on again off again travel buddies is known quite accurately as "The Turning Leaves."  When she is not making bright sound with the band, or breathing a gutsy melancholy solo, she is hidden in a corner, or under a tree, writing a rhyme of courtly love, another ballad for a lost or would be mortal made god by her ink and blood, something the fortune teller somehow missed.  In the fall of 2013, Dylan Jane completed her first U.S. tour.  

Bethlehem and the songwriter that goes by the name of "Sad" Patrick met at an open mic that Sad started in a local coffee shop in the Northwest Philadelphia neighborhood they both share.  Bethlehem quickly became the main event of the evening, drawing neighbors, friends and strangers alike with her earthy, honest voice.  With the voice of a diva, but always approachable and amicable, Bethlehem won the hearts of the regulars.

In her solo work, Bethlehem has been described as "Germantown's next rising star" by WHYY/NewsWorks Philadelphia and is primarily an acapella artist who combines her original sonic creations with vocalized rhythms as well as claps and stomps in a performance art style atop a custom-made tarima that has her name engraved in it in Hebrew letters.  Her first solo release, Bigger Than Music, was released in November of 2012.  She also works with some notable acts as a jazz singer, including the Philadelphia Jazz Project with whom she performed with at TEDxPhiladelphia in 2014.  

Bethlehem brings her own color palette to Patrick's songwriting.  With her voice, she interprets the songs, combining jazz-inspired scats and spiritual dynamics to a songwriting style that is rooted in a strong folk story-telling tradition, creating a distinct sound that could perhaps be described as bluesy folk.  

Of his previous work as a singer-songwriter, one of Patrick's most notable songs is written in the form of a would-be letter by a soldier in the battle field, narrating the events that lead up to him losing his life.  Another tells the story of a satellite that was lost in space, never to be retrieved. Regardless of the subject and device he uses to tell his stories, the songs always trace their way back to age-old themes of figuring out relationship complications in this modern world.  

The duo is currently working on an album of original songs by Sad, interpreted in Bethlehem's silky voice and old-blues improvisational style.  

Behind the scenes we have a fairy-like wordsmith who prefers to remain anonymous at the moment and pilfer shiny objects, a local young producer in need of resources to compete in a field that gets packed more and more everyday with people with access to expensive toys and gadgets, but with little to no inherent original voice or skill.  Finally, we have a musical magic-maker and student of the stars, whose buried treasure of songs, nearly ten years in the making, is so good, that we need to veil the entire project in secrecy.  His songs need some dusting off before he pulls away the curtains and makes them re-appear.  And there are more.  And there will be more.  


A Healing Album for Broken Men

My next album project is a healing journey that will be released in two or more parts.  The first part or parts will be a collection of songs that reveals the trials and stories of an imaginary character that built around the stereotype of the twenty-first century young male fan of the writer Charles Bukowski.  

The project is not a biographical sketch of Bukowski himself, nor an academic critique of his work, but an exploration of the life of the writer as a compass that the fictional character uses to guide his life and embody the glorified aspects of the famous writer, from the romanticized early life as starving artist, poet and working-class hero toiling in obscurity, to the reluctant fame, the women, the translations of work into multiple languages, the celebrity affiliations, that fantasy of the introspective would-be writer boy and main character.  In the fringes of the academia, in the midst of social anxiety and self-taught bookishness, he attempts to enter Bukowski's body of work as a lifestyle as a form of escapism from the mundane--his otherwise relatively well-balanced suburban life, the ho-hum drum of his stereotypically too-good parents, and the success with women he would actually have if it weren't for his insistence on acting the part of the real-life troubled writer, from top to bottom.  

Generally, he leads a failed life, not due to lack of resources or support, but to lack of following his own purpose and desiring the purpose and ritual of a man who did not choose his pain--Bukowski who was plagued with childhood trauma, disfigurement and pain, who, in the words of Borges, did make something "eternal from the miserable circumstances" of his life.  It is the privileged man who wants to drink coffee made from the feces of little rodents and make it a delicacy after his family has stolen the coffee fields and forced the original inhabitants to search in the waste of animals who may have ingested some of what they used to enjoy freely before being forced to work for another's profit, developing an archetype, the "boy who likes Bukowski.  Misery and trauma are desirable and highly sought after, like the feces coffee, when in reality, anyone who is born into unfavorable circumstance knows, as the native people who created the coffee that is now a delicacy to those tormented by the mundane-ness of their privilege, the coffee has an origin based on survival needs and is not a beautifully wrought thing.  

The project further seeks to explore the great question of the last few centuries of patriarchal rule, "what is wrong with men?"  But also, probes at related questions, such as, "what is wrong with women?"  in a series of podcast interviews with musicians, artists, men and women of various occupations.   Conflicts between men and women, families, trauma, societal definitions of success, life purpose, addiction, scandal, women of the night, late bloomers, early bloomers, class warfare, childhood nostalgia, dreams, and stereotypes are some of the topics that have already arisen in conversation, song and text.

I'll also seek to find and interview religious leaders and those in the healing arts, from different tradition.  This will involve some travel that will include the recording of the second part of the album--the healing component.  Healing traditions from around the world will be surveyed and consulted to create an actual album of healing music, perhaps an exploration of meditations and trance-work.  So, the album is in two parts because the aim is not just to explore the brokenness and expose the nature of the disease that plagues the character, but to find concrete ways of healing the failures of his life and moving on to some decent progression of his soul, as a member of society and this great universe, to search for pain when none is there, there is no greater disease seen in modern man.  The point is to transcend the topic of why men this or why women that and go back to a conversation about the sources of creative inspiration, transcendence through art, and for each artist that has sort of lost "his way," to at least attempt to begin to honor their own pain, not the painful abusive childhood of Bukowski's, not the blindness of Borges, not the physical pain of Frida.  

But if it's a genuine grit of another red light district night, not so much by choice but by the loneliness of a withdrawn and pathological curiosity that calls a being back to the typewriter, to throw poems at walls while drinking straight from a bottle, like those who scream in pain through broken bones and throw fits when others, perhaps, better "trained" or more "successful" artists make light metaphors about finding God through hardship, maybe there really is a light that endures after blindness, but only the seer would know.  Yes, Nietzche said suffering produces great works, but do we look for suffering?  Do we idealize the lives of those less fortunate simply because we can?  We are only witnesses, but we also each have our own story.  It's time we stop dreaming we are other people, or other people's art.  It's time we stop pretending we have the calling of others, honor our own experiences and find the real source of our own artistic inspiration, what Andalusian flamenco culture has historically referred as our duende, our own "troublemaker," "imp" or "lord of the house"--the house being our own bodies, as vehicles for movement and productivity. 



So far, I've done much of what I've been calling "live research," taking on some of the habits of the lifestyle of the broken writer and blogging and writing from that place.  A lot of this material has been recorded on the public blog, but also, I have been keeping a private blog, journals and notes that will be part of the larger work to be released with the album.  Podcast interviews have also taken place already, but there needs to be a professional hand that assists with the editing and presentation, thus another need for funding.  


This Luscious Earth

"Hello, Old Friend, it's good to see you, your smile still lights up my face.  I'm so glad that you're not lonely, your heart has found a place."  -Dylan Jane, "Finders Keepers"

With the physical release of WHIM, my goal was to release music in the most environmentally-conscious way possible, limiting paperwork, working digitally and releasing the album in a way that was as "carbon neutral" as possible.  The company chosen to create the product was relatively local, and I chose recycled materials, which most most mass production disc warehouses offer today, but at more expensive rates.  Offsets were purchased to compensate for any other damage that shipping and manufacturing may have created.  

We'd like to re-think the idea of a physical release, working with certain tangible limitations, but with the goal of keeping the entire thing as people/community and sustainable as possible for larger projects as well, even if its an additional cost to the budget of a release but thinking in the long-term, as far as what the impact will be as a whole.  No unnecessary labor and the least amount of packaging that will sit in landfills or be shipped overseas using precious oil to be sorted in foreign recycling centers once tossed into our blue bins.  We are still conceptualizing this and need time, legal assistance and intellectual resources to complete the plan.  

We're learning from pioneers here in the Mount Airy neighborhood of Philadelphia and starting on the right foot as  "green"  to support the troubador and the trobairitz in their travels of spreading good cheer through music.  We hope to make these resources more readily available to our artists who may not have the financial means to go fully "green" on their own.  

We also plan on donating a portion of the funds to a local charity that provides instruments to low-income students and music instruction resources to schools in need.  The need that has been expressed is that lots of instruments are donated on a an annual basis, but many of these instruments are donated in disrepair and are not playable.  We plan on separating a portion of the funds to provide actual currency needed to repair the instruments and bridge the gap of need.  

 




REPOST, RECYCLE, SHARE

and in the words of indiegogo:

"...and that’s all there is to it."
story_txt:
Bonjour! We would like to gather some funds to help with expenses of establishing our humble label as an official entity!A musical fairytale... Once Upon a Fruit Tart

Fruit Tart started as the faux-label name of my singer/songwriter persona, Rosa Diaz.  A fruit tart was the most beautiful scrumptious gift that a friend brought to my place once, when she came over to practice.  Because where there is music, there are always yummy treats.  At least, at my place.  I am currently blog content and material for a follow up to my 2012 release, WHIM. The album will be called For Boys Who Like Bukowski: A Healing Album for Broken Men.  I am still visioning the project and updates of research and documented ideas can be traced on the blog.  Somewhere in Occitania...The traveling musician archetype of the 
troubadour (and his female counterpart, the troibaritz) is our 
inspiration!  The artistic spirit of the High Middle Ages--romance 
languages, lyric poetry, multi-stringed instruments, chivalry and 
courtly love remain the main inspiration of the many a modern 
singer-songwriter and we seek not to differentiate between the high 
nobility, those of petty noble lineage, the merchants, tradesmen and the
 poor fisherman (or woman.)  The loose association and freedom that artists will have with Fruit Tart Records also calls upon this muse.  We are planning to set ourselves up to be some combination of creative group, collaborative, collective, co-operative and association.  We'll have to sit with a few legal experts and community organizations who have trudged through that mud before us before we can actually obtain a worthy legal standing that all artists in the troupe are happy with.  What Fruit Tart aims to be is a place to rest our heads, a place to "hold court" and solidify already existing collaborations and friendships among the community of creatives, a flag we can wear proudly, something to push our individual efforts forward maintaining as much freedom as possible while at the same time nurturing the artistic community ethic that has aided us in growing our gifts.  Introducing our Creative Types!We've gathered a beautiful community of artists and creatives who would like to "hold court" here at Fruit Tart and affiliate with us. Lounging and strumming her lute at the other end of the castle courtyard is Dylan Jane.  Her troupe of sometimes-y on again off again travel buddies is known quite accurately as "The Turning Leaves."  When she is not making bright sound with the band, or breathing a gutsy melancholy solo, she is hidden in a corner, or under a tree, writing a rhyme of courtly love, another ballad for a lost or would be mortal made god by her ink and blood, something the fortune teller somehow missed.  In the fall of 2013, Dylan Jane completed her first U.S. tour.  Bethlehem and the songwriter that goes by the name of "Sad" Patrick met at an open mic that Sad started in a local coffee shop in the Northwest Philadelphia neighborhood they both share.  Bethlehem quickly became the main event of the evening, drawing neighbors, friends and strangers alike with her earthy, honest voice.  With the voice of a diva, but always approachable and amicable, Bethlehem won the hearts of the regulars.
In her solo work, Bethlehem has been described as "Germantown's next rising star" by WHYY/NewsWorks Philadelphia and is primarily an acapella artist who combines her original sonic creations with vocalized rhythms as well as claps and stomps in a performance art style atop a custom-made tarima that has her name engraved in it in Hebrew letters.  Her first solo release, Bigger Than Music, was released in November of 2012.  She also works with some notable acts as a jazz singer, including the Philadelphia Jazz Project with whom she performed with at TEDxPhiladelphia in 2014.  Bethlehem brings her own color palette to Patrick's songwriting.  With her voice, she interprets the songs, combining jazz-inspired scats and spiritual dynamics to a songwriting style that is rooted in a strong folk story-telling tradition, creating a distinct sound that could perhaps be described as bluesy folk.  Of his previous work as a singer-songwriter, one of Patrick's most notable songs is written in the form of a would-be letter by a soldier in the battle field, narrating the events that lead up to him losing his life.  Another tells the story of a satellite that was lost in space, never to be retrieved. Regardless of the subject and device he uses to tell his stories, the songs always trace their way back to age-old themes of figuring out relationship complications in this modern world.  The duo is currently working on an album of original songs by Sad, interpreted in Bethlehem's silky voice and old-blues improvisational style.  Behind the scenes we have a fairy-like wordsmith who prefers to remain anonymous at the moment and pilfer shiny objects, a local young producer in need of resources to compete in a field that gets packed more and more everyday with people with access to expensive toys and gadgets, but with little to no inherent original voice or skill.  Finally, we have a musical magic-maker and student of the stars, whose buried treasure of songs, nearly ten years in the making, is so good, that we need to veil the entire project in secrecy.  His songs need some dusting off before he pulls away the curtains and makes them re-appear.  And there are more.  And there will be more.  A Healing Album for Broken MenMy next album project is a healing journey that will be released in two or more parts.  The first part or parts will be a collection of songs that reveals the trials and stories of an imaginary character that built around the stereotype of the twenty-first century young male fan of the writer Charles Bukowski.  The project is not a biographical sketch of Bukowski himself, nor an academic critique of his work, but an exploration of the life of the writer as a compass that the fictional character uses to guide his life and embody the glorified aspects of the famous writer, from the romanticized early life as starving artist, poet and working-class hero toiling in obscurity, to the reluctant fame, the women, the translations of work into multiple languages, the celebrity affiliations, that fantasy of the introspective would-be writer boy and main character.  In the fringes of the academia, in the midst of social anxiety and self-taught bookishness, he attempts to enter Bukowski's body of work as a lifestyle as a form of escapism from the mundane--his otherwise relatively well-balanced suburban life, the ho-hum drum of his stereotypically too-good parents, and the success with women he would actually have if it weren't for his insistence on acting the part of the real-life troubled writer, from top to bottom.  Generally, he leads a failed life, not due to lack of resources or support, but to lack of following his own purpose and desiring the purpose and ritual of a man who did not choose his pain--Bukowski who was plagued with childhood trauma, disfigurement and pain, who, in the words of Borges, did make something "eternal from the miserable circumstances" of his life.  It is the privileged man who wants to drink coffee made from the feces of little rodents and make it a delicacy after his family has stolen the coffee fields and forced the original inhabitants to search in the waste of animals who may have ingested some of what they used to enjoy freely before being forced to work for another's profit, developing an archetype, the "boy who likes Bukowski.  Misery and trauma are desirable and highly sought after, like the feces coffee, when in reality, anyone who is born into unfavorable circumstance knows, as the native people who created the coffee that is now a delicacy to those tormented by the mundane-ness of their privilege, the coffee has an origin based on survival needs and is not a beautifully wrought thing.  The project further seeks to explore the great question of the last few centuries of patriarchal rule, "what is wrong with men?"  But also, probes at related questions, such as, "what is wrong with women?"  in a series of podcast interviews with musicians, artists, men and women of various occupations.   Conflicts between men and women, families, trauma, societal definitions of success, life purpose, addiction, scandal, women of the night, late bloomers, early bloomers, class warfare, childhood nostalgia, dreams, and stereotypes are some of the topics that have already arisen in conversation, song and text.I'll also seek to find and interview religious leaders and those in the healing arts, from different tradition.  This will involve some travel that will include the recording of the second part of the album--the healing component.  Healing traditions from around the world will be surveyed and consulted to create an actual album of healing music, perhaps an exploration of meditations and trance-work.  So, the album is in two parts because the aim is not just to explore the brokenness and expose the nature of the disease that plagues the character, but to find concrete ways of healing the failures of his life and moving on to some decent progression of his soul, as a member of society and this great universe, to search for pain when none is there, there is no greater disease seen in modern man.  The point is to transcend the topic of why men this or why women that and go back to a conversation about the sources of creative inspiration, transcendence through art, and for each artist that has sort of lost "his way," to at least attempt to begin to honor their own pain, not the painful abusive childhood of Bukowski's, not the blindness of Borges, not the physical pain of Frida.  But if it's a genuine grit of another red light district night, not so much by choice but by the loneliness of a withdrawn and pathological curiosity that calls a being back to the typewriter, to throw poems at walls while drinking straight from a bottle, like those who scream in pain through broken bones and throw fits when others, perhaps, better "trained" or more "successful" artists make light metaphors about finding God through hardship, maybe there really is a light that endures after blindness, but only the seer would know.  Yes, Nietzche said suffering produces great works, but do we look for suffering?  Do we idealize the lives of those less fortunate simply because we can?  We are only witnesses, but we also each have our own story.  It's time we stop dreaming we are other people, or other people's art.  It's time we stop pretending we have the calling of others, honor our own experiences and find the real source of our own artistic inspiration, what Andalusian flamenco culture has historically referred as our duende, our own "troublemaker," "imp" or "lord of the house"--the house being our own bodies, as vehicles for movement and productivity. So far, I've done much of what I've been calling "live research," taking on some of the habits of the lifestyle of the broken writer and blogging and writing from that place.  A lot of this material has been recorded on the public blog, but also, I have been keeping a private blog, journals and notes that will be part of the larger work to be released with the album.  Podcast interviews have also taken place already, but there needs to be a professional hand that assists with the editing and presentation, thus another need for funding.  This Luscious Earth"Hello, Old Friend, it's good to see you, your smile still lights up my face.  I'm so glad that you're not lonely, your heart has found a place."  -Dylan Jane, "Finders Keepers"With the physical release of WHIM, my goal was to release music in the most environmentally-conscious way possible, limiting paperwork, working digitally and releasing the album in a way that was as "carbon neutral" as possible.  The company chosen to create the product was relatively local, and I chose recycled materials, which most most mass production disc warehouses offer today, but at more expensive rates.  Offsets were purchased to compensate for any other damage that shipping and manufacturing may have created.  We'd like to re-think the idea of a physical release, working with certain tangible limitations, but with the goal of keeping the entire thing as people/community and sustainable as possible for larger projects as well, even if its an additional cost to the budget of a release but thinking in the long-term, as far as what the impact will be as a whole.  No unnecessary labor and the least amount of packaging that will sit in landfills or be shipped overseas using precious oil to be sorted in foreign recycling centers once tossed into our blue bins.  We are still conceptualizing this and need time, legal assistance and intellectual resources to complete the plan.  We're learning from pioneers here in the Mount Airy neighborhood of Philadelphia and starting on the right foot as  "green"  to support the troubador and the trobairitz in their travels of spreading good cheer through music.  We hope to make these resources more readily available to our artists who may not have the financial means to go fully "green" on their own.  We also plan on donating a portion of the funds to a local charity that provides instruments to low-income students and music instruction resources to schools in need.  The need that has been expressed is that lots of instruments are donated on a an annual basis, but many of these instruments are donated in disrepair and are not playable.  We plan on separating a portion of the funds to provide actual currency needed to repair the instruments and bridge the gap of need.   
REPOST, RECYCLE, SHARE

story:
I write this important message with permission from her brother, Maurice. We need your help to bring our Tanya home and give her the proper homecoming she deserves.

 

We are raising money for her funeral, and I ask all of you if you can please donate money towards her burial expenses.  The goal is to raise $5,000, but we pray for additional money(s) to cover all funeral expenses, which we expect to cost at least $10,000.   Please donate $100, $50, $20, or what you can afford; no donation is too small.

 

I am a licensed attorney with the State of New York, so you have my word that all money(s) raised will pay for all of her funeral and related expenses.  Please help Maurice bring our friend Tanya home (both parents are deceased).  Spread the word and share this message with anyone and everyone.

story:
My Story

My name is Joanette, I have a bachelor’s degree in Business administration I’m originally from Boston, MA but now I reside in the south. I couldn’t take the cold anymore so I packed up and headed south. My parents were born and raised in Camp Hill, Alabama and that’s where I used to spend my summer vacation when school was out. The town is a very friendly atmosphere and you get a lot of hellos when you’re walking or driving down the street. I chose to open a business in this area because there aren’t many places to go for food or entertainment and I just want to bring some life back to the town. This will be only restaurant and lounge located in the downtown area. My business is called Joanie’s restaurant and lounge, located in camp hill, Alabama. My goal is to create jobs locally and promote more minority women owned businesses in the area. I want to encourage more businesses to relocate to our town, to stimulate growth in the community. I’ve owned this building for many years and I’ve been renovating it by using my own funds and my paycheck that I get every other week & my family has pitched in to help also.  Due to the overall economy turmoil, I’ve run out of money and extra financial support from family members. I’m currently seeking any type of financial assistance to start the final phase of my renovation process.

What we need

I’m asking for $30,000 so I can get started with the windows, plumbing, HVAC and electrical work. Our cuisine is American food. I want to bring some of my savory northern dishes to the south. Cooking is my passion and I enjoy entertaining people. This will be the first dine in restaurant in this area in about 30years. You have to travel 15-20 miles to find some type of entertainment, restaurant, bar or music. I want to offer convenience to the people of Camp Hill.

$16,785 - Heating & Air

$3,500 - Electrical

$7,000 Plumbing

$2,500 Windows

The Impact

By donating the required funds of $30,000, this will be a HUGE help with starting the most costly part of my project. I own my building and I’ve taken this journey as far as I can. I’ve exhausted my personal savings to get to this point and anything extra I have left over from my paycheck, I contribute to my future restaurant. I have many pictures in my gallery for everyone to see the progress I’ve made thus far. I’m always working on my building with my team so I’ll have much more to show you soon. This campaign is dear to my heart because I don’t just want to have a business I want to be able to create a few jobs locally. I’m usually at my business location on the weekends so feel free to stop in ask questions or lend a hand. 147 South Main St. Camp Hill, Alabama. THANK YOU!

Other ways you can HELP!

You can also donate any building supplies such as flooring- any type, laminate, wood or ceramic tile, toilets, sinks, ceiling tile, windows, light fixtures, swing doors or front glass double doors. Any restaurants or Bars that are retiring from the business that want to donate any type of bar equipment, margarita machines, furniture, pot s & pans, fryers, stove, cooler, steam tables, flat griddle, electric- POS machines, security cameras, anything ! I’m very appreciative to any help or advice that I can get. My business address is 147 South Main St. Camp Hill, AL 36850. Formerly Winter’s Grocery. THANK YOU!!

story:
Short Summary

Our dear friend Rocky Gonzales passed away on April 1st, 2012 due to a tragic accident here in Tokyo , Japan. Rocky touched so many people in his short life and had the biggest smile and biggest heart of anyone I have ever known. 

What We Need

Being in a foreign country, the costs of shipping Rocky back to California are extremely expensive. Help us fund these costs as well as the costs involved in the funeral process. 

Rocky leaves behind a loving girlfriend, thousands of friends and a family. We will all miss him more than we can ever imagine.

For those of us here in Tokyo, due to Japanese law, we are still unsure whether we will get the chance to say goodbye to Rocky. Having a beatiful funeral and grave will give us the opportunity to have a place to say our goodbyes to him.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are asking everyone to dig into their pockets and give generously. However, not only do donations help, but just a matter of spreading the word.

story:
Short Summary

The “Underserved and Gifted” movement was created to maintain and advance the San Jose based Youth Digital Arts programs located at 3 locations: the Seven Trees and Alma community centers, and the city’s Parks, Recreation and Neighborhood Services (PRNS).

Established in 2011, at the Seven Trees community center, the programs provide youth access to professional audio recording, production equipment and software, and the guidance from experienced staff and industry professionals to fully utilize such resources. 

These programs act as a space for youth to incubate their talents and skills, allowing them advantages usually only afforded to financially burgeoning communities. And the program has worked, with students receiving national and international recognition, receiving praise from the industry, and fostering an interest in further education. 

Much in part to the programs' success, these opportunities have been expanded to Roosevelt Community Center (Digital Arts Troupe Academy - D.A.T.A.) and the Alma Community Center (Alma Music Studio). 

This is not only important for the growth of San Jose, but pivotal to the development of the youths’ talent and community contributions. 

"Providing San Jose youth an outlet to freely express themselves through digital arts is an opportunity we are proud to support," said Julie Edmonds-Mares, Director of the Department of PRNS.  "The fundraiser connects the thriving and growing talents of young adults with stakeholders and supporters who can help ensure that these opportunities remain available." 

What We Need 

In 2010, these programs became threatened, as San Jose's youth programs took a 50% cut in operational hours, leading us to our plea for support.  

We have, finally, attained the state of the art equipment for our community centers, but we still do not have the financial means to hire the professionals required to maintain and evolve these programs. 

In order for the facilities to be harnessed to their maximum potential, we need experienced specialists that possess the charisma and capacity to educate and inspire youth. 

After an arduous process of combing the community for experienced talent, we have found these media mentors, but this is only half the battle. The program coupled with these experts necessitate operational hours to properly run the studios, foster the youth, and expand the reach of the program. 

The Impact 

It's simple: more operational hours equals more students working under the guidance of media mentors to complete projects that inspire them to pursue post-secondary education or professional careers in digital media making.

In the last three years, our media mentors have mentored over 600 youth in the wider San Jose area.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations no matter big or small helps us towards our goal! If you are unable to contribute, a simple like, comment, or sharing our video would be deeply appreciated. Also, if you would like to invite our media mentors or students to perform at your next event or as guest speakers at your organization--we would love to share the message and movement in person!

Presented by Youth Connections of San Jose and hosted by PRNS Roosevelt Community Center and Seven Trees Community Center, the benefit will provide much needed support to the nationally recognized digital art programs and, of course, San Jose teens and young adults. Ultimately, this is about the youth. 

Please support our cause by sharing the "Underserved and Gifted" movement with family and friends. Thank you for your contribution. 


This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Alum Rock Youth Center Advisory Committee, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.

story:
Welcome To Plug-N-Post 



Security and Reliability


Are You Wondering Why You Should Use A Paid Email Service?

It is a fact that companies like Google and Microsoft offer free email services. So why then use a paid email service?

First of all: Plugnpost is a first class, professional email and web hosting service. We offer state of the art solutions and are dedicated to providing powerful and user-friendly email services.

Second: The Plugnpost Email Service is absolutely ad-free, while for instance Gmail analyzes all messages looking for hooks so that they can show related ads in your web browser. The Plugnpost Email Service is entirely neutral and clean, while Google puts more and more effort into tuning their ad offerings. That is how they make money.

Third: Plugnpost is regulated by a strong privacy legislation that protects your data, and we enforce a strict Privacy policy.

Fourth: Plugnpost will never use the contents of your messages or other data in any other context such as some email providers do. Gmail, for instance, state in their Terms of Service that they reserve the right to use, reproduce, and publish any content you send through their services.

And finally: Plugnpost will give  you personal support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, all year long.

Today It is impossible to get a mail id of your choice. We have to settle for something like namennnn@gmail.com or nameabcd@yahoo.com only

That is exactly why we have plugnplay.com - to provide fresh choice to the millions of youngsters who will be entering into the email world.

plugnpost.com is aimed not merely an email service it will be an integrated service of mail,chat, cloud store, calendar, document share and many more.

What We Need & What You Get

The Financial Angle 

Plugnpost.,com will require a funding of USD 100,000.00 to establish and run. The above sum includes the cost for servers, mailing software,  Groupware tools and development of front end web- site.

All contributors will get one year subscription to the plugnpost.com mail box.

In case this campaign does not raise the goal amount, I will still try to bring up a scaled down version of plugnpost.com which will be upgraded after generating sufficient revenues.

The Impact

Your help and contribution will help me bring in an affordable email to everyone

Ok, you can’t contribute 

You can still help me 

 Please get the word out and please spread this to your friends who may have some  interest in this venture.

Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you
story_txt:
Welcome To Plug-N-Post Security and Reliability
Are You Wondering Why You Should Use A Paid Email Service?
It is a fact that companies like Google and Microsoft offer free email services. So why then use a paid email service?First of all: Plugnpost is a first class, professional email and web hosting service. We offer state of the art solutions and are dedicated to providing powerful and user-friendly email services.Second: The Plugnpost Email Service is absolutely ad-free, while for instance Gmail analyzes all messages looking for hooks so that they can show related ads in your web browser. The Plugnpost Email Service is entirely neutral and clean, while Google puts more and more effort into tuning their ad offerings. That is how they make money.Third: Plugnpost is regulated by a strong privacy legislation that protects your data, and we enforce a strict Privacy policy.Fourth: Plugnpost will never use the contents of your messages or other data in any other context such as some email providers do. Gmail, for instance, state in their Terms of Service that they reserve the right to use, reproduce, and publish any content you send through their services.And finally: Plugnpost will give  you personal support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, all year long.Today It is impossible to get a mail id of your choice. We have to settle for something like namennnn@gmail.com or nameabcd@yahoo.com onlyThat is exactly why we have plugnplay.com - to provide fresh choice to the millions of youngsters who will be entering into the email world.plugnpost.com is aimed not merely an email service it will be an integrated service of mail,chat, cloud store, calendar, document share and many more.What We Need & What You GetThe Financial Angle Plugnpost.,com will require a funding of USD 100,000.00 to establish and run. The above sum includes the cost for servers, mailing software,  Groupware tools and development of front end web- site.All contributors will get one year subscription to the plugnpost.com mail box.In case this campaign does not raise the goal amount, I will still try to bring up a scaled down version of plugnpost.com which will be upgraded after generating sufficient revenues.

story:
Join the Free the Weed Movement!

We are Kush Liberty: A group of individuals in Tampa, FL who are passionate about Cannabis and its legalization for medical and industrial uses.  Marijuana and hemp production benefits the sick and elderly, the economy & the environment and is less harmful than alcohol and pharmaceutical drugs.  Its legalization will also keep nearly 60,000 people out of Florida's prison system. 

Our Mission:  Arm you with the tools and resources you need to be an active member in the free the weed movement.  We want you to spark conversations with peers about Marijuana and its many benefits and to prove once and for all that marijuana belongs in the hands of the people, not the government. 

We are campaigning for funds to develop an online community of Marijuana Freedom Fighters.  Our online community will provide a safe environment for users to communicate publicly or privately and to organize meet-ups and rallies. In addition, we are developing an Android/Apple app that will provide updated stats and information about the legalization of marijuana. The app will arm individuals for heated discussions with family, friends, and peers.  These tools will enable our community to be effective advocates who will work to spark the vote in Florida and beyond.  

We need your contribution to help us develop and market these online and mobile tools to help us spread the word on the importance of marijuana's legalization.  The medical marijuana industry is estimated to bring $600 million in annual sales if Amendment 2 passes in Florida and 450,000 people with chronic illnesses will be helped. 

We Need Funds for:

  • Mobile App Development & Maintenance  (Android/Apple)
  • Online Community Development & Maintenance
  • Press, Promotions, and Social Media Marketing
  • Merchandise
  • Posters, Flyers, Brochures & Decals 
  • Hosting for the App, Website & Online Community


The Impact

Your contribution will have a tremendous impact on the following:

  • Florida residents: Florida will benefit from decreases in crime and increases in tax revenue & private enterprise similar to Colorado, the first state to provide the sale of recreational marijuana. Since Jan. 1, crime in Denver is down while the state's tax revenue has increased nearly $18 M and retailers have generated sales of about $70 M. 

  • Florida's sick and elderly: An estimated 450,000 Floridians will qualify for medical marijuana. Marijuana has been proven to help those with Alzheimer's Disease, Anxiety/Stress/Depression, Cancer, Chronic Pain, Diabetes, Epilepsy, Fibromyalgia, GI Disorders, Glaucoma, Hepatitis C, HIV, Hypertension, Incontinence, Injuries, MS, Osteoporosis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Sleep Apnea and Tourette's Syndrome

  • Florida's patients and doctors: Unfortunately, the most recently passed FL bill approving high-CBD medical marijuana (the 'Charlotte's Web' strain) only helps a small percentage of the patients who would benefit from medical marijuana.  In addition, it places heavy burdens on physicians who wish to recommend it to their patients, arguably forcing them to violate federal laws in order to do so. There is not an ID card requirement, however, in order to be protected from criminal laws, a qualifying patient must be added to the “compassionate use registry” maintained by the Department of Health. The physician must be the individual who then “orders” the low-THC marijuana from 1 of the 5 registered manufacturers for the patient. Doing so would violate federal law. Because physicians need a federal DEA license to prescribe medicines, they are very unlikely to openly break federal law, meaning the law is almost surely unworkable.

  • Popular opinion: Currently, 58% of Americans support marijuana legalization and more than 80% of Floridians support medical marijuana.

  • Florida's justice system: Legalized marijuana will keep 60,000 non-violent offenders out of the court system and out of jail, enabling tax dollars to be spent placing the right people behind bars.

  • Federal law: Despite a long medical history and countless studies on the benefits of cannabis, the Federal Government still classifies it as a Schedule 1 drug despite the fact that it has a US patent on its antioxident and neuroprotectant properties. This means that in the eyes of the Federal Government, marijuana has no currently accepted medical use, is the most dangerous of all the drug schedules with potentially severe psychological or physical dependence, and is included in the same class as heroin, LSD, ecstasy, methaqualone, and peyote.

  • The environment: If hemp production increases, it will have a huge impact on the planet.  Hemp fiber is the longest, strongest and most durable of all natural fibers. Hemp cultivation requires no chemicals, pesticides or herbicides and is completely sustainable. Hemp produces 4 times the fiber per acre as pine trees. Hemp tree-free paper can be recycled up to 7 times, compared with 3 times for pine-pulp based papers. Hemp is easy to grow and actually conditions soil where it grows.  Hemp would be an ideal source of biomass for fuel and hemp Ethanol burns very cleanly.

     

The Plan

If we reach our goal of $30,000, we will be able to achieve the following in this order:

1. Send the perks to each of our contributors! (30 days after close of campaign)

2. Develop the online community of Marijuana Freedom Fighters (to launch within 45 days)

3. Develop the mobile app (to be available on Apple/Android stores within 60 days)

4. Merchandising, Press, Promotions and Social Media (throughout the 90 days after close of campaign)

5. Hold our launch party to celebrate and announce our new mobile and online communities! 

If we exceed our goal of $30,000, we will use the money for additional marketing and awareness of our offerings and the need for legalization. 

This is our first Indiegogo campaign but we are affiliated with a marketing & design firm and have experience with merchandising, press, promotions and social media.  We are excited to invest our time and talents for such a worthwhile cause.  Now we just need your small financial contribution!

Free the weed!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can:

  • Promote this campaign via social media @kushliberty or email
  • Get loud and buy official Kush Liberty gear!
  • Pledge to vote 'Yes on 2' on our website
  • Sign up on our waiting list to become a Marijuana Freedom Fighter
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to promote our campaign!

story:
The book is now complete!


To purchase additional copies, visit our storefront on Blurb.

For updates and future projects, follow @relicsofamericana on Instagram, and like 'Relics of Americana' on Facebook.

Thank you, thank you, thank you everyone for your support!

--------------------------------------------------------------

US Route 301 Roadtrip to photograph the decay of classic Americana roadside attractions in rural Georgia, South Carolina, and Florida.  Then, we'll publish the images in a photo book!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STRETCH GOAL: $4,000! Folks like you have gotten us this far! **ALL CONTRIBUTIONS BETWEEN NOW AND FRIDAY NIGHT WILL RECEIVE A COMPLETELY ONE-OF-A-KIND, HARD COPY 4x4 PRINT FROM THE TRIP!  More $$ means a higher quality final product, which includes:

-- Higher-quality premium paper

-- More physical pages

-- Possibility of extended adventures into North Carolina and Virginia

   

  

(Route 301 Postcards, courtesy William Bird; Full Collection)


Who We Are

  • Hey! Let me tell you a bit more about me - I'm Evan, a professional actor with a passion for photography (you can see some of my work below).  Raised in North Carolina, I'm a southern dude currently based in New York, and earned a minor in photography during my college years. This trip, I'll be shooting on a Canon 5D.  
  • Joining me is my buddy Brian! He's from California, and will be navigating, photo-assisting, and is a seasoned road-tripper. He's driven Route 66 in nearly its entirety, spent time traveling the whole coast and central valley of California, and is pretty much the most even-keeled person you'll ever meet. He's also an actor AND a helluva of a singer, so don't be surprised if we send out a musical thank you video or two (or three)!

Where We're Going

  • South. Specifically, to South Carolina, Georgia (and a tiny bit of North Florida) to photograph remnants of what was once an important part of the American sensibility: the great American road trip.



Why U.S. 301 is Special

  • From the 1940s to the 1960s, U.S. Route 301 was the East Coast's roadtrip escape route - a gateway to Florida: the promised land of family resorts, beaches, fun & sun. Nicknamed the "Tobacco Trail," tiny towns near U.S. 301 in South Carolina and Georgia thrived off the tourism for years. 
  • BUT, in the early 1960s, the national interstate system was built and took with it the streams of tourists.These small towns were choked off and now, sixty years on, the once-filled diners, drive-ins, motels, and kitschy roadside attractions sit vacant, falling apart and disappearing into the past.

Why a Photo Book & Why Now Is the Time

  • Inspired by Robert Frank's The Americans and the vibrant motel postcard artwork of the same time period, I want to capture the shift in identity this stretch of U.S. 301 has experienced over the last 50 years. Every state has industries left in the dust, but the stark contrast between past and present on U.S. 301 is a story that desperately needs to be shared. The roadside landmarks standing today are in various stages of decay, and with proper historical information, this photo book will provide a chance for reflection on the ever-shifting traditions of travel and tourism in America.  

  • We need to capture these roadside relics while they still exist.  With each passing year, weather, new development, and natural overgrowth endanger these structures. As we near the 50th anniversary of I-95’s first segments opening in the region, there’s no better time than now to document these special landmarks before they’re gone for good.


What We Need & What You Get

Let's break this down:

  • Our Goal: $3,495. This covers publishing costs (a majority of our budget), gas, rental car, minor equipment, and perks for you!  We're including travel and lodging costs - driving the stretch of U.S 301 in 2014 will add a unique layer to our experience and better inform the final product. By camping, paying for most food on our own, and staying with friends, we hope to keep those travel costs low. (Know someone in the area who'd like us to stay with them? Let us know here!)
  • Everyone loves a perk. We want to keep the photo book as accessible as possible, so a digital version is available at the $25 tier. The postcards will be purchased in towns along the way, and are sure to reflect the local flavor - we can't wait to share those gems with you!
  • Okay, let's put it all on the table: If we don't reach our goal, we will still make this trip, but may have to shorten the overall duration and skip some locations (Boo!). Regardless, our focus is on creating the highest-quality photo book in the end, no matter what!

Quality of Work to Expect


     

       

        

Risks & Challenges

Here are a few we think we should share with you:

  • What if the actual buildings are gone? The most important part of our trip along Route 301 is to capture the current state of as many buildings, structures, and signage as possible. This means photographing standing buildings, converted sites, fully-abandoned structures and more. Reaching out to local organizations and historians will play a part in our trip, and by matching the buildings we come across with historical information, we will be able to tell a story that is accurate and compelling.

  • Timeline for the book. We are set to have the book in hand by December 2014, and are self-publishing through resources at Blurb.com. Evan will be editing, designing the book and images leading up to the finished product.

  • Okay, so maybe not a "Risk," but worth mentioning: Brian's never been this far south before! Not a problem: I'll brief him on the proper use of "y'all," introduce him to staples like Bojangles, grits, Cheerwine, and an overall slower pace. After all, we won't be in New York anymore. Brian is an avid road-tripper, though, and has a lot of experience navigating across the country.

Questions (& Answers!)

  • How is my perspective different from other photographers? 

    My photography focuses on often overlooked, mundane objects.  These forgotten motels, drive-ins, and diners deserve a second look, and will be at home in my style of photography.

Still wanting to know more?  Email us here!

Other Ways You Can Help

No change to spare?  No worries - you can still help out :)

  • Share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Wordpress, Instagram - any of 'em! All of 'em!
  • Share Tunes! We'll be spending a lot of time in and around the car. We could use some of your favorite road trip songs! Email us here.
  • Send Good Vibes. Just think good, happy thoughts. Good for us, Good for you! Everyone wins!

story:
Short Summary

My son, Manny, and I moved to Denver, CO in 2012 so I could attend graduate school. After a long and arduous few years, we are ready to return to our home state of Ohio. 

Since Manny was only about a year old, I have been responsible for almost every aspect of raising him. The toll it's taken on me financially has been very heavy. We want to move to be close to our family, but we just need a little help!

We are obviously not above internet panhandling.

The toll it's taken on me financially has been very heavy. We want to move to be close to our family, but we just need a little help!We are obviously not above internet panhandling.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! I'm Yuliya, 19, I was born in Ukraine, but moved to the states when I was three. So I didn't get to have the full Ukraine experience, but only a part of it when I went to visit about four years back. Let me tell you, the poverty there in the small villages is incredibly horrible. You see children walking without shoes, with tears in their pants and shirts, and if they are lucky enough to have a shirt on you don't see their ribs because of the lack of food available. I am going to Moldova with a missionary group from my church this summer. Moldova is located between Romania and Ukraine, on the Black Sea. During this missionary trip we will be having three kids camps for four different villages. We have been doing car washes, bake sales, and other fundraising; but we still come up a little short financially. 

What We Need & What You Get

Every donation is a huge help whether it is two, five, or even 10 dollars. We need about five hundred to a thousand dollars. This money will go towards the camps in which we will be spreading the love of Jesus Christ, crafting, playing sports,playing Biblical games, singing with them, giving them clothing, and feeding them throughout the day. I am in charge of the crafts and am very excited for this missionary trip. It is such a blessing that I have been praying about for almost a year. I know God will help us and bless us with whatever He sees fit. The money will go directly to the children's needs. Whatever those might be (clothing, food, etc.) We will be very grateful for every donation that will be donated towards this campaign and I know that God will bless you. "..Whenever you did it for any of my people, no matter how unimportant they seemed, you did it for me." -Matthew 25:40

The Impact

Have you ever wanted to make a difference, but didn't know how? This is your opportunity. This missionary trip will change hundreds of children's hearts, minds, and attitude. This will change them from living in a dark gray world, to a life full of color and love that will stay in their hearts for a long time. Although this is my very first missionary trip, I am going with an experienced adult that has been on many and knows the outcomes of these trips. These children are lit with hope all over again, when they thought all hope was lost. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you come across this page and are not able to contribute, it's alright! Take the time and spread the word about this campaign, but most importantly keep us in your prayers. Prayers are more powerful than any amount of money. Thank you and may God Bless You! 

-Moldova Missionary Team (Summer 2014)
story_txt: Short SummaryHey everyone! I'm Yuliya, 19, I was born in Ukraine, but moved to the states when I was three. So I didn't get to have the full Ukraine experience, but only a part of it when I went to visit about four years back. Let me tell you, the poverty there in the small villages is incredibly horrible. You see children walking without shoes, with tears in their pants and shirts, and if they are lucky enough to have a shirt on you don't see their ribs because of the lack of food available. I am going to Moldova with a missionary group from my church this summer. Moldova is located between Romania and Ukraine, on the Black Sea. During this missionary trip we will be having three kids camps for four different villages. We have been doing car washes, bake sales, and other fundraising; but we still come up a little short financially. What We Need & What You GetEvery donation is a huge help whether it is two, five, or even 10 dollars. We need about five hundred to a thousand dollars. This money will go towards the camps in which we will be spreading the love of Jesus Christ, crafting, playing sports,playing Biblical games, singing with them, giving them clothing, and feeding them throughout the day. I am in charge of the crafts and am very excited for this missionary trip. It is such a blessing that I have been praying about for almost a year. I know God will help us and bless us with whatever He sees fit. The money will go directly to the children's needs. Whatever those might be (clothing, food, etc.) We will be very grateful for every donation that will be donated towards this campaign and I know that God will bless you. "..Whenever you did it for any of my people, no matter how unimportant they seemed, you did it for me." -Matthew 25:40The ImpactHave you ever wanted to make a difference, but didn't know how? This is your opportunity. This missionary trip will change hundreds of children's hearts, minds, and attitude. This will change them from living in a dark gray world, to a life full of color and love that will stay in their hearts for a long time. Although this is my very first missionary trip, I am going with an experienced adult that has been on many and knows the outcomes of these trips. These children are lit with hope all over again, when they thought all hope was lost. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you come across this page and are not able to contribute, it's alright! Take the time and spread the word about this campaign, but most importantly keep us in your prayers. Prayers are more powerful than any amount of money. Thank you and may God Bless You! -Moldova Missionary Team (Summer 2014)

story: Be a pal.
story_txt: Be a pal.

story:
Short Summary

We are Henry Peters and Jeff Davies and we have set up and developed the Winchcombe Burger Company.

It all started twelve months ago when some friends came around for a BBQ and were served burgers made in the kitchen at home. All of the friends liked them so much that they asked if they could buy some, and so the seeds of the Winchcombe Burger Company were sown.

Since then we have developed the concept in to a business which is very close to going live.

The ethos of the business is not only to provide the customers with a selection of burgers that they cannot buy elsewhere, but also to support local farmers, producers and businesses.

Therefore our range of burgers goes beyond the norm to include meats and flavours that  are not currently available, whilst having full traceability of where the meat has come from, how the animal has been treated, and how it will make the humble burger taste better.

As an example the beef we use comes from 28 day aged Longhorn Cattle which have grazed in the field which we can almost see from the window of our unit. We then take that meat and turn it in to a burger, not by using scraps of meat and fillers, but by mincing our own meats with our own mix of cuts to add texture, taste and flavour.

What also makes our burgers special is the range of meats and flavours, (all natural), that we use.

There is not sufficient space to detail all of our range but below is a sample to give you an idea of what we are offering;-

  • Beef and Chilli
  • Beef and Horseradish
  • Lamb and Mint
  • Moroccan Lamb
  • Pork and Chorizo
  • Pork, Apple, and Honey

Our full range and more detail on the business can be found on our website The Winchcombe Burger Company

In addition we will also be developing seasonal burgers, such as Turkey and Cranberry, to sell at appropriate times of year.

Obviously to make money we need to sell these burgers which we plan to do initially through farmers markets, food festivals and through our website (see link above) direct to customers, as well as through local farm shops and delicatessens and to pubs and restaurants both directly and through distribution channels, which we are currently in the process of agreeing terms with.

We have found a suitable unit to produce the burgers and have funding in place for the larger assets required such as a van, production and storage, and display equipment.

However having funded the large equipment we are running out of our own money to buy the smaller equipment and money to guarantee pitches at the markets.

We are therefore looking to raise funds through this source to allow us to buy the smaller items, which individually are reasonably priced but collectively amount to a larger sum of money.

The items we need to buy include;-

  • Kitchen Tables
  • Weighing Scales
  • Till
  • Labelling System
  • Gazebo
  • Induction Hob
  • Generator
  • Trailer
  • Lighting Gantry

We know this equipment list won't cost the full amount of money we are seeking, but there are other costs we need to incur to allow us to move the business forward, including

  • Pitch rental costs at festivals
  • Development of bespoke packaging
  • Marketing and advertising costs
  • Website development

By supporting and investing in us we be able to launch the business fully at the beginning of June and be up and running in time for the prime "burger season" over the summer months

What We Need & What You Get

It is easy as Directors of the company to get over excited and over use a well known "Only Fools and Horses" quote that "this time next year we will be millionaires".

Whilst that would be nice, the reality is that unless our numbers come up on the Lottery it is unlikely to happen, however we do believe that we have a sound business idea and that we have the passion and belief that it will work, and whilst not making us able to buy a Premiership football team it will allow us to earn a living.

However we can't do this without support and the money we are after will allow us to

  • buy the small equipment we need to furnish the unit as we need to
  • pay for the pitch rental fees for larger festivals where there is greater footfall and increased potential for higher sales
  • decorate and furnish the unit as we need to so that we are fully compliant with environmental health officer requirements
  • implement marketing strategies to establish the name of the business and to get it out to potential customers

As with all investors a return is required no matter how large or small the investment is. 

So what would you get if you were to invest in us?

Although we originally thought that a one off voucher to buy our burgers at a reduced rate sounded like a good idea, on reflection we felt that it would only be a transaction similar to any other voucher you can buy from various websites that bombard you with offers.

So we have thought about this differently and what we are after is investors who want to be our on-going customers and want to benefit from the development of our business as we ourselves develop.

To achieve this we have set up "The Well Hung Burger Club" membership of which will initially be exclusively only available to those that have invested in the company through this website and are therefore fanatical about burgers.

Member benefits will include:-

  • For every year that you are a member you will receive a voucher worth £15 to redeem against our products (which cannot be used in conjunction with any other offer or discount)
  • a 15% discount on all members orders (excl annual voucher and delivery)
  • Advance notice of which markets and festivals we will be showing at with specific promotional discounts only available to Club members
  • additional exclusive promotions through out the year and on launch of new products
  • VIP invites to burger tastings with opportunities to meet the farmers and producers
  • "Club Nights" in local pubs and restaurants where our burgers will be cooked and served at preferential rates
  • Opportunities to win free tickets to food festivals where we are selling
  • Regular newsletters with additional offers

The Impact

Your investment will primarily allow us both to sleep at night, or at least we will be kept awake worrying about more positive things, like how busy we are going to be the next day!!

Seriously any investment you can make in our business will allow us to hit the ground running.

We have already generated over 1,200 followers on Twitter, and that number is going up every day, there are customers out there waiting for us to launch.

We have already made contact with food festival organisers and farmers markets and they are keen for us to take a stall at markets and festivals both locally and around the country

We have already turned down a number of opportunities as we were not ready to provide the standards we demand of ourselves and we didn't want to compromise on them.

Your money and investment will help us to achieve our aims and ambitions for this company and we would like you to be a part of it, not just with your investment but as we move forward and develop and hopefully deliver our bigger plans over the next two to three years

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are still reading this, then thank you for taking the time to understand what the Winchcombe Burger Company is all about.

If this company is not for you then good luck and I hope you find a company you would like to invest in soon, however if you know someone who may be interested then please forward the link for this page to them so that they can read what we are all about and hopefully become a member of "The Well Hung Burger Club"
