story:
INTRODUCTION

Most people think that colon cancer is just an old man's disease, perhaps because medical guidelines recommend regular screening begin at the age of 50. But the truth is, this disease doesn't discriminate in age, gender or race.  In fact, there is a rising incidence trend in the Under 50 population.

Grace De La Rosa was 38 when she was diagnosed with Stage 3 Colon Cancer.  She had no family history of any type of cancer. She's a veteran  Navy pilot's wife, mother of two, who were 14 and 3 at the time. She was a swimwear  model, fitness instructor and fitness competitor. She worked out religiously and ate healthy foods. So Grace was shocked to hear the words, You Have Cancer.

She had surgery to remove the golf ball-sized tumor from her colon and received FOLFOX chemo treatments for 3 consecutive days, every other week, for six months.

Colorectal cancer is the second leading cause of cancer deaths in both men and women combined in the U.S. But it's also one of the most preventable and treatable cancers--if it's caught early.

Nobody likes to talk about colon cancer, because the symptoms associated with this disease can be embarrassing to discuss with anyone, including your doctor. But we're talking about a matter of life and death. Grace believes it's her responsibility as a survivor to share the symptoms she experienced so others can be empowered with this knowledge.

Her symptoms were all clear in hindsight. They included unexplained anemia (blood loss) after the birth of each of her children.  She was given iron pills and sent home.  She experienced fatigue to the point where she couldn't climb a flight of stairs without having to stop midway to catch her breath.

Grace also experienced abdominal cramps which she thought were menstrual-related. And she noticed a tiny speck of blood once when she wiped. She assumed it was a spotty menstrual cycle or hemorrhoids which she'd never experienced.

Just a few months prior to her diagnosis, Grace noticed when she passed gas the odor was abnormally foul, as if something was dying inside of her. She simply assumed it was something she ate.

If there's just one piece of advice Grace wants to instill in others, it's this: Don't brush off symptoms that aren't "normal" for you. Your doctor may be a medical expert, but you are the expert of your own body. Trust your gut. Be proactive in your health care. Know the symptoms of colon cancer. Go to your doctor, especially if you have a family history of colon cancer, and request a screening, even if you're under 50.

 

OUR PROJECT

This year marks Grace's 9th year as a colon cancer survivor. She created the Be a

campaign in support of National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month with a mission to educate the community about colon cancer and the importance of early detection, to give hope to newly diagnosed patients, and to save lives by spreading the word through:

  • Group Presentations. Grace is available to speak with your organization about colon cancer through a survivor's point of view.

  • Production of Colon Cancer Awareness Video. Grace teamed up with Enfocus Media, Inc., led by Emmy Award-winning director Bernardo Santana III to produce an awareness video featuring Grace's story along with conversations from other local colon cancer survivors. This video will be used as another means to further educate others about this disease.

  • Creation of an online presence to reach a large audience through our Be a Blue Buddy Facebook page, Grace's online cancer journal, and this fundraising web page.

 

GOALS

We can't do this without your help. That's why we want you to Be a . Contribute to our campaign and help us raise funds to donate to Colon Cancer Alliance's Blue Note Fund. The fund provides financial assistance to patients and their families so they can focus on getting well instead of stressing about mounting bills. Please donate generously.

We understand that not everybody can afford to make a financial contribution, but you can still help!

  1. Share the link to this page with your family, friends and colleagues by text, email, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter. You can also share the link on your website, blog and newsletter. #BeABlueBuddy #ColonCancer

  2. WEAR BLUE on Friday, March 7, 2014 which is National Dress in Blue Day.  We are pleased to garner FL Governor Rick Scott and Mayor Alvin Brown's support as they both proclaimed Dress in Blue Day in the State of FL and the City of Jacksonville, FL!  Governor Scott also proclaimed the month of March as National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month.

    Dress in Blue Day kicks off National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month and takes place on the first Friday in March. The day encourages individuals, businesses and community groups to wear blue and talk to each other about the importance of colon cancer screenings. Blue symbolizes hope for the patients who are currently fighting the disease, and it honors survivors as well as those who have died.

    Send photos of you and your group wearing blue to bluebuddycampaign@gmail.com and we'll post it on our campaign and Facebook pages!

  3. Invite Grace to be your organization's guest speaker to discuss colon cancer from a survivor's point of view.

Together, we can make a difference!

 

IMPACT

When you share a link to our site, participate in National Dress in Blue Day, or invite Grace to speak at your next business meeting, you're helping to create awareness about this disease, the importance of early detection, and perhaps save lives.

What's more, when you make a financial contribution to our campaign, you're also assisting colon cancer patients and their families receive financial relief during their time of need. 100% of net proceeds will be donated to CCA's Blue Note Fund.

With your help, we hope to exceed our fundraising goal of $5,000 so we can donate that much more to the program.  Since this is a personal fundraiser, contributions are not tax-deductible at this time.

 

PERKS

Make a contribution to our campaign, and you'll receive tokens of our appreciation that help continue our quest in spreading the word about colon cancer. It's our way to express our sincere, heartfelt gratitude for your generosity.

For those receiving a T-shirt, please tell us your size (Adult S, M, L, XL or 2XL) by either of the methods listed here.




COLORECTAL CANCER FACTS & SYMPTOMS

Colorectal cancer is the second leading cause of cancer deaths in both men and women combined in the U.S. It's also one of the most preventable and treatable cancers if it's caught early.

The American Cancer Society estimates that 136,830 people in the U.S. will be diagnosed with colorectal cancer  and that 50,310 will die in 2014. About 72% of cases arise in the colon and about 28% in the rectum.  On average, the lifetime risk of developing colon cancer is about 1 in 20 (5%).  However, this varies widely according to individual risk factors.

Jacksonville, FL - Duval County’s Incidence and Death Rates per 100,000 are 46.7 and 17.2, respectively, according to Northeast Florida Counts' latest statistics from 2010.

Symptoms may include:

  • Anemia
  • Fatigue
  • Blood - red or dark
  • Gas
  • Bloating, Constipation
  • Nausea, Vomiting
  • Diarrhea
  • Narrow, Ribbon-Like Stools
  • Unexplained Weight Loss

Talk to your doctor if you experience any of these symptoms.  The earlier you're diagnosed, the better chance of survival.

 

RISK FACTORS

  • Age 50+
  • Family History of Cancer
  • Inflammatory Bowel Disease (Ulcerative Colitis, Crohn's Disease)
  • Genetic Syndrome (Familial Adenomatous Polyposis or FAP; Lynch Syndrome or HNPCC-Hereditary Non-Polyposis Colorectal Cancer)
  • Lifestyle Choices (Lack of Exercise; Diet High in Fat and Red Meats; Diet Low in Fiber; Obesity; Smoking; Drinking)

 

GET SCREENED

Getting screened is far less traumatic and less expensive than undergoing surgeries, radiation and chemotherapy.  Talk to your doctor to discuss the best screening procedure for you.

  1. Fecal Occult Blood Test (FOBT). Used to detect bleeding from the upper digestive tract via stool sample. You can use a kit in the privacy of your own home.

  2. Fecal Immunochemical Test (FIT). Similar to FOBT. Used to detect bleeding from the lower digestive tract.

  3. Sigmoidoscopy. A thin, flexible scope used to detect pre-cancerous and cancerous polyps within the rectum and lower colon. Colon cleanse and sedation
    are used in the procedure.

  4. Colonoscopy. Similar to a sigmoidoscopy. Detects benign and malignant polyps within the rectum and the entire colon. Colon cleanse and sedation are used in the procedure.
     
  5. Double Contrast Barium Enema X-Ray. X-ray images of the rectum and colon are taken after an enema of barium solution and air is introduced into the colon. The barium solution highlights the rectum and colon in the x-ray images. Colon cleanse is required, but sedation is not needed. Detects 30-50% of cancers that can be found with a standard colonoscopy.1

THE CAMPAIGN TEAM

 

Grace De La Rosa.
Stage 3 colon cancer survivor and advocate, campaign creator, executive producer.
     

 

Bernardo Santana III.
Emmy Award-winning Director/Owner, EnFocus Media, Inc. Santana was touched by cancer twice when his aunt passed away from breast cancer and his grandmother died from ovarian cancer on Dec. 24, 2012.
     

 

Ramona Ramdeen.
Producer, Enfocus Media, Inc. Ramona was a social worker before delving into film production and continues to work on projects focusing on health and social issues. She hopes to begin work on her first feature film upon obtaining her Bachelor of Arts degree from The Art Institute this summer. Ramona is a mother of two healthy children. Although she has no family history of cancer, she is an advocate for regular colorectal cancer screening, especially for those who do not fit the standard risk categories.

LINKS

Grace De La Rosa

EnFocus Media, Inc.

Patient & Caregiver Support

SOURCES
1Tests to Detect Colorectal Cancer and Polyps. National Cancer Institute at the National Institutes of Health.
story_txt:
INTRODUCTION
Most people think that colon cancer 
  is just an old man's disease, perhaps because medical guidelines recommend regular 
  screening begin at the age of 50. But the truth is, this disease doesn't 
  discriminate in age, gender or race.  In fact, there is a rising incidence trend in the Under 50 population.
Grace De La Rosa was 38 when she was diagnosed with Stage 3 Colon Cancer.  She had no family history of any type of cancer. She's a veteran  Navy pilot's wife, mother of two, who were 14 and 3 at the time. She was a swimwear  model, fitness instructor and fitness competitor. She worked out religiously and ate healthy foods. So Grace was shocked to hear the words, You Have 
  Cancer. 

  She had surgery to remove the golf ball-sized tumor from her colon and received 
   FOLFOX 
  chemo treatments for 3 consecutive days, every other week, for six months.
Colorectal cancer is the second leading cause of cancer deaths in both men and women 
  combined in the U.S. But it's also one of the most preventable and treatable 
  cancers--if it's caught early.
Nobody likes to talk about colon cancer, because the symptoms associated 
  with this disease can be embarrassing to discuss with anyone, including your doctor. But 
  we're talking about a matter of life and death. Grace believes it's her responsibility 
  as a survivor to share the symptoms she experienced so others can be empowered 
  with this knowledge.
Her symptoms were all clear in hindsight. They included unexplained anemia (blood 
  loss) after the birth of each of her children.  She was given iron pills and sent home.  She experienced fatigue to the point where 
  she couldn't climb a flight of stairs without having to stop midway to catch 
  her breath.Grace also experienced abdominal cramps which she thought were menstrual-related. 
  And she noticed a tiny speck of blood once when she wiped. She assumed it was a spotty menstrual cycle or hemorrhoids which she'd 
  never experienced.Just a 
  few months prior to her diagnosis, Grace noticed when she passed gas the odor was abnormally foul, 
  as if something was dying inside of her. She simply assumed it was something 
  she ate.
If there's just one piece of advice 
  Grace wants to instill in others, it's this: Don't 
  brush off symptoms that aren't "normal" for you. Your doctor may be 
  a medical expert, but you are the expert of your own body. Trust your gut. Be proactive in your health care. Know the symptoms 
  of colon cancer. Go to your doctor, especially if you have a family history of 
  colon cancer, and request a screening, even if you're under 50. 
OUR PROJECTThis year marks Grace's 9th year as a colon cancer survivor. She created the Be a 
campaign in support of National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month with a mission to educate the community about colon cancer and the importance of early detection, to give hope to newly diagnosed patients, and to save lives by spreading the word through:

Group Presentations. Grace is available to speak with your organization about colon cancer through a survivor's point of view.

Production of Colon Cancer Awareness Video. Grace teamed up with Enfocus Media, Inc., led by Emmy Award-winning director Bernardo Santana III to produce an awareness video featuring Grace's story along with conversations from other local colon cancer survivors. This video will be used as another means to further educate others about this disease.

Creation of an online presence to reach a large audience through our Be a Blue Buddy Facebook page, Grace's online cancer journal, and this fundraising web page.

 GOALSWe can't do this without your help. That's why we want you to Be a . Contribute to our campaign and help us raise funds to donate to Colon Cancer Alliance's Blue Note Fund. The fund provides financial assistance to patients and their families so they can focus on getting well instead of stressing about mounting bills. Please donate generously.
We understand that not everybody can afford to make a financial contribution, but you can still help!

Share the link to this page with your family, friends and colleagues by text, email, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter. You can also share the link on your website, blog and newsletter. #BeABlueBuddy #ColonCancer

WEAR BLUE on Friday, March 7, 2014 which is National Dress in Blue Day.  We are pleased to garner FL Governor Rick Scott and Mayor Alvin Brown's support as they both proclaimed Dress in Blue Day in the State of FL and the City of Jacksonville, FL!  Governor Scott also proclaimed the month of March as National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month.Dress in Blue Day kicks off National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month and takes place on the first Friday in March. The day encourages individuals, businesses and community groups to wear blue and talk to each other about the importance of colon cancer screenings. Blue symbolizes hope for the patients who are currently fighting the disease, and it honors survivors as well as those who have died.Send photos of you and your group wearing blue to bluebuddycampaign@gmail.com and we'll post it on our campaign and Facebook pages!

Invite Grace to be your organization's guest speaker to discuss colon cancer from a survivor's point of view.

Together, we can make a difference! 
IMPACTWhen you share a link to our site, participate in National Dress in Blue Day, or invite Grace to speak at your next business meeting, you're helping to create awareness 
  about this disease, the importance of early detection, and perhaps save lives.What's more, when you make a financial contribution 
  to our campaign, you're also assisting colon cancer patients and their 
  families receive financial relief during their time of need. 100% of net proceeds will be 
  donated to CCA's Blue Note Fund.With your help, we hope to exceed our fundraising 
  goal of $5,000 so we can donate that much more to the program.  Since this is a personal fundraiser, contributions are not tax-deductible at this time. 
PERKSMake a contribution to our campaign, 
  and you'll receive tokens of our appreciation that help continue our quest 
  in spreading the word about colon cancer. It's our way to express our sincere, 
  heartfelt gratitude for your generosity.
For those receiving a T-shirt, please tell us your size (Adult S, M, L, XL or 2XL) by either of the methods listed here.COLORECTAL 
  CANCER FACTS & SYMPTOMSColorectal cancer is the second leading cause of cancer deaths in both men and women combined 
  in the U.S. It's also one of the most preventable and treatable cancers if it's caught early.The American Cancer Society estimates that 136,830 people in the U.S. will be 
  diagnosed with colorectal cancer  and that 50,310 will die in 2014. 
  About 72% of cases arise in the colon and about 28% in the rectum.  On average, the lifetime risk of 
  developing colon cancer is about 1 in 20 (5%).  However, this varies widely according to individual risk 
  factors.Jacksonville, FL - Duval County’s Incidence and Death Rates per 100,000 are 46.7 and 17.2, respectively, according to Northeast Florida Counts' latest statistics from 2010.Symptoms may include:

Anemia
Fatigue
Blood - red or dark
Gas
Bloating, Constipation
Nausea, Vomiting
Diarrhea
Narrow, Ribbon-Like Stools
Unexplained Weight Loss

Talk to your doctor if you experience any of these symptoms.  The earlier you're diagnosed, the better chance of survival.
 
RISK 
  FACTORS 

Age 50+
Family History of Cancer
Inflammatory Bowel Disease 
    (Ulcerative Colitis, Crohn's Disease)
Genetic Syndrome (Familial 
    Adenomatous Polyposis or FAP; Lynch Syndrome or HNPCC-Hereditary Non-Polyposis 
    Colorectal Cancer)
Lifestyle Choices (Lack 
    of Exercise; Diet High in Fat and Red Meats; Diet Low in Fiber; Obesity; Smoking; 
    Drinking) 
 
GET 
  SCREENEDGetting screened is far less traumatic and less expensive than undergoing surgeries, radiation and chemotherapy.  Talk to your doctor to discuss the best screening procedure for you.


Fecal 
    Occult Blood Test (FOBT). Used to detect bleeding from the upper digestive 
    tract via stool sample. You can use a kit in the privacy of your own home.

 Fecal 
    Immunochemical Test (FIT). Similar to FOBT. Used to detect bleeding from 
    the lower  digestive tract.


Sigmoidoscopy. 
    A thin, flexible scope used to detect 
    pre-cancerous and cancerous polyps within the rectum and lower colon. Colon 
    cleanse and sedation are used in the procedure.


Colonoscopy. 
    Similar to a sigmoidoscopy. Detects benign and malignant polyps within the 
    rectum and the entire colon. Colon cleanse and sedation are used in 
    the procedure.

  

Double 
    Contrast Barium Enema X-Ray. X-ray images of the rectum and colon are 
    taken after an enema of barium solution and air is introduced into the colon. 
    The barium solution highlights the rectum and colon in the x-ray images. Colon 
    cleanse is required, but sedation is not needed. Detects 30-50% of cancers 
    that can be found with a standard colonoscopy.1

THE 
  CAMPAIGN TEAM 



 
Grace 
      De La Rosa.Stage 3 colon cancer survivor and 
      advocate, campaign creator, executive producer.


 
 
 



 
Bernardo 
      Santana III.Emmy Award-winning Director/Owner, 
      EnFocus Media, Inc. Santana was touched by cancer twice when his aunt passed away from breast cancer and his grandmother died from ovarian cancer on Dec. 24, 2012.


 
 
 



 
Ramona 
      Ramdeen.Producer, Enfocus Media, Inc.  Ramona was a social worker before delving into film production and continues to work on projects focusing on health and social issues.  She hopes to begin work on her first feature film upon obtaining her Bachelor of Arts degree from The Art Institute this summer. Ramona is a mother of two healthy children.  Although she has no family history of cancer, she is an advocate for regular colorectal cancer screening, especially for those who do not fit the standard risk categories.

LINKSGrace De La RosaEnFocus 
  Media, Inc.

Patient 
  & Caregiver SupportSOURCES1Tests 
  to Detect Colorectal Cancer and Polyps. National Cancer Institute at the 
  National Institutes of Health.

story:
We want to bring our lovingly crafted, all-natural bath and body care products to a much larger audience - by raising enough funds to renovate Kinder Soaps’ production studio be fully compliant with ASEAN Cosmetics Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP).

"I’m having a wonderful experience with the essential oils for eczema, particularly the Eczema Support and the Teselli Healing Serum. My son is responding very well, the itch immediately goes away and so far it is not spreading. I have tried numerous creams and even natural products, but these oils are proving to be the most promising and fast-responding. -Jasvin J. (15 June 2014)"
"I was introduced to Kinder Soaps by a friend who noticed my acne prone back. She was kind to share some Clarity soap for me to try and not only it controlled my acne, I feel in love (with) Clarity. It prompted me to buy the 12-Soaps-A-Year package. I’m now down to my last 4 bars (out of 12) and will be replenishing my stock, without a doubt. 

I adore Clarity because it does not leave my skin with pulling feeling after cleansing with soap. I have used Clarity from top to toe. Yes including my hair and face, not only on my acne prone back.

So if you need to control oil / sebum on your skin, especially on your back (like me), Clarity is your solution. -Yuen Chin (12 June 2014)"

Saving Skins, One Shower At A Time.

Hi, I'm Michelle, founder and resident soap artisan at Kinder Soaps. For the past 6 years I have been formulating, researching, and making all-natural, handmade bath and body care goods for sensitive and problematic skin in Malaysia. It all started when my daughter, Andrea, developed eczema shortly after birth. She was the reason why I began my research into natural skin care, and making soap for her in my kitchen late at nights when all the children were asleep. 

We have since grown to have a handful of lovely, helpful part-time staff who help me man our tiny shop and ship out packages to our customers all over the world--but I am still chiefly responsible for the actual production of every single product we offer. 

You can read more about our origins here. 

I would like to think that our mantra, "Kindness Comes Naturally", has extended beyond our products, to the way we treat our earth and its inhabitants in everything that we do. Here are some ways we are trying to accomplish this:

  1. All our products are made from natural, plant-based ingredients, and may include other additives like beeswax and goat's milk. We stay clear of petrochemical products like artificial fragrances and preservatives so that people with really sensitive skin will benefit from the absence of these common skin irritants, and we won't be contributing harsh pollutants into waterways. 
  2. We have recently ditched plastic shrink wrapping as a means of protecting our soap (yay!), and swapped over to making our own reusable, 100% biodegradable beeswax cotton wraps. They are a bit fussier to produce and handle, but I strongly believe in doing everything we possibly can to reduce our dependence on throwaway plastic. 
  3. We run a recycling programme for some of our packaging materials. Customers return our beeswax cotton wraps to us for recycling, and receive complimentary bars of soap as a small token of thanks.

Despite the positive feedback we have been receiving consistently over the years, I would like to make it clear that we do NOT create 'miracle' products that will definitely 'cure' any skin ailment. We can only promise to work ethically, and that our choice of ingredients will always be partial to things which are as minimally processed as possible, and free from artificial fragrances and preservatives. I personally work really hard at doing my research into ingredients before deciding to add them to any of our formulations, spending countless late nights having mental debates with myself over skincare and health-related research papers, articles etc.

Anyway, here are some scenes from typical working day, which I try to also share on our Facebook page to keep in touch with customers:

Since then, I have used my experience and knowledge about plant-based skin care to help scores of people cope with, if not completely overcome, various skin complaints ranging from acne to eczema. (To know more about our soap, visit our FAQ page.) My customers' support has been overwhelming over the years, for which I will always be grateful. My four little children are also benefiting from the fruits of my labour (that's our youngest, Sean, up there in the photo)!

And in case you're wondering - yes, Andrea is now free from eczema, thanks to some simple dietary and lifestyle choices. :)


Why I Need RM100,000 

I want to extensively renovate my 1,200 sqft soap studio so that it will be be compliant with the ASEAN Cosmetics Directive's Guidelines for Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). This is expected to cost around RM80,000. After considering the cost of materials which I will need to make your perks and take care of shipping costs, I reckon the amount of cash I'd really need would be closer to RM100,000 (~USD30,000).

My original sketch of the desired floorplan:


... and the digital version which was finally given the green light on the 31st of July 2014, after months of discussions and negotiations with the GMP division of Malaysia's National Pharmaceutical Control Bureau (NPCB):

What This Means For People With Sensitive Skin

  1. Improving the quality of life for so many people (we have received so many thank-you emails over the years) - I realise now that we don't just make bath and body products! So now I want to be able to bring our products beyond Malaysian shores in a much bigger way than what we are doing at present.
  2. Our products will always conscientiously made. Kinder Soaps will be audited annually by the GMP division of the NPCB for quality control purposes. What this means for you is that we will need to always maintain proper paperwork for quality control purposes. I am not the most fastidious of people when it comes to this sort of thing, but I do believe that following a framework as set out by the ASEAN Cosmetics Initiative is worth every bit of the effort it requires. It is a good place to start in terms of building even more accountability and transparency in how a small business like ours is run.
  3. We want to take Kinder Soaps global. Carrying on from points 1 and 2, having a GMP-compliant studio opens up many doors, specifically with regards to the commercial export of our products, which requires something called a Certificate Of Free Sale.
  4. I want to channel more of my time and energy into formulating new products for tackling other skincare and health-related applications by setting up all the necessary processes to go with a GMP compliant studio (which will include hiring dedicated production staff). I will of course be always turning to completely natural, plant-based ingredients.

In summary, I'd like to reach out to more people who may benefit from using our products, as well as to find new ways of soothing and nourishing troubled skin.

What Renovation Work Will Be Required?

Here's what the space looked like when I first moved in, about 3 and a half years ago. It's functional, but not exactly very impressive :") Some of the major undertakings include

  • removing the carpeting and redoing the floor,
  • building rooms for various processes (see the floorplan above)
  • building storage areas,
  • reworking light fixtures,
  • reworking drainage and plumbing systems,
  • installation of ventilation fans and new air conditioners,
  • installation of a good water filtration system,
  • setting up a proper quality control system in accordance with GMP guidelines,
  • hiring and training new staff specifically for production work.

Here's What You'll Receive

My forté is, as mentioned earlier, making all-natural bath and body goods to care for your skin in a way that is also sensitive towards the environment. So as a gesture of our thanks for your support in helping us make our dream a reality, here are beautifully presented perks, which will be delivered ANYWHERE in the world at no additional cost:

1. Soap Gift Sets

Receive our soap lovingly wrapped in furoshiki, sent either to you or to someone whom you care very much about. They will be in sets of 

  • 3 bars (Syukur, USD30), 
  • 6 bars (Mauruuru, USD50), or 
  • 18 bars (Eskerrona, USD100). 

Pick your soap, or let us choose them for you based on your skin requirements.

We will also include your name on our Gratitude Wall, which will be in the retail area downstairs from the studio. :)

2. Complete Skincare Gift Sets

Not only will you receive soap, but also our other products that are definitely going to leave your skin feeling pampered, nourished and protected. This one is a bumper haul!

Reconnaissance (USD225) will get you

  1. 12 bars of soap (your choice, or we'll surprise you with a selection)
  2. 3 x 100ml Skin Treats Oil (i.e. one each of the 3 types we offer: Eczema Support, Dry Skin Relief, Baby Bliss), which are 100% natural blends of various plant oils to nourish and moisturize your skin
  3. 1 x 20g tube of our multitasking Double Duty Balm. Apart from comforting chapped lips and dry patches of skin, it's terrific for healing diaper rash too!
  4. 1 x 30ml Teselli Intensive Healing Serum. This is our newest offering, and it looks set to be a firm favourite amongst our customers who have more severe skin concerns, or who have difficult-to-heal scars.
  5. 1 x 100g Teselli Body Soufflé. A preservative and fragrance-free option to your usual creams. This is meant for drier skin types. 
  6. 2 x 100g Gentle Body Polish (one each of the 2 types we offer: Dry Skin, Oily Skin). A mild exfoliant for the face and body, best suited for those with sensitive skin. Our Body Polishes are dry powders which need to be dispensed and moistened with a liquid of your choice--water, honey and yoghurt are great options for your skin!

All these goodies will be carefully packed and shipped in a sturdy mailing box. 

Your name will also be displayed on our Gratitude Wall. 

As with the soap gift sets, you can receive these goodies yourself, or have us ship them to a friend or loved one.

3. Customised Soap For You - and for the Less Fortunate

Here's something a little different - contributing at this level will not only get you made-to-order soap, but also put our gentle soap bars in the hands of the underprivileged in our community.

Zahvalnost (USD700) will get you

  • 90 bars of customised soap. You and I will work together to come up with a formulation that suits your skin or scent preferences. They make terrific hostess gifts, and you should receive these bars in time for Christmas...!
  • 90 bars of soap to be sent to a community or home for the less fortunate, within Malaysia. If you know of a community that can benefit from our soap, please direct us to them - otherwise we'll select one on your behalf. We'll let them know that you gifted this soap to them. :)
  • Your name on our Gratitude Wall, in a special section dedicated to those who helped us reach out to the less fortunate in our community.

What If We Surpass Our Target Funding Amount?

We depend heavily on managing our cashflows well in order to continue being in business - and we have done so without any official debt so far. So if we do face the happy situation of having more than we need for the renovation work, here's what we'll be using the cash for:

  1. stock up on ingredients (we can never have too much of this!)
  2. set aside more funding for research and development (R&D) and trials of new products (I personally would like to find something effective to help with psoriasis and keratosis, for starters)
  3. invest in nicer furniture for the office/retail area (because my staff and customers deserve a pretty place to hang out!)

What If We DON'T Hit Our Target Funding?

This is definitely a possibility. :") Here are the 'escape routes' I can take, and reasons why I would really rather not have to consider them:

  1. Apply for a personal loan, or charge my credit cards. By far the most obvious alternative, but I would prefer not to work for the bank over the next few years just to pay these loans off... And besides, my expertise in helping to heal and soothe the skin isn't very useful to a corporation--it is most suited to helping individuals like yourself.
  2. Postpone the studio renovation until I have amassed enough cash. This feels like a bit of a cop-out to me, because I would basically just go back to doing business as usual, while fulfilling your orders, and not exactly taking the next big step towards anything in the near future. Then there's also the risk of losing steam after a while, and I certainly don't want to experience that...
  3. Rework the design of the studio to match the amount of funds we manage to raise. This depends on the final amount we manage to raise. There is a little bit of wriggle room with regards to kitting out the studio (it certainly won't be as pretty as I'd imagine it to be!), but I certainly don't intend to cut corners on safety and functionality. 

Excited? Please help us spread the word!

Again, thank you SO much for staying with us so far. 

Do you have friends and family members who may benefit from our products and expertise?

Indiegogo has a few nifty ways to easily share campaigns with your social networks, located at the top of this page. Please use whichever ones are most convenient to you, and also talk about our campaign the next time you meet up with your friends for a chat. :) Thank you so much!

Questions?

Send us an email at ask@kindersoaps.com and we'll respond within 3 business days.

Notes and Thoughts

Shipping and Customs

By default, all perks will be shipped via Pos Malaysia's registered surface parcel service, and we will email you with your parcel's tracking number which can be used to trace its journey here. Broadly speaking, parcels sent by surface mail will take anywhere between 3-8 weeks to arrive at their destinations, but if you poke around the Pos Malaysia website, you'll have a better idea of what delivery times to expect. 

If you would like to expedite your shipping by opting for registered air parcel instead, please notify us and we'll advise you on the additional shipping charges required.

We will do all that we can to ensure that your perks are safely wrapped and ready for their (long) journeys to you, but we can't help it if the postman accidentally drops your parcel and something in there breaks. :( If you'd like us to purchase insurance for your package, just let us know and we'll advise you on the additional charges incurred, which you will need to bear. 

You will also need to pay for any customs duties and taxes which may be levied by your country on the goods sent to you.

Production and Delivery Time Estimates

Remember: each and every product you see on our website, and everything we will be delivering to you at the end of this campaign, will be personally made by me. I have some terrific helpers who take care of the packaging and shipping, but otherwise the production of the soap, oils, serums, balms etc are my responsibility. Delays may occur, but my team and I will do all that we can to keep to a planned timeline (my children, on the other hand, will probably have other plans for me...!)

Here's how we expect to spend our time:

  1. Receive your funds from this campaign (3 calendar weeks after campaign ends)
  2. Purchase ingredients, plan production schedule (2 weeks)
  3. Begin production of perks, and curing time for soap (7 weeks)
  4. Begin studio renovations while the soap etc are safely curing/stored in the retail space downstairs from the studio
  5. Ship your goodies! (3-8 weeks to arrive at your doorstep, depending on where you are and how quickly your parcels clear customs)

So in all, this won't exactly be a quick turnaround time by any stretch of imagination. :") We're looking at a timeline of roughly 15-20 weeks to deliver your perks to you from the time this campaign ends. We thank you in advance for your patience! 

What's Michelle Like In Person?

Well you've read ALL the way down this huge block of text, so I'm assuming that you're actually quite interested in what Kinder Soaps is all about! I'm flattered, thank you so much... Okay, so here's a 20-minute show about Kinder Soaps which was recorded and aired on Malaysia's satellite TV, Astro, in 2012. I was expecting Sean at the time, hence the baby bump that accompanied me during the interview. 

I hope that this interview will give you an insight into how I think, how I run Kinder Soaps and what has transpired in the past two years till today.

Please pardon my over-use of the word "obviously" and the phrase "and all that" - I blame it on being nervous in front of the camera!


Again, thank you SO much for staying with me all the way to this stage. I hope that you will make a pledge to help Kinder Soaps reach even more people, to get them comfortable in their skin.

My four little children are also benefiting from the fruits of my labour (that's our youngest, Sean, up there in the photo)!And in case you're wondering - yes, Andrea is now free from eczema, thanks to some simple dietary and lifestyle choices. :)Why I Need RM100,000 I want to extensively renovate my 1,200 sqft soap studio so that it will be be compliant with the ASEAN Cosmetics Directive's Guidelines for Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). This is expected to cost around RM80,000. After considering the cost of materials which I will need to make your perks and take care of shipping costs, I reckon the amount of cash I'd really need would be closer to RM100,000 (~USD30,000).My original sketch of the desired floorplan:... and the digital version which was finally given the green light on the 31st of July 2014, after months of discussions and negotiations with the GMP division of Malaysia's National Pharmaceutical Control Bureau (NPCB):What This Means For People With Sensitive Skin
Improving the quality of life for so many people (we have received so many thank-you emails over the years) - I realise now that we don't just make bath and body products! So now I want to be able to bring our products beyond Malaysian shores in a much bigger way than what we are doing at present.

Our products will always conscientiously made. Kinder Soaps will be audited annually by the GMP division of the NPCB for quality control purposes. What this means for you is that we will need to always maintain proper paperwork for quality control purposes. I am not the most fastidious of people when it comes to this sort of thing, but I do believe that following a framework as set out by the ASEAN Cosmetics Initiative is worth every bit of the effort it requires. It is a good place to start in terms of building even more accountability and transparency in how a small business like ours is run.

We want to take Kinder Soaps global. Carrying on from points 1 and 2, having a GMP-compliant studio opens up many doors, specifically with regards to the commercial export of our products, which requires something called a Certificate Of Free Sale.
I want to channel more of my time and energy into formulating new products for tackling other skincare and health-related applications by setting up all the necessary processes to go with a GMP compliant studio (which will include hiring dedicated production staff). I will of course be always turning to completely natural, plant-based ingredients.
In summary, I'd like to reach out to more people who may benefit from using our products, as well as to find new ways of soothing and nourishing troubled skin.What Renovation Work Will Be Required?Here's what the space looked like when I first moved in, about 3 and a half years ago. It's functional, but not exactly very impressive :") Some of the major undertakings include
removing the carpeting and redoing the floor,
building rooms for various processes (see the floorplan above)
building storage areas,
reworking light fixtures,
reworking drainage and plumbing systems,
installation of ventilation fans and new air conditioners,

installation of a good water filtration system,
setting up a proper quality control system in accordance with GMP guidelines,
hiring and training new staff specifically for production work.
Here's What You'll ReceiveMy forté is, as mentioned earlier, making all-natural bath and body goods to care for your skin in a way that is also sensitive towards the environment. So as a gesture of our thanks for your support in helping us make our dream a reality, here are beautifully presented perks, which will be delivered ANYWHERE in the world at no additional cost:1. Soap Gift SetsReceive our soap lovingly wrapped in furoshiki, sent either to you or to someone whom you care very much about. They will be in sets of 

3 bars (Syukur, USD30), 


6 bars (Mauruuru, USD50), or 


18 bars (Eskerrona, USD100). 

Pick your soap, or let us choose them for you based on your skin requirements.We will also include your name on our Gratitude Wall, which will be in the retail area downstairs from the studio. :)2. Complete Skincare Gift SetsNot only will you receive soap, but also our other products that are definitely going to leave your skin feeling pampered, nourished and protected. This one is a bumper haul!Reconnaissance (USD225) will get you

12 bars of soap (your choice, or we'll surprise you with a selection)


3 x 100ml Skin Treats Oil (i.e. one each of the 3 types we offer: Eczema Support, Dry Skin Relief, Baby Bliss), which are 100% natural blends of various plant oils to nourish and moisturize your skin


1 x 20g tube of our multitasking Double Duty Balm. Apart from comforting chapped lips and dry patches of skin, it's terrific for healing diaper rash too!


1 x 30ml Teselli Intensive Healing Serum. This is our newest offering, and it looks set to be a firm favourite amongst our customers who have more severe skin concerns, or who have difficult-to-heal scars.


1 x 100g Teselli Body Soufflé. A preservative and fragrance-free option to your usual creams. This is meant for drier skin types. 

2 x 100g Gentle Body Polish (one each of the 2 types we offer: Dry Skin, Oily Skin). A mild exfoliant for the face and body, best suited for those with sensitive skin. Our Body Polishes are dry powders which need to be dispensed and moistened with a liquid of your choice--water, honey and yoghurt are great options for your skin!
All these goodies will be carefully packed and shipped in a sturdy mailing box. Your name will also be displayed on our Gratitude Wall. As with the soap gift sets, you can receive these goodies yourself, or have us ship them to a friend or loved one.3. Customised Soap For You - and for the Less FortunateHere's something a little different - contributing at this level will not only get you made-to-order soap, but also put our gentle soap bars in the hands of the underprivileged in our community.Zahvalnost (USD700) will get you

90 bars of customised soap. You and I will work together to come up with a formulation that suits your skin or scent preferences. They make terrific hostess gifts, and you should receive these bars in time for Christmas...!


90 bars of soap to be sent to a community or home for the less fortunate, within Malaysia. If you know of a community that can benefit from our soap, please direct us to them - otherwise we'll select one on your behalf. We'll let them know that you gifted this soap to them. :)

Your name on our Gratitude Wall, in a special section dedicated to those who helped us reach out to the less fortunate in our community.
What If We Surpass Our Target Funding Amount?We depend heavily on managing our cashflows well in order to continue being in business - and we have done so without any official debt so far. So if we do face the happy situation of having more than we need for the renovation work, here's what we'll be using the cash for:
stock up on ingredients (we can never have too much of this!)

set aside more funding for research and development (R&D) and trials of new products (I personally would like to find something effective to help with psoriasis and keratosis, for starters)
invest in nicer furniture for the office/retail area (because my staff and customers deserve a pretty place to hang out!)
What If We DON'T Hit Our Target Funding?This is definitely a possibility. :") Here are the 'escape routes' I can take, and reasons why I would really rather not have to consider them:

Apply for a personal loan, or charge my credit cards. By far the most obvious alternative, but I would prefer not to work for the bank over the next few years just to pay these loans off... And besides, my expertise in helping to heal and soothe the skin isn't very useful to a corporation--it is most suited to helping individuals like yourself.

Postpone the studio renovation until I have amassed enough cash. This feels like a bit of a cop-out to me, because I would basically just go back to doing business as usual, while fulfilling your orders, and not exactly taking the next big step towards anything in the near future. Then there's also the risk of losing steam after a while, and I certainly don't want to experience that...
Rework the design of the studio to match the amount of funds we manage to raise. This depends on the final amount we manage to raise. There is a little bit of wriggle room with regards to kitting out the studio (it certainly won't be as pretty as I'd imagine it to be!), but I certainly don't intend to cut corners on safety and functionality. 

Excited? Please help us spread the word!
Again, thank you SO much for staying with us so far. Do you have friends and family members who may benefit from our products and expertise?Indiegogo has a few nifty ways to easily share campaigns with your social networks, located at the top of this page. Please use whichever ones are most convenient to you, and also talk about our campaign the next time you meet up with your friends for a chat. :) Thank you so much!Questions?Send us an email at ask@kindersoaps.com and we'll respond within 3 business days.Notes and ThoughtsShipping and CustomsBy default, all perks will be shipped via Pos Malaysia's registered surface parcel service, and we will email you with your parcel's tracking number which can be used to trace its journey here. Broadly speaking, parcels sent by surface mail will take anywhere between 3-8 weeks to arrive at their destinations, but if you poke around the Pos Malaysia website, you'll have a better idea of what delivery times to expect. If you would like to expedite your shipping by opting for registered air parcel instead, please notify us and we'll advise you on the additional shipping charges required.We will do all that we can to ensure that your perks are safely wrapped and ready for their (long) journeys to you, but we can't help it if the postman accidentally drops your parcel and something in there breaks. :( If you'd like us to purchase insurance for your package, just let us know and we'll advise you on the additional charges incurred, which you will need to bear. You will also need to pay for any customs duties and taxes which may be levied by your country on the goods sent to you.Production and Delivery Time EstimatesRemember: each and every product you see on our website, and everything we will be delivering to you at the end of this campaign, will be personally made by me. I have some terrific helpers who take care of the packaging and shipping, but otherwise the production of the soap, oils, serums, balms etc are my responsibility. Delays may occur, but my team and I will do all that we can to keep to a planned timeline (my children, on the other hand, will probably have other plans for me...!)Here's how we expect to spend our time:
Receive your funds from this campaign (3 calendar weeks after campaign ends)
Purchase ingredients, plan production schedule (2 weeks)
Begin production of perks, and curing time for soap (7 weeks)
Begin studio renovations while the soap etc are safely curing/stored in the retail space downstairs from the studio
Ship your goodies! (3-8 weeks to arrive at your doorstep, depending on where you are and how quickly your parcels clear customs)
So in all, this won't exactly be a quick turnaround time by any stretch of imagination. :") We're looking at a timeline of roughly 15-20 weeks to deliver your perks to you from the time this campaign ends. We thank you in advance for your patience! What's Michelle Like In Person?Well you've read ALL the way down this huge block of text, so I'm assuming that you're actually quite interested in what Kinder Soaps is all about! I'm flattered, thank you so much... Okay, so here's a 20-minute show about Kinder Soaps which was recorded and aired on Malaysia's satellite TV, Astro, in 2012. I was expecting Sean at the time, hence the baby bump that accompanied me during the interview. I hope that this interview will give you an insight into how I think, how I run Kinder Soaps and what has transpired in the past two years till today.Please pardon my over-use of the word "obviously" and the phrase "and all that" - I blame it on being nervous in front of the camera!Again, thank you SO much for staying with me all the way to this stage. I hope that you will make a pledge to help Kinder Soaps reach even more people, to get them comfortable in their skin.

story:
What is Karmagenes? 

The Karmagenes genetic test helps you to better understand yourself and to better understand and connect with the people around you. Karmagenes links 14 specific behavioural characteristics with your DNA. 

Through our product you can see how much your DNA relates with you being: Optimist, Risk taker, Decisive, Sex driven, Social, Self-aware, Bon vivant, Spontaneous, Strategic, Emotional, Calm, Stress tolerant, Confident and Innovative.

How can a DNA based personality test help people?

To answer this question, here are a few points to illustrate the added value of the Karmagenes Genetic Test we have developed.

        1. Our product is NOVEL and VERSATILE!

Karmagenes Genetic Test is an innovative way of bringing together science, social networking and personality tests. It’s a scientific personality test that can complement the personality tests that some, if not all of us have done at some point in our lives.

        2. Your DNA does not lie!

Scientists around the world are slowly beginning to establish that our genes play a key role in determining who we are and what kind of partner we choose. Our DNA contains the underlying code for who we are, and getting to understand our genes better might help us make important decisions that already existing personality tests may not be able to.

         3. It’s Science…but it’s FUN!

Don’t you want to know how your own DNA, the one of your partner, of your parents, of your siblings, or your kids has played a role in their personality? Do our test and you will be able to understand how significant the DNA is…and how much their environment and upbringing has changed their personalities! 

Uniqueness and DNA

Our main goal is to better understand ourselves and the people next to us through DNA.

But first things first! What is DNA?

What is it in our DNA that makes us unique?

What led us to start Karmagenes?

Who we are is principally defined by our genetic background and environmental factors such as school, family, friends etc. Our focus is exclusively placed on the role that DNA plays in our individual personality traits. We wanted to create a simple genetic test that is accessible to everyone. Thus, we came up with Karmagenes Genetic Test.


How long does the test take?

There are 4 simple steps to follow for the Karmagenes Genetic Test and you will get your results within 4-6 weeks once we receive your DNA:                 

          1. You subscribe for a test.

         2. We send you the kit to collect your saliva.

         3. We perform the genetic analysis based on the latest and on the highest 

             standard of the molecular biological science.       

        4. You get your Karmagenes report!

             (check the link below for more details http://goo.gl/pOnzAV )

Why crowd funding?

It is clear that the job market nowadays is quite hard and competitive. Thus we thought we would take our professional fate in our own hands… with your help!

By sponsoring our campaign, you will make a dream come true! It may sound stereotypical but that's the truth. We will be happy to have your feedback. This will be extremely important for creating something new and global. We want to shape our project with you!

Show me the money

To kick off Karmagenes we kindly ask your financial support but it doesn't stop there. Spread the word about Karmagenes on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. More importantly tell your family and friends to visit our website! Be a part of our exciting project!

Practically, our basic upcoming expenses for the next 2-3 months will be around 25.099USD:

- 9K: To make a Karmagenes customised genetic array. Yep, it costs a lot! 

- 7K: To upgrade our technological equipment (for example two bigger and better computers! and 2 new nice big screens to analyse the DNA data without the risk of losing our vision:)

- 5K: To buy commercial software licences (we still try to make things work with free trials:)  

- 4K:  market Karmagenes. We need to expand. We think big and we want to go globally (meaning we have to attend international meetings, make some cool promotion products and ads)

- 99USD: To have a stock of beers for the difficult moments:)

What do you get?

Apart from our infinite gratitude, we will reward you some incredible perks, that are listed on the right!

You will have the chance to get a cool T-shirt, or a mug, or a stress ball with our trendy logos and mottos (check out our photo gallery). Grab the opportunity and be one of the first people to do the Karmegenes test.

Karmagenes at a glance

1. DNA does not lie!

2. Meet yourself!

3. Understand your social network!

4. Add value to self-assessment tests!

5. Bring science to the general public!

Business people say: Good idea + bad team= probable failure

                                          Good team + bad idea= possible success

But at Karmagenes,  we are  sure to have a Good Team and a Good Idea:)

Overall

We are an enthusiastic, international and multidisciplinary team. We want to share our scientific expertise with everyone. Genetics, and more broadly science can seem difficult to be comprehended. 

Remember that the pen and especially the electronic pen (in this age of the internet) is mightier than any sword.

So sharing our project means the most to us.

We thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign and look forward to getting to knowyou better.

Enjoy!

Team at Karmagenes

story:
Fish Hawk Spirits LLC   www.fishhawkspirits.net or on facebook https://www.facebook.com/Fishhawkspiritsllc?ref=hl

Makers of Absinthia Rubra, The Red American Absinthe & Marion Black 106,The Spirit of Florida

Fully licensed and operating craft distillery in the piney woods of rural Marion County Florida.


We are engaged in the brand launch of our premium Red American Absinthe, Absinthia Rubra.   Absinthia Rubra is a real absinthe, made with the "trinity" of wormwood, anise & fennel as well as other fine herbs. It is hand crafted in Florida from all natural locally grown ingredients. No artificial flavors, no artificial colors.  Available in Florida from Republic National Distributing Company.

We have two distinct levels of funding needed to successful launch our products. An initial test marketing budget and then a marketing campaign budget. Take a quick look at our Facebook page and you will see the types of events we currently attend.

This Indiegogo project is for bridge funding to provide operational funds from non predatory sources to conduct test marketing.  Once we achieve the best marketing campaign plan, we will be seeking a larger amount of funding to launch a statewide campaign. 

Our Hope is to escape the need to involve traditional venture capitalists.

This project has been in development for 4 years. The firm was organized in May 2011 and final licensure was secured in April 2012. 

We consistently hear from consumers that "real" absinthe is not legal to produce or sell in the US.  People believe the Green Fairy is trapped by federal regulations.  Not any longer. As of 2007 it is legal to produce Absinthe in the US  and our first product was bottled and shipped in September 2012.  Alas, it still requires a significant marketing budget to let people know where they can go to dance with the green fairy and this is what we hope you will assist us to accomplish.

We have had inquiries from traditional Venture Capitalists, seeking a controlling equity share to "take us to the big time"  we hope to avoid that route by appealing to you to help our cause.

This initial bridge funding will allow us to run the test marketing campaigns and fine tune them to achieve the maximum impact for minimum cost.  Once concluded, we will raise the funds to launch the state wide campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute you can still help us out!  You can purchase our products at your local retailer. When you ask them to special order our products from RNDC, they can have it for you to buy within a week or so at no additional charge.  Spread the word at your local bar and retailer that high quality, hand made, Red American Absinthe and Premium Tangerine Brandy are available from Fish Hawk Spirits, Ocala, Florida.  Don't forget to share this campaign with your friends and visit us on Facebook  Look at the gallery for Fish Hawk art and photos.

story:
11 Years

1919 Hemphill is a DIY, volunteer run community space and punk venue in Fort Worth, TX. We have been around 11 years, an incredibly long time for a space of this type. But in order to keep our doors open, we need your help. We are always running on a month-to-month basis as we make only enough money to keep our doors open. Our building is constantly in need of repairs and our equipment needs updating.

DIY or DIY

We need improvements in the following areas:

  • Roof repairs - the roof leaks, as anyone who's come to a show on a rainy day knows.
  • Further AC improvements: we made a lot of progress since last year, but we can always make it better in those hot summer months. We would also like to get some new, high powered fans
  • PA Equipment: shows are how we make most of our donations, and we would like to improve our speakers and make repairs to the ones we already have
  • The Back Yard: we would like our back yard to be a more welcoming hangout space. We need to buy sand, gravel, seating and other stuff
  • A New Sign: the sign on the front of our building is old and faded. We would like to get a vibrant new one to catch everyone's attention
  • Day to Day Expenses: Rent and electricity eat up most, if not all, of our budget most months. These are the basic necessities to keep 1919 open. Last year, we managed to make the money from the fundraiser stretch all the way through the summer

Merch!

We are keeping it simple this year as far as gifts. Anyone who donates $30 or more gets a koozie, an Indiegogo contributer exclusive new T-Shirt, a new patch, a sticker and a tape compilation featuring bands that have played at 1919. The only way to get the shirt is to contribute here and everything will be ready in time for Xmas!.

Keep Punk Alive

1919 Hemphill is the longest running DIY space in Texas, and one of the oldest in the country. DIY spots are notoriously temporary and long-running spaces are very few and far between. Other than being a meeting space and venue, 1919 provides clothing and other resources to the community and is a safe space for people of all ages to find out about new bands and develop a love for music for its own sake.

Lend a Helping Hand

If you aren't able to contribute, we still need your help. We always need new furniture for the downstairs area, so if you have a clean couch or chair, let us know and we would love to take it. We also always need people to help clean up or offer us their skills for upkeep of the building. Just get ahold of one of us and we will let you know how to help.

Keep Punk Alive
1919 Hemphill is the longest running DIY space in Texas, and one of the oldest in the country. DIY spots are notoriously temporary and long-running spaces are very few and far between. Other than being a meeting space and venue, 1919 provides clothing and other resources to the community and is a safe space for people of all ages to find out about new bands and develop a love for music for its own sake.


Lend a Helping Hand
If you aren't able to contribute, we still need your help. We always need new furniture for the downstairs area, so if you have a clean couch or chair, let us know and we would love to take it. We also always need people to help clean up or offer us their skills for upkeep of the building. Just get ahold of one of us and we will let you know how to help.

story:
Blessings to everyone reading this message for help.

My name is Sue Thorn.  I am a best friend, mother and U.S. Marine Iraq War Veteran. 

After a very challenging two (2) year wait, my children and I now have a place of our very own to call home.  Motels and homeless shelters are now a thing of the past, and my family and I are very grateful.

Like many veterans returning home from Afghanistan and Iraq, I suffer from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  I've had many challenges both in Iraq and since my return to the States.

My life has been a series of losses.  In Iraq, I lost 4 of my comrades which troubles me to this day, and my grief will never go away.  My Papa passed away about the time that the school district that I worked for did a mass layoff because the funds were shrinking and many teachers, including myself lost their jobs.  I lost my job, my vehicle was then repossessed (unable to keep up payments), then my home and became homeless with little ones to care for.

My family and I now live in a great, but EMPTY house.  We have no furniture and I am still unemployed and lack the funds to buy any furniture.  We eat and sleep on the floor, the children sleep on crib mattresses and I on the carpet beside them.

Please help me to reach my goal of completely furnishing my home by February 2014.  It would be a great way to start the New Year (2014) and a great belated Christmas present to my children and I.

Thank you for taking the time to read this appeal for help.

Sue Thorn

story:
Investment Software for Everyone

Invest Safely - Profitably

Investing Is for Everyone, for You – Launch an investment program that offers everyone safe profitable investing or to grow a retirement account safely.

Funding that Can Benefit You and Your Friends

Launch our marketing campaign for an investment program that offers everyone safe profitable investing or to grow your retirement account safely.

I firmly believe investing is for everyone and yes, you can grow your retirement account safely.  Our software program, Dynamic Investor Pro, enables anyone to safely and profitably invest in the stock market or to effectively manage other people’s portfolios.

More than 100 people, 40% of them professional investment advisors, have tested the program.  Over the past four years and we have incorporated their suggestions to make Dynamic Investor Pro not just easy to use but also extremely powerful. And reknown market technician, author and columnist Michael Carr highly recommends Dynamic Investor Pro.

Our Vision - The Results - The Goal

As a former investment advisor I envisioned a program that would allow just about anyone to invest in the stock market with little time and without the need to be a stock market guru.  In other words, a program with a support system that anyone can learn in a few hours;  one that will help them avoid losing their money, their retirement, like happened to most people during the recent recession, and in fact enable anyone to grow their money at a strong growth rate. 

Last year our private and professions users’ recorded average gains of 13% with a range of 3 – 30% and 58% used the program weekly or even less frequently.

We are ready to launch Dynamic Investor Pro with nation-wide marketing.  We have developed a video and training videos, obtained marketing proposals from a number of established companies, and now we are ready to let everyone know and benefit. 

My partner and I have spent these last four years developing Dynamic Investor Pro because we simply believe every person should be able to buy stocks or mutual funds and ETFs and safe guard their retirement account or build wealth. Yes, we want to let everyone know it is possible and there is an easy software program for safe profitable investing.  Your funding will make this possible – both for yourself and anyone who desires financial security or an alternate way to make money (like a number of our test clients).

We have tailored rewards for you whether you are interested or not in taking control of your retirement account or investing in the stock market.  We offer various software packages or high quality exhibition quality photos, T-Shirts or other photo products from our favorite scenic place, Glacier National Park.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out.
  • email this link or forward this page to them:

story:
The Impact

There is a critical lack of safe, educational and vocational support, and community living for adults with developmental and neurological conditions. We propose to create a lively and inspiring place that would be a secure, permanent home, and will provide employment opportunities, for some of our more vulnerable local residents. The Concerto Project will also provide a home-like environment for young adults on the autism spectrum, where they will be provided with the support to develop independent living skills and work towards successfully returning to their communities, to be near their families and to achieve the happiest, most productive, rewarding, and independent lives possible.

The Concerto Project

Envisions a model for community that is an ongoing, creative collaboration among people at all points of the life spectrum, providing mutual support, engagement, and growth in a safe, active and sustainable environment.

Here, in the beautiful, resource-abundant Pacific Northwest, we want to create a fascinating and sustainable environment that would support young adults to achieve their potential. Anyone with a vulnerable family member or friend will tell you that their possibilities for community are very limited.

Find out more by reading our FAQ's at   http://www.concertoproject.org/faq.html

The Plans

  • The Concerto Project
    • will be supported by professionals who live as an extended family in new, specially-designed homes.
  • Local vulnerable community members will live here, as well as young adults who come to live at Concerto having the goal of returning to their home communities with the skills that will prepare them to be independent and fulfilled.
  • The Project will consist of 3-6 homes where members will each have an integral role in the sustainability of their environment.
  • Organic farming, small scale manufacturing for commerce, and business and intellectual property development skills will be pursued with vocational training and supports.
  • Therapeutic arts and activities will be supported by staff and local artists.
  • The land and the buildings will be preserved by a perpetual trust to ensure the sustainability of the Project
  • We have created a first level prospectus and gained the support of many gifted professionals, who have encouraged us to pursue The Concerto Project.
  • Phase One:
    • Our first goal for funding is $2500-$7000, which will provide for the creation of the 501(c)(3) nonprofit foundation that will develop and support the Project. The funds will also allow for the completion of our research of several communities in other regions of the US that serve young adults in achieving sustainable independence through supported living, vocational training and continuing education.
  • Many hours of donated planning and development have gone into The Concerto Project already. Committed individuals have expressed interest in serving on the board of directors, performing program research and development, assisting in the acquisition of property, facilitating appropriate design and environmental considerations and helping to achieve full project funding with the creation of the future endowment.
  • Phase Two:
    • Our second goal for funding is $50,000, which will provide for project and program development. Mahlum Architects of Seattle, specialists in sustainable living and learning environments, will produce architectural renderings. The budget will be developed. Search for staff will begin.
  • Phase Three:
    • Funding goal of $7M will be achieved. The land will be secured, through donation or purchase. Staff will begin to be hired.
  • Phase Four:
    • Design, construction plans and permitting will begin.
  • Phase Five:
  • Build and furnish.
  • Phase Six:
    • Move-in.
  • During all Phases: Program development and recruitment.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please send our link to friends and family who are familiar with the need for this kind of opportunity and who will love being a part of something wonderful!
  • http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/concerto-a-life-spectrum-residential-project/x/5072811
  • https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Concerto-Project/275113819317670
  • http://youtu.be/JbxFas4zTJU
  • http://www.concertoproject.org/faq.html
  • To learn more about Ramapo for Children  http://www.ramapoforchildren.org/our-work/staff-assistant-experience
  • To learn more about Mahlum   http://www.mahlum.com/
  • Visit The Art of Autism   http://the-art-of-autism.com/  for inspiring images and stories of the artists represented.
  • Visit The Rocket Family Chronicles for an entertaining and enlightening peek into the home of Rocket, a teen with autism. Challenges notions with humor and insight.  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2914810/
  • Autism Now series #6, panel discussion with Robert McNeil on the issue of addressing support for adults on the autism spectrum:  http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/health-jan-june1...
  • Ask us to put you on our mailing list for Project updates.
  • Visit our site regularly at www.concertoproject.org

story:
On #GivingTuesday we are looking to raise money for our programs so that we can continue to support the single parents that need our services.

For every $20 we raise during December 3 #GivingTuesday Indiegogo will contribute $1.

Singleton™ Moms provides a number of free services to single parents undergoing treatment for cancer in the Phoenix Metropolitan area. 

  • Care Coordinator/Care Team: Volunteers support the day-to-day needs of the entire family through cleaning projects and emotional support. 
  • Singleton Kitchen: Volunteers prepare healthy, meals that are then distributed to the families we serve. 
  • Singleton Pockets:Our financial assistance program Bare Necessities: Household items donated by the community and distributed on a first come first serve basis. 
  • Singleton Kids: Quarterly events and grant making program for the children of the parents we serve. 
  • Singleton Santa: Our annual Holiday Family Adoption participated by groups and companies in the community and benefiting the families we serve. 
  • Singleton Phonebook & Resources: Businesses and professionals that offer our parents their services at no cost. 

"I will never be able to thank Singleton Moms enough for all you have done for me and my boys. I'm grateful that our relationship has grown and that I'm not just a mom you've helped but a friend." Mom Netis 

Our goal during #GivingTuesday is to raise $2500 to help support our programs. Every little bit helps so please donate! 

Donate Bare Necessities

Another way to help on #GivingTuesday is to visit our office on Tuesday December 3rd and donate Bare Necessities for our monthly drives.  

Every other month Singleton Moms hosts a Bare Necessities Drive at our office. We all know how expensive a trip to Wal-Mart or Target can be when you are trying to replenish household necessities. Through the help of generous community donors, the Bare Necessities program allows Singleton Parents to come by the Singleton Moms office and pick up much needed household necessities such as laundry detergent, paper towels, toilet paper, toothbrushes, etc.

The Bare Necessities program helps to reduce the financial burden that is associated with restocking practical household supplies.

Thank you!
The Singleton Moms Team

Our office address is 
7579 E Main St, #700
Scottsdale, AZ 85251

Opening Hours
Monday to Friday 9am - 1pm
Saturday 10am - 2pm

Telephone: 480.818.5285
Email: contact@singletonmoms.org

Singleton Moms is a 501c3 #35-2280372.

story:
(Videos will be added as we progress in development)


Just how far in the know do you want to be? Welcome to the ins and outs of the cities and towns. Welcome to knowing exactly what's going on and when. To being the one that has it all figured out and not being left out of the know. In the digital age this is how it can be done. So grab some friends. Make an outing of it. Hit your stride and get in on it all. Boring doesn't live here. Only VIPs do.


Our Story

The Localstride team consists of talented engineers, programmers, and marketers looking to create something different than just another directory or daily deal site. We are working on a social experiment called Localstride. The main focus is to connect communities and local activities together that share a common interest. We are working to solve the question we have all sat and wondered; "What can I do today, tonight, this weekend, whenever??" Localstride is based on the idea that people want to be part of something special, something unique. To stay informed and at the same time share it with like-minded people. We are developing a service that allows people to gain access to information and perks to those things that interest them most. This will be anything from live music, outdoor recreation, sporting events, dining specials, arts and festivals, charity events; really any form of entertainment and activity that can be found locally that may interest you. It will also be a hub for you to discover and follow local bands and venues that match your selected music genre preferences. We are looking to raise funding so that we can take time from our current responsibilities and dedicate our full attention to writing the programming around the recommendation engine and finalizing the User Interface around this logic for the website and applications. Funding will also go to database, equipment costs, and other expenses included in starting an online business.


First Stage City Potentials:

Austin, TX

Dallas, TX

New York, NY

Los Angeles, CA

Chicago, IL

Atlanta, GA

Washington D.C.

Philadelphia, PA

Nashville, TN

San Francisco, CA

Las Vegas, NV

Phoenix, AZ

Birmingham, AL

Any many more..


Reward Points


Localstride users will have the ability to earn rewards by staying active and sharing with others. These rewards come in the shape of reward points which can be used as a virtual currency within Localstride at the member's discretion to purchase event tickets and special offers, or donate to local charity and non-profit organization partners. Reward points may be earned by signing up new members, sharing special offers with others, and "checking-in" to events and organizations.

10 Reward Points = $1 Localstride



Imagine

A service that brings you what you want before you ask for it. A service that you can use to plan your social calendar. A service that you can use to gather friends together to enjoy shared experiences. Imagine being a member of a group that receives benefits that others donâ€™t. This is LocalStride. A web-based service, much like a concierge that offers members desired social experiences, event information and perks, and valuable discounts based upon personal interests. From concerts to dinner to movies to events, LocalStride delivers access to the experiences you are interested in living.


Ways You Can Help


Become a contributor by clicking the green â€œContribute Nowâ€ button on the right.


Spread the Word. Post to Facebook, Twitter, send emails to friends, post to LinkedIn.


This is a service for You so comments and feedback are welcome. "Like" us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. Keep an eye out for periodic updates on our Facebook, Twitter and IndieGoGo page and our website:

www.localstride.com.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

 

It certainly seems that no one gives a sh1t about single parents trying their utmost best to lovingly raise their children with next to nothing.

 

SHAME on every last one of you that turned blind eyes to us instead of helping us out.

 

May Karma redeem the great many of you.

 

 

 

The Impact

 

 Karma will right the wrongs of the many that look away from a single parent in need and their children.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

 IF you decide you want to help us, don't bother contributing via this site. I will send you an address to which you can mail your contribution to us. I'm also with paypal and Western Union, Email Money Transfers... there are many ways you can contribute and not waste money through this site. For every dollar I have been blessed with through igg - they've taken NINE CENTS.
