story:
Something from the in-flight menu?


Hello! I am Nikos and I am launching a website all about the world of airline buy on board menus, and I want to go 'undercover' on 23 flights to rate/taste and review airline food. The website will showcase over 60 airlines worldwide who offer some form of buy on board meal options for passengers. All airlines will be featured on my website, and you have the opportunity to make this research project happen! The research will also help me to continue writing articles about airline food options for passengers. (http://blog.apex.aero/inflight-services-2/economy-class-passengers-dine-class/) You tube videos will be compiled for each airline experience, and uploaded to my channel from April/May this year. All donations no matter how big or small (unless you want to remain anonymous) will be featured on the Inflight Feed website for the rest of the year. It will display the perk chosen by you, and your information. If you wish not to be featured just let me know!


Not a sightseeing trip! 


The project is a 27,833km journey on 23 airlines across Europe to sample as many different airline buy on board food options. Once complete all the data will be used to inform passengers of what's available to eat on various airlines, as well as what options vegetarians, gluten free, diabetic and religious passengers can eat! A blog will feature my travels and each airline that I fly on whilst I also check quality/presentation, taste, price and service delivery. On each flight I will conduct research, and purchase/sample meals whilst documenting each experience with you. This project is a perfect way to review airlines myself, get a little media attention for my website, whilst hopefully benefiting a charity too!


Possible Route Map Across Europe, does not include all flights, example only.


I am passionate about airlines and especially airline food. I was fortunate enough to spend the last 8 years working in the airline industry. The idea for the website came about whilst working at an airline, passengers would complain about the lack of food items on the menu, their complaints went unheard. So the idea was born, a platform for passengers to review their experiences with airline buy on board options, as well as an information source for future travelers to stay informed about their dining options.


I hope to fly anywhere from 3 to 5 sectors per day with different airlines, sampling their menu options, sleeping at airport hotels, or sometimes returning home the same day if possible. The flights would be split up into mini trips covering vast areas over a period of time. Flights should take place March/April 2012. The trip will see me stopping in Hamburg on the 27th March for 3 days to coincide, and visit, the World Travel Catering & Onboard services expo. http://www.worldtravelcateringexpo.com


The Journey
A 27,883km (approx) airline flying journey across Europe flying with 23 of the following 30 airlines: Aer Lingus, Air Baltic, Air Berlin, Air Europa, Blue1, bmibaby, Brussels Airlines, Cimber Sterling, Condor, easyJet, Finnair, NIKI, Flybe, Germanwings, Helvetic Airways, Iberia, Icelandair, Iceland Express, Jet2, KLM, Monarch Airlines, Norwegian Air Shuttle, Ryanair, SAS,Thomson Airways, Transavia.com, TUIfly, Condor, Vueling and Wizz Air.

Note the original idea included flying onto North America and conducting a further 15 flights with airlines in Canada and the USA, meaning the trip would be around 60,000km! I felt it was more realistic to try and raise funds for the European portion at least!

Why?
Our friends at Branding Aero in New York (picture above) conducted some of the very first inflight reviews on our behalf, highlighting dining options for passengers on several US based airlines. With funding the project will be able to review many more airlines, these reviews are then used to provide passengers with information, tips, reviews, and premium dining options. I am not worried about the destinations I will fly to, that's not important. What is important is to fly on as many different airlines as possible. 

The Impact


On Airlines

I believe this will have an impact on airlines, raise more awareness of their menus, and hopefully show that not all airline meals are the same. I want to show passengers that there are great options out there to choose from.

I don't believe that anyone has ever completed a trip such as this before, so it would be the first of its kind. 


Charity

Just like your local fun run, I am trying to raise awareness of my flying trip. Ideally I would like to be able to donate some serious money (through a sponsor) from this event to a charity that possibly deals with hunger.

 

If I fly 27,000km and ask a sponsor to sponsor me anywhere from 0.25 cents to 0.50cents per kilometer flown, this could be a nice donation of anywhere between $6,500 to  $13,500 for a charity. Just need the sponsor first!! I have made a few submissions already.


I am open to suggestions from my community, so talk to me and let me know what you think!




What I need

The funds are to cover most of the cost of flights, inflight meal purchases, and travel expenses incurred during the project. Approximate figures are below, I have conducted research into flight sectors and approximate costings. If full funding is not reached, only part of the project can be completed. Depending on the funds donated I may be able to sample a few different airlines only.


Approximate cost breakdowns

Europe 23 flights to purchase approximate cost â‚¬ 1872. Average ticket price â‚¬78 per flight.

Hotel costs: Will require airport accommodation for up to 8 nights â‚¬560.

Inflight Meal Purchases: â‚¬483 euro, average flight spend â‚¬21.

I plan to also purchase a meal for the person sitting next to me on some flights, surprise and delight them!

Reward costs: To come out of own pocket.

Misc Travel Costs: To come out of own pocket.

Total approximate cost of project:  â‚¬2915/USD$3695.


What you get?

A chance to help fund this amazing research project, and a reward for you based on your donation!  

By donating, you are making this dream happen for me.

Access to videos and photos well before anyone sees them on the website!

The chance to follow me in my travels, and learn about the various options these airlines offer.

A behind the scenes look at how this trip will come about, regular updates for all that donate. 

A new friend, who will be forever thankful & grateful to you, and don't forget your rewards!!


Please don't forget to share the love and promote this project with your friends on Facebook & Twitter, thanks in advance :)

story:
Brewery Creek Community Garden is a project steered by a friendly bunch of folks from the Mount Pleasant neighbourhood. Our goal is help meet the increasing demands for urban agriculture, while building community. The garden was designed through a series of community workshops and has been recently approved by the Vancouver Parks Board. We are building the garden for the start of the 2012 growing season.  

Our goal is for each of our 40 members to invite 10 friends or family members to donate $10, for a total of $4,000!  This money will be enough to buy the materials we need to build the basic features of the garden and get us digging and growing this season!  We have lots of volunteers and always welcome more!  

Even before the garden comes into existence, the Brewery Creek Community Garden group has become active in bringing together neighbours and community members from Mount Pleasant to talk about food security, planting seeds and building community.  We have partnerships with great organizations like Mount Pleasant Neighbourhood House and the Mount Pleasant Branch of the Vancouver Public Library, and we're working with the Parents Advisory Committee at Mount Pleasant Elementary School to find ways to bring the garden experience to children and families in the neighbourhood.

By supporting Brewery Creek Community Gardens you are supporting:

  • stronger communities
  • urban agriculture
  • youth food awareness programs
  • urban beautification
  • permaculture programs
  • immigrant integration programs
  • making urban parks a safer space

Please consider giving $10 or more to help us build Brewery Creek Community Garden and use the indiegogo share tools to share this message with your friends and family.  Please contact us directly if you want to be involved in the garden, donate materials like a shed, or find out more about our garden workshops at the Vancouver Public Library.  Email: brewerycreekgarden@gmail.com  

Thanks for checking us out and happy growing!

story:
Share our campaign using any of the tools above^^^ and you have a chance to win an assortment of our herbal products! Let us know you shared at www.facebook.com/simplediaper

Who We Are

Simple Diaper & Linen (formerly Mother Herb Diaper Service) is a Northampton, MA based business driven by a passion for working with communities to benefit the environment, family health, and our economy. We are cooperatively-owned and mother-operated. We provide diapering alternatives that reduces waste and improves the comfort and health of your children. Our energy-efficient machines, chemical-free laundering, and local delivery by bicycle supports our mission of eco-sustainability. Our services include:

  • cloth & compostable diaper services
  • commercial linen service
  • 100% chemical & fragrance fee laundering 
  • Pickup and delivery to your door step!

But we do ALL of this in a basement!

Our current space provides us with many limitations. Our small residential machines limit our capacity to serving only 30 families and 3 linen clients and we have minimal storage and workspace. Moving to a commercial space with HUGE commercial machines will significantly increase our capacity and our productivity (and lets us see the light of day!) We will be able to expand our services from four towns to an entire region including The greater Springfield, Holyoke, Northampton, and Greenfield areas (even Brattelboro, VT!) that have been asking for our service to come to them for years.

The Mamas

Angie Gregory and Jessica Montagna are two mothers who are committed to building a service that makes low-impact diapering easy, affordable, and flexible for those early years of parenting (Jessica is a former satisfied client!). We strive to create living wages for our family of worker-owners and bulid a vast network of support and advocay for sustaibable diapering in our community. Together we bring over 15 years of experience and expertise in cloth diapering, natural parenting, and environmental stewardship.

What We Need

Your help is critical to our expansion and every dollar you contribute will be matched by a very generous donor! After years of business planning we have been approved for a loan, and need to close a gap of $19,000 for the loan to be released! This portion will support the purchase of our new cloth diaper inventory -our first order - a whopping 12,000 cloth diapers and wipes!

But, if we don't reach our Indiegogo goal by the deadline...your contribution will be refunded, our donor won't make their match, our lender will not lend to us, and we'll be stuck in the basement!

Not only will your support come with some fun perks, but it will also come with our most sincere thanks and a tangible mark on the movement away from wasteful diapering!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any amount you can contribute financially, but there are also other ways for you to support Simple Diaper & Linen.

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Donate your skills and expertise with us! During renovations of our new space we will need plumbing work, carpentry, help prepping all of the cloth diapers, and help moving!

story:
My Story

My name is Antoinette Douglas Hall, I live in San Francisco, and I was born in the UK to West Indian parents. 

I have worked in the photography industry as a Producer for over 10 years, on commercial advertising & editorial shoots.  I am really excited to be a part of this opportunity, a project where my photographic images can provide support, raise hope and contribute to an amazing cause.

I am going to show support and raise awareness for a condition called Obstetric Fistula.  As a photographer I will be capturing images to record the emotional journey of the women and bring attention to the issue. 

I will go to Ethiopia on the 21st November for 12 days with a team called Salaam Garage where each team member will create an individual project to support the Ethiopian women with obstetric fistula and raise the profile of the Hamlin Hospital who deeply care for these women.

Obstetric FISTULA is a preventable condition that can occur to women during childbirth leaving the women in a state of permanent incontinence of urine and or feces. This condition can often leave them ostracized from their families and communities with no support.  The Hamlin Hospital in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia is making a difference.

The Project

I plan to exhibit, then create and publish a book.  The proceeds from these 2 events will go directly to the Hospital.  

 

The hospital treats 2000 women every year but thousands more go untreated.  The majority of these women that are left untreated live in rural areas and either they cannot make the journey, cannot afford it or have not heard about the hospital.

 

With financial support they can build more outreach posts in rural locations and train more staff.  As a result many more women will have treatment or support posts closer to them and aid will be increasingly more accessible.  With these efforts we hope to raise the number of women treated by The Hamlin Hospital.

 

My project will explore the huge gift a successful surgery can bring.  Support, community and family are needs that welcome the women at the Hamlin Hospital and I wish to capture that joy and hope.  This project will happen, but to what extent will depend on your support.

Please donate what you can and spread the word to all your family and friends.

 

Thanks!!

story:
Short Summary

Our colleague Will (Grapes Oh in SL) is experiencing some challenging family times. He has taken an unpaid leave to return home to assist in caring for his terminally ill father. Additionally, his brother is severely disabled, compounding the responsibilities for the family. With his reduced income and the current family challenges, we want to raise some money for them to enjoy this special Christmas together and lessen the stress they are all experiencing. Your donation of any amount will be presented to the family as a Christmas surprise.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised during the campaign will be given directly to Will to support his family. Everyone who donates will be listed on a giant Christmas card when the funds are presented.

The Impact

We hope that this campaign will help Will and his family focus on the joys of being together, even amidst the turmoil and sadness they are all experiencing. The Christmas season is a time of togetherness and a time of miracles. Our aim with this campaign is to provide a little bit of magic for Will and his family, so they can experience the breadth of caring that his colleagues, friends, and associates, feel towards him. We want to help the family feel that caring in a tangible manner, and we believe that any money we can provide to them will lend some relief from their current burden. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know many people are in need this holiday season, and we completely understand that not everyone can contribute financially. Every dollar adds up, so even a modest donation is valuable to this campaign. Other ways you can help are by:

• Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

• Send this campaign to other people who know Will personally.

• Post this campaign on social media sites by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story: Randal Gilder, a beloved husband, cherished son, exemplary fraternity brother, and inspiring coach, passed away the morning of July 19, 2012 due to complications from a cardiac arrest 5 days prior.  For 20 years, Randal was diagnosed with FMS (Familial Mediterranean Fever).  However, 6 months ago it was found that he did not have FMS.  Since then he has been in and out of the hospital, incurring many medical bills totaling over $180,000 that now fall to his family to pay. Please consider donating to this cause to relieve the financial stress and allow the family to properly grieve.

story:
Did you know that Kentuckians are exposed to thousands of toxic chemicals every day, from the air we breathe and the products we use and enjoy every day?

It's true!  Of the 80,000+ chemicals in the U.S. today, fewer than 1% have actually been tested for safety. Big chemical companies are relying on us to think this isn't a problem, but toxic chemical exposures are linked to cancer, reproductive disorders, birth defects, learning and developmental disabilities, obesity and other chronic diseases that Kentuckians face. 

We don't want cancer-causing chemicals in our couches and chairs.  We don't want fat-forming chemicals in food cans.  What about chemicals linked to birth defects in our baby products? Asthma from air pollution inside and outisde?  No way. 

If you value a safe, clean environment and healthy families, NOW is the time for swift action!  Legislation is moving through Congress right now that would require more rigorous testing of chemicals before they get into products, help clean-up contaminated communities and reward companies that switch to safer chemicals.  State policy makers can take action, too. 
 

Your generous donation to the Kentucky Environmental Foundation...

will enable us to educate and engage Kentuckians all over the state to advocate government for more protection from toxic chemical exposures, urge companies to transition to safer chemicals, and inspire personal actions to stop the build-up of toxics in the environment and our bodies.

 
The need to reduce exposure to toxic chemicals and cut health care costs has never been more important.  Together, with your support, we can create a safer, healthier future for all Kentuckians.  
 
Please make a generous donation today!
 
********

About the Kentucky Environmental Foundation

KEF is a non-profit organization dedicated to securing solutions to environmental problems in a manner, which safeguards human health, promotes environmental justice, preserves ecological systems and encourages sustainability.

 
KEF will use funds to develop new educational tools; identify and support community educators to reach out to parents, health professionals and business leaders, organizations and the media on ways to implement healthier solutions to toxic chemical contamination, air and water pollution; and activate advocacy campaigns to hold governments and companies accountable for protecting our health. 

********

Other Ways You Can Help

Once you've made a donation, and even if you can't, please help us get the word out and make some noise around this campaign.  Please use Indiegogo's share tools to help spread the word... they're quck and easy!
story_txt:
Did you know that Kentuckians are exposed to thousands of toxic chemicals every day, from the air we breathe and the products we use and enjoy every day?
It's true!  Of the 80,000+ chemicals in the U.S. today, fewer than 1% have actually been tested for safety. Big chemical companies are relying on us to think this isn't a problem, but toxic chemical exposures are linked to cancer, reproductive disorders, birth defects, learning and developmental disabilities, obesity and other chronic diseases that Kentuckians face. 
We don't want cancer-causing chemicals in our couches and chairs.  We don't want fat-forming chemicals in food cans.  What about chemicals linked to birth defects in our baby products? Asthma from air pollution inside and outisde?  No way. 
If you value a safe, clean environment and healthy families, NOW is the time for swift action!  Legislation is moving through Congress right now that would require more rigorous testing of chemicals before they get into products, help clean-up contaminated communities and reward companies that switch to safer chemicals.  State policy makers can take action, too. 
 

Your generous donation to the Kentucky Environmental Foundation...

will enable us to educate and engage Kentuckians all over the state to advocate government for more protection from toxic chemical exposures, urge companies to transition to safer chemicals, and inspire personal actions to stop the build-up of toxics in the environment and our bodies.
 
The need to reduce exposure to toxic chemicals and cut health care costs has never been more important.  Together, with your support, we can create a safer, healthier future for all Kentuckians.  

 
Please make a generous donation today!
 
********
About the Kentucky Environmental Foundation 
KEF is a non-profit organization dedicated to securing solutions to environmental problems in a manner, which safeguards human health, promotes environmental justice, preserves ecological systems and encourages sustainability.
 
KEF will use funds to develop new educational tools; identify and support community educators to reach out to parents, health professionals and business leaders, organizations and the media on ways to implement healthier solutions to toxic chemical contamination, air and water pollution; and activate advocacy campaigns to hold governments and companies accountable for protecting our health. 

********
Other Ways You Can Help


Once you've made a donation, and even if you can't, please help us get the word out and make some noise around this campaign.  Please use Indiegogo's share tools to help spread the word... they're quck and easy!

story:
Jeff Mizanskey is serving life without parole for marijuana. 

He was sentenced under Missouri's "prior and persistent drug offender" statute. Jeff was convicted of three marijuana-only felonies between 1984 and 1994, and was sentenced to life without parole at the discretion of the judge. None of his arrests involved children, violence, or weapons of any kind. 

Jeff has been incarcerated for 21 years at a maximum security prison in Jefferson City, MO. If the Governor of Missouri doesn't grant him clemency, Jeff will likely die in prison. He has exhausted all of his other appeals and options. 
In the time he's been in prison, he's seen convicted murderers and rapists come and go- including Ronald W Greer, a rapist who was released due to overcrowding before promptly re-offending and committing an additional rape. When rapists are released to make room for nonviolent marijuana offenders, its a sure sign the system isn't working. 
During Jeff's time in prison, he has taken nearly every community program offered. He works full-time in prison building furniture, and has been given the responsibility of training new workers and inmates in his craft. Even the prosecutor who sent Jeff to prison for life now believes he should be released. This year, he sent a letter to Governor Nixon asking him to grant clemency; he believes Jeff has paid his debt to society. 
Jeff has a wonderfully supportive family, including grandchildren he has never had the opportunity to know outside the walls of prison. This campaign is raising $21,000 to campaign for his release via clemency ($1000 for each year Jeff has spent in a maximum security prison for marijuana). 
The Campaign

$21,000 will allow us to bring Jeff's story to every corner of the state. This campaign serves two purposes- to make people aware of this injustice, and to motivate them to contact the Governor asking him to grant clemency. 

If a new opportunity to litigate for Jeff's freedom arises, funds raised may be allocated in part to hire a lawyer for Jeff. If this occurs, remaining funds will be distributed proportionally among the four categories below. If no additional legal opportunities arise, all $21,000  raised will be distributed as follows:

  • $8,000 designated for radio/tv ads (recorded by Jeff)
  • $4,000 for online advertising 
  • $2,000 for print advertising
  • $7,000 designated for high-traffic interstate billboards

    This billboard currently resides on I-70 near Sedalia, where Jeff was arrested. Right now, it's the only one in the state- but with your help we can change that.

story:
Experience new cultures & improve your language skills in a relaxed and friendly environment. No more classrooms, no more verb tables, no more tests: 1-to-1 conversations with native speakers from around the world in the best bars across town. 

www.franglish.eu  


Franglish is a language exchange event that offers language learners of all different levels a unique opportunity to practice and improve a foreign language. Each event consists of a series of 15-minute 1-to-1 conversations during which half the time you speak in English and the other half in another language giving both native speakers the chance to practice their foreign language. It's up to you what you talk about – there are no rules! At the end of the 15 minutes, you are directed to a new table where you meet a different partner, and so on for 2 hours. The events will be held at carefully chosen bars around town to ensure a chilled-out, no-pressure environment.

SO IT'S SPEED-DATING, RIGHT?

No. Well, that's not the aim. But we would expect an invitation to the wedding...

Seriously though, Franglish is not an after-work nor some sort of new-age approach speed dating: this is a social event that allows you to discover new languages and new cultures.

Since its launch in Paris in 2010, Franglish has proven to be extremely popular. Since then we have been able to spread the concept to a number of towns and cities across France and the UK. Driven by our belief that language learning should be accessible to absolutely everyone, we want our events to be FREE. The money you donate will help us launch free English/French and English/Spanish events in New York by November 2014. Your contributions will go towards the initial start-up costs including venue-hire, the purchase of essential event materials and promotion of Franglish in and around New York.


Encouraged by our success across Europe, we've decided it's time to take Franglish across the pond. Our concept is new, it's unique and it's exciting: there's nothing like this on offer in New York. Our Paris events are also especially popular with American tourists and expats, many of whom have suggested we launch in the US. You can't get much more cosmopolitan than New York, but getting to know foreigners as a local is often easier said than done. Similarly, tourists and expats can find it difficult to strike up conversation with locals. Franglish offers the perfect solution.


We have big ambitions to make our unique concept available to as many people as possible. Eventually, we hope to offer events for many different languages in towns and cities across America and Europe.

All contributors will be offered V.I.P tickets to our New York premiere, after which they will be given the chance to fill in a short feedback questionnaire. As a supporter, you will therefore help to shape the future development of the Franglish concept.


STEVEN ANNONZIATA & NICOLAS SAUREL: Co-founders of Franglish.

FEDERICA BELTRAMONE: Event organiser. Trilingual Italian/French/English

AUDREY COUPRIE: Marketing and event organiser. Bilingual French/English

CAMILLA FREEMAN: Marketing & Communications (English/French/Spanish)

SOFIA WILSON: Marketing & Communications (Spanish/English/French/German)


As an expression of our gratitude for your belief in our project, we've got some great Franglish perks on offer.

V.I.P TICKETS

Join us at the Franglish New York premiere, organised excusively for our contributors. No need to book, we'll put you straight on the list!

PRIORITY BOOKING

Guaranteed place at Franglish events, so you don't need to worry about signing up long in advance!

T-SHIRTS

*we will email to confirm choice/size, to be collected at Franglish New York premiere

BUMPER STICKERS

* 11.5 x 3.75 inches (approx dimensions). We will email to confirm choice, to be collected at Franglish New York premiere

LUXURY DINNER PACKAGE

Enjoy an exquisite three-course dinner for two at a top French restaurant in central New York.

If you've got this far, thank you. We really hope we've convinced you to dig deep into your pockets and donate to the campaign, but even if you can't make a contribution, please help spread the word about Franglish: like us, follow us, tweet us or talk about us!

story:
Moroccans, Peace Corps Volunteers and YOU:

Partners in Gender Equality

Association de Bienfaisance pour le Développement et la Solidarite and Association Oxygene, working with Peace Corps-Morocco's Gender and Development Committee are excited to announce our 2014 Gender Advocate Training, bringing together Moroccans and Peace Corps Volunteers from all over the country to advance the cause of gender equality in Morocco. 

Why? 

Gender inequality is a global challenge and one that we believe is important to address here in Morocco. A report two years ago showed that female participation in the labor market did not exceed 25% at the time, and that 80% of young females from the countryside drop out of school between grades 1 and 6. Moroccans from all corners of the country have recognized the prevalence of gender inequality and are looking for ways to address them.

There have been notable victories in recent years through the changes in the Family Code laws that have greatly expanded the rights of women. Although we celebrate these victories, we know that there is more work to be done. This project will allow us to capitalize on the current momentum and begin to affect change at the local level through a grassroots approach.

We need your help to train the next change agents here in Morocco. 

How?

We will bring together 30 Moroccans and their Peace Corps Volunteer counterparts for a three-day workshop to work with both Peace Corps Volunteers and Moroccans on how to address gender issues in their communities. Activities include:

  • Discussion of gender issues facing Morocco in general and individual communities in particular.
  • How to assess where your community is and where progress can be made
  • How to identify resources to tackle gender issues
  • Strategies for being a Gender Advocate
  • A tool-kit on Gender Advocacy

At the end of the training, each Moroccan + Volunteer team will be given a tool-kit to take back to their community and present in their youth center, women's center, school or other community gathering place.

The tool-kit is designed to give Moroccans and Volunteers a launch pad for gender work in their community and to give Moroccans the resources they need to continue the work with or without future Peace Corps Volunteers to assist them. 

In addition, each Moroccan participant will now have a network of 29 other Moroccans throughout the country who they can turn to for advice and information.

Who?

Association de Bienfaisance pour le Développement et la Solidarite and Association Oxygene are partnering with the Peace Corps-Morocco Gender and Development Committee to produce this training. All three organizations have experience doing on the ground work to benefit Moroccans and a track record of success. Past projects include:

  • Association de Bienfaisance pour le Développement et la Solidarite has worked with USAID and the Peace Corps to develop a boys' empowerment camp. They have also partnered with Morocco's Ministry of Education to create a literacy program for women in rural communities.
  • Association Oxygene has been widely recognized throughout Morocco for it's powerful work with women in Ouarzazate and surrounding communities. Oxygene has worked with the United Nations Development Program and the Global Fund for Women to teach women entrepreneurship and business skills.
  • Peace Corps Morocco's Gender and Development committee has been recognized by U.S. Peace Corps in 2013 as one of the agency’s highest performing Gender and Development Working groups.  The Gender and Development committee recently produced a documentary on sexual harassment called, "Breaking the Silence," which has been screened throughout Morocco.

What We Need & Why We Need It

$4,600 will cover the full training for 60 people. This includes:
  •  Travel for workshop participants from all over Morocco to convene in one of two locations (Fez, home of the world's oldest oldest university or Ouarzazate, home of the set for the City of Pentos in Game of Thrones!)
  • Food and beverage for all participants. This includes the approximately 72 gallons of sweet mint tea that the average person in Morocco consumes in any 24-hour period
  • All materials for the Gender Advocate Toolkit, Resource Development plans, and community assessment tools our Gender Advocates will receive.
  • Translation services so that language is not a barrier to participating in the Gender Advocate Training

The Impact

We dream big. Our ultimate goal is nothing less than full gender equality throughout Morocco. 

But schwiya b schwiya (little by little) as we say in Morocco. So for now we will expect to unleash a group of gender advocates who are ready and willing to get to work in their communities ASAP.

2014 is our first training but we hope to continue this training in years to come, moving from 30 people to 60 to 90 to hundreds and then thousands! 

In the meantime, we'll focus on our first group of 30. Not only will the participants return to their local communities as advocates for gender equality, but also as resource developers and community facilitators, all of which has potential to yield significant grassroots level impact. They will implement gender equality initiatives and lead gender-related activities with 600+ youth upon their return, and they will have the tools to develop their own, more effective, gender-based resources for use by Moroccans all over the country. 

The sky is the limit for impact, and our confidence and expectations are high. 

Risks & Challenges

This is our first training. It's possible that we will discover some challenges with the format or with the materials. Some areas we already know to watch for potential problems:

  • Ensuring equal participation between men and women. We believe that men and women both need to be part of the conversation on gender equality.
  • Addressing gender issues within different cultural contexts: Morocco is one country but we have a lot of diversity. Gender issues in Arab vs. Amazight (Berber) culture or urban vs. rural communities may be too numerous to address in one training.
  • Sustainability: While we want to train Peace Corps Volunteers as well as Moroccans, the program is designed to make sure that gender advocacy continues beyond the length of a Peace Corps Volunteers' two-year assignment. But we know that some Moroccans may still have difficulty launching work after their counterpart has left the community.

All of these issues have been discussed by the Association de Bienfaisance pour le Développement et la Solidarite and Association Oxygene and our partners on the GAD Committee and we will be monitoring this training and doing follow-up to evaluate our success, tweaking the program as needed in future years.

story:
En español más abajo o pulse aquí

At CUSTODIUM we work on location. We made a simple GPS tracking device and all the software around to have a complete system.

4 solved problems and a solution to many others

In CUSTODIUM we work in location and GPS tracking. During the development of our devices and systems, we found 4 basic problems:

Out of range location

In outside location and open areas the GPS is very useful but when we are in indoor areas the GPS signal lose coverage. As well as, in rural area the GPS works properly, however the mobile networks don´t have enough coverage.

So that's why we thought about reinforce our device with wireless networks widely used such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee...

Custom IoT include the use of these networks for WIRELESS COMMUNICATION

Self-sufficiency

In general, the electronic devices have a lack of self-sufficiency, that sooner or later run out and it's necessary to recharge it. This matter especially affects when it refers to apps that have to go on months or years.

To solve this problem we thought in adding recharge systems based on renowable energies.

Therefore Custom IoT could supply with any power source that provide electric energy, mini-solar, micro-wind, dynamos... WE ARE GREEN!

Secure data



When we operate with data position the limit is to lose them, so that it's necessary to make back-up copies knowing where the data are to recover them.

In Custodim we send the data to the cloud to save copies but not always there is connection to send it.

To solve it we include a memory card. As a result, Custom IoT save the data, it doesn't matter small or big data, the most important is to save data. SECURE DATA!

Feel & act

We think the location is important, but we could go further away adding information from sensors to use in health, work security, environment information...

We included a high number of useful sensors and actuators to solve the problem.

Thus, Custom IoT has serial ports of sensors and actuators that could be useful in an important quantity of different scenes. FEEL & ACT!


What is custom IoT? 


          

"Custom IoT" is a Swiss knife device for the IoT.  Is a tailor-made device, achieved in a practical size to make mobility much easier. All the uses that you can imagine!

 www.customiot.info


Bits doing things:

bits & environment  


Related to environment, Custom IoT could be use as a smart garden and smart vegetable patch.

Also in meteorological office and other functions related with environmental protection: forecast and monitor the impact of natural aspects.

bits & home


Our Custom IoT device is very functional in home automation. Thanks to the sensors and actuators it could be very useful. 

Imagine uses such as communication, comfort, security, energy saving, etc. As well as with the IoT (Internet of Things) there are multiple aspects related to connectivity of assets.

bits & energy 



In Custodium we believe in green energies so that Custom IoT is powered by clean energy such as mini solar, micro-wind, micro-peltier. We refer to the efficiency and environmental compatibility of the power supply. 

This have a great potential especially in the field of electric mobility.

bits & health 


With reference to health, Custom IoT could be very helpful also. 

For example, it could monitor temperature of patients that are in quarantine because they may have ebola virus disease. It will send a constant signal to the hospital to control the patient from their home. Our team is working on it. 

As well as, it could has applications in e-health, Public health or in sports.

Features and benefits:

Sheet product and areas of applicability/uses. See more at: www.customiot.info

Uses:

The next days we are going to publish some ideas of uses with Custom IoT.

FIRST IDEA!

OPEN GARDEN: http://www.instructables.com/id/EKNXDHXI2LMF7I4/

SECOND IDEA!

HEART RATE with custom IoT: Example in instructables

THIRD IDEA!

COLOR MUSIC with custom IoT: see the example


What we need and what you get?

We need 33.000€ to achieve our project.

With your support we will be able to produce 1000 units of our development board. As well as, your help will allow us to improve our developments and then bring onto the market.

And if we achieve more funds?

If we get more we will dedicate the money to invest in improving the expansion device and of course to increase the value proposition of our products.

Perks

The story behind custodium:

All started the last year in a conversation between two friends, Ernesto and Jose who were talking about Jose's father, who suffer from Alzheimer. Jose wanted to have located his father in order to help him when it was necessary. He was looking for a GPS tracker in the market, but there wasn´t any suitable for Alzheimer´s sufferers. The main problem was that the GPS devices in the market were bracelet or necklace so it is easy to pull out it by Alzheimer's patients.

After that,we were developing a GPS tracker open, wearable and modular for people, animals, assets and vehicles. Finally we market our product called Custodium tracker.

And why we developed “custom IoT”? The story is highly connected to our Custodium Tracker. We just wanted to solve some problems of our device and we do it!

It was great! We create a integral solution at the same time as we developed a multifunctional device. 


    • Timeline: 

    • Our goal is to start selling our devices in March 2015.
    • We start our crowdfunding campaign on 23 December. It will finish on 1 February 2015.

    Competition of ideas:

    • On 2 of January we will launch a competition of ideas. Custom IoT could has multiple uses. We invited you to get free rein to your imagination. Propose us new ideas or applications. The perk will be a Custom IoT to test it. There will be four winners. 
    • This is our form of the competition: http://goo.gl/forms/vujKhS7YiS

    Breaking news:

    We have been selected for II Program Adventure for HIPIIEs (HIGH PERFORMANCE INNOVATION INTENSIVE ENTERPRISES) in Adventure Network. 

    The program will take place along this first semester of 2015 and It will count on the participation of more than 15 mentors and experts. The best projects will be showed to investors of Spain and the USA.

    This program is evaluated by Goldsmith methodology created by Randall Goldsmith,  President of t3dc.org, Investor in Residence for the Texas Emerging Technology Fund and Fund Manager for the TRTF Fund I. This model has helped to create more than 1000 business of high potential.


    Thank you:

    Thanks in advance for contribute to improve our proyect. You are supporting our growth as a team professionally and also personally.

    If you cannot contribute, help to get our campaign in front of those who can. Share our campaign on  Twitter, Google+, Linkedin. Get on board!

    Grab this chance!



    Bits doing things--¿Qué es lo que quieres que sea? 

    Nuestro brillante dispositivo para el Internet de las Cosas (IoT)

    Zaragoza, España, Tecnología

    En CUSTODIUM nos dedicamos a la localización y seguimiento GPS. Creamos un simple dispositivo y el software que le rodea para tener un completo sistema.

    4 problemas y una solución para muchos otros

    En CUSTODIUM nos dedicamos a la localización y seguimiento GPS durante el desarrollo de nuestros dispositivos y sistemas encontramos 4 problemas básicos:


    Localización sin cobertura:

    En la localización en exteriores y espacios abiertos el GPS es de gran utilidad, pero todo esto se convierte en un problema cuando hablamos de espacios cubiertos o interiores donde la señal de GPS no tiene cobertura. También en el mundo rural cuando hablamos de localización en exteriores el GPS funciona perfectamente pero las redes de telefonía móvil no siempre tienen la cobertura adecuada.
    Así que para resolver estos problemas pensamos reforzar nuestro dispositivo con otras redes inalámbricas de amplio uso como pueden ser Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee ...

    Por eso custom IoT incluye la posibilidad de usar estas redes para su comunicación. ¡SIN CABLES!


    Autosuficiencia.


    Todas las aplicaciones móviles y en general los dispositivos electrónicos tienen la limitación de la duración de las baterías que mas tarde o mas temprano acaban agotandose y hay que recargar. En CUSTODIUM este problema es especialmente grave cuando se trata de aplicaciones que tienen que durar meses o años.

    Para resolver este problema pensamos en incluir sistemas de recarga con energías renovables.

    Por eso custom IoT incluye alimentación desde cualquier tipo de fuente que proporcione energía electrica, mini-solar, minieólica, dinamos.... ¡SOMOS VERDES!


    Datos seguros:


    Cuando estamos manejando datos de posición y otros asociados lo último que queremos es perderlos, así que hay que hacer copias de seguridad y saber donde tiene uno sus datos guardados para poder recuperarlos. En CUSTODIUM mandamos los datos a la nube para que siempre alla una copia de los mismos pero como ya hemos dicho no siempre hay una conexión disponible para mandarlos.

    Para resolver este problema pensamos en incluir una tarjeta de memoria.

    Por eso custom IoT incluye una tarjeta de memoria para guardar datos, no importa si son grandes o pequeños, lo importante es que estén guardados.

    Siente y actúa:


    Consideramos que la posición es algo importante, pero si le añadimos información procedente de sensores para dotarlos de movilidad seremos capaces de llegar más lejos en aplicaciones que son importantes para la salud, la seguridad en el trabajo, la información enriquecida del entorno.......

    Para resolver este problema quisimos incluir un alto número de sensores y actuadores.

    Por eso custom IoT incluye puertos de sensores y actuadores para poder usarse en una importante cantidad de escenarios diferentes.
    ¡SIENTE Y ACTUA!


    ¿Qué es custom IoT?



             
    "Custom IoT" es un dispositivo para IoT (Internet de las cosas). Está hecho a medida, con tecnología española y en un tamaño muy práctico para facilitar la movilidad. Puede tener tantos usos como puedas imaginar. 

     www.customiot.info


    Bits doing things:

    bits & el medio ambiente


    En cuanto al medio ambiente, nuestro dispositivo puede aplicarse en jardines y huertos inteligentes, en estaciones meteorológicas y otros usos relacionados con la protección del medio ambiente.
    Además de medir y monitorizar el impacto de otros aspectos del medio natural, como desastres naturales o otros causados por el hombre.
    bits & el hogar


    Nuestro dispositivo Custom IoT puede ser muy funcional en la domótica. Gracias a los sensores y actuadores puede ser muy útil.
    Imagina usos en comunicación, bienestar, seguridad, ahorro energético, etc. También, gracias al Internet de las Cosas (IoT) hay múltiples opciones de conectividad entre diferentes elementos del entorno doméstico.
    bits & energía


    En Custodium creemos en las energías verdes por eso Custom IoT se puede alimentar con fuentes de energía limpias: mini solar, micro-eólica, micro peltier. Hablamos de energías eficientes compatibles con el medioambiente.
    El potencial de esto es enorme especialmente en campos como la movilidad eléctrica.
    bits & salud


    En salud, nuestro dispositivo también puede tener varias aplicaciones.
    Un ejemplo de ello es la monitorización de temperatura en pacientes que estan en cuarentena por posible contagio de ébola. Podemos tener controlada la temperatura del paciente desde su casa y el dispositivo enviará la señal al hospital. Nuestro equipo está trabajando en ello.
    Además, puede tener otras aplicaciones como: salud pública, e-salud o deportes.

    Características y beneficios:

    Puedes ver la hoja de producto y otras características en: www.customiot.info

    Usos:

    En los próximos días iremos publicando algunos ejemplos de uso de Custom IoT.

    PRIMERA IDEA!

    OPEN GARDEN: http://www.instructables.com/id/EKNXDHXI2LMF7I4/

    SEGUNDA IDEA!
    FRECUENCIA CARDÍACA con custom IoT: mira el ejemplo en Instructables

    TERCERA IDEA!
    HAZ MÚSICA! con custom IoT: mira las instrucciones


    ¿Qué necesitamos y qué consigues?

    Necesitamos 33.000€ para llevar a cabo nuestro proyecto.
    Con tu apoyo podremos producir 1.000 unidades de nuestra placa de desarrollo. También tu ayuda nos permite mejorar nuestros productos y poder lanzarlos al mercado.

    Ver recompensas arriba

    Si conseguimos más fondos:

    Si logramos recaudar más dedicaremos el dinero a invertirlo en mejoras de la placa de expansión y por supuesto a mejorar la propuesta de valor de nuestros productos.

    La historia de custodium:

    Todo comenzado el año pasado en una conversación entre dos amigos, Ernesto y Jose. Hablaban del padre de Jose, que padece Alzheimer. A Jose le gustaría tener localizado a su padre para poder ayudarle cuando fuera necesario. Él buscó un localizador GPS en el mercado, pero no había exactamente uno adaptado a los enfermos de Alzheimer. El problema principal era que los dispositivos de GPS eran en forma de pulsera o de colgante entonces es fácil que los pacientes se lo arrancaran. Después de todo esto, nosotros nos pusimos a desarrollar un GPS abierto, vestible y modular para personas, animales, mercancías y vehículos. Finalmente sacamos al mercado nuestro producto llamado Custodium tracker.
    ¿Y por qué desarrollamos después el costum IoT ? La historia esta sumamente ligada a nuestro Custodium Tracker. ¡Solamente quisimos solucionar algunos problemas de nuestro dispositivo y lo hemos hecho!
    Es genial. ¡Hemos creado una solución integral al mismo tiempo que hemos desarrollado un dispositivo multifunción!


    Diego, responsable de desarrollo de producto, nos cuenta más sobre Custom IoT en su blog: Diego Tecnology


    Timeline: 

    Nuestro objetivo es empezar a vender nuestros dispositivos en marzo de 2015.

    Nuestra campaña empieza el 23 de diciembre. Finalizará el 1 de Febrero de 2015.

    Competición de ideas:

    El 2 de enero lanzamos la Competición de ideas, te invitamos a darle rienda suelta a tu imaginación. Todas las ideas de usos, aplicaciones para nuestro Custom IoT serán bienvenidas. La recompensa será un custom IoT para hacer pruebas y descubrir sus funcionalidades.

    Este es nuestro cuestionario para plasmar tu idea:

     http://goo.gl/forms/vujKhS7YiS

    Aparición en los medios y otros:

    • TV: Aragón TV: Aragón en abierto
    • Foro Open pilot: Presentación elevator pitch
    • Wearables Spain: Conferencia
    • Fundación Aragón Invierte: II Foro Inversión Aragón Invierte
    • Enjoy Challenge: Nuestro dispositivo cruza el estrecho
    • Radio: Aragón radio- escúchalo en: Canal emprendedor

    Últimas noticias:

    Hemos sido seleccionados para el II Programa Adventure for HIPIIE´s del centro de Innovación de BBVA, dentro del programa Adventure Network una red internacional de aceleración de proyectos construida sobre el vínculo Texas-España.
    Solo 20 startups pueden acceder a este programa y Custodium es una de ellas, así que estamos muy felices y con ganas de empezar como "adventureros".
    El programa tendrá lugar a lo largo de este primer semestre de 2015 y contará con la participación de más de 15 mentores y expertos. Los mejores proyectos se presentarán a inversores de España y EEUU.
    El programa se desarrollada mediante la metodología Goldsmith, desarrollado por Randall Goldsmith, Presidente de t3dc.org, Investor en Residence for the Texas Emerging Technology Fund y Fund Manager for the TRTF Fund I, y que goza de un éxito contrastado en los Estados Unidos. En los últimos años, este modelo ha contribuido a crear mas de 1000 negocios de alto potencial, a los que les ha ayudado a captar más de 600 millones de dólares de inversión privada.

    Gracias:

    Gracias por adelantado por contribuir a mejorar nuestro proyecto. Estas permitiendo nuestro crecimiento como equipo profesionalmente y personalmente.
    Si no puedes contribuir, ayúdanos a compartirlo con aquellos que puedan. Comparte nuestra campaña en Twitter, Google+, Linkedin.  ¡Únete a nosotros!

    Muchas gracias por apoyarnos
story_txt:
En español más abajo o pulse aquíAt CUSTODIUM we work on location. We made a simple GPS tracking device and all the software around to have a complete system.4 solved problems and a solution to many others
In
CUSTODIUM we work in location and GPS tracking. During the
development of our devices and systems, we found 4 basic problems:Out of range location


In outside location and open areas the
GPS is very useful but when we are in indoor areas the GPS signal
lose coverage. As well as, in rural area the GPS works properly,
however the mobile networks don´t have enough coverage.


So that's why we thought about
reinforce our device with wireless networks widely used such as
Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee...


Custom IoT include the use of these
networks for WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONSelf-sufficiency


In general, the
electronic devices have a lack of self-sufficiency, that sooner or
later run out and it's necessary to recharge it. This matter
especially affects when it refers to apps that have to go on months
or years.


To solve this
problem we thought in adding recharge systems based on renowable
energies.


Therefore Custom
IoT could supply with any power source that provide electric energy,
mini-solar, micro-wind, dynamos... WE ARE GREEN!Secure data





When we operate
with data position the limit is to lose them, so that it's necessary
to make back-up copies knowing where the data are to recover them.


In Custodim we
send the data to the cloud to save copies but not always there is
connection to send it.


To solve it we
include a memory card. As a result, Custom IoT save the data, it
doesn't matter small or big data, the most important is to save data. SECURE DATA!

Feel & act

We
think the location is important, but we could go further away adding
information from sensors to use in health, work security, environment
information...

We
included a high number of useful sensors and actuators to solve the
problem.

Thus,
Custom IoT has serial ports of sensors and actuators that could be
useful in an important quantity of different scenes. FEEL
& ACT!
What is custom IoT? 

          

"Custom IoT" is a Swiss knife device for the IoT.  Is a tailor-made device, achieved in a practical size to make mobility much easier. All the uses that you can imagine!
 www.customiot.info
Bits doing things:
bits & environment  


Related to environment, Custom IoT could be use as a smart garden and smart vegetable patch.

Also in meteorological office and other functions related with environmental protection: forecast and monitor the impact of natural aspects.

bits & home



Our Custom IoT device is very functional in home automation. Thanks to the sensors and actuators it could be very useful. 
Imagine uses such as communication, comfort, security, energy saving, etc. As well as with the IoT (Internet of Things) there are multiple aspects related to connectivity of assets.

bits & energy 




In Custodium we believe in green energies so that Custom IoT is powered by clean energy such as mini solar, micro-wind, micro-peltier. We refer to the efficiency and environmental compatibility of the power supply. 
This have a great potential especially in the field of electric mobility.

bits & health 



With reference to health, Custom IoT could be very helpful also. 
For example, it could monitor temperature of patients that are in quarantine because they may have ebola virus disease. It will send a constant signal to the hospital to control the patient from their home. Our team is working on it. 
As well as, it could has applications in e-health, Public health or in sports.




Features and benefits:

Sheet product and
areas of applicability/uses. See more at: www.customiot.info
Uses:The next days we are going to publish some ideas of uses with Custom IoT.FIRST IDEA!OPEN GARDEN: http://www.instructables.com/id/EKNXDHXI2LMF7I4/SECOND IDEA!HEART RATE with custom IoT: Example in instructablesTHIRD IDEA!

COLOR MUSIC with custom IoT: see the example



What we need and what you get?
We need 33.000€ to achieve our project.

With your support we will be able to produce 1000 units of our
development board. As well as, your help will allow us to improve our developments and then bring onto the market.
And if we achieve more funds?
If we get more we will dedicate the money to invest in improving the expansion device and of course to increase the value proposition of our products.
Perks












The story behind custodium:

All started the last year in a conversation between two friends, Ernesto and Jose who were talking about Jose's father, who suffer from Alzheimer. Jose wanted to have located his father in order to help him when it was necessary. He was looking for a GPS tracker in the market, but there wasn´t any suitable for Alzheimer´s sufferers. The main problem was that the GPS devices in the market were bracelet or necklace so it is easy to pull out it by Alzheimer's patients.
After that,we were developing a GPS tracker open, wearable and modular for people, animals, assets and vehicles. Finally we market our product called Custodium tracker.

And why we developed “custom IoT”? The story is highly connected to our Custodium Tracker. We just wanted to solve some problems of our device and we do it!
It was great! We create a integral solution at the same time as we developed a multifunctional device. 


Timeline: 


Our goal is to start selling
our devices in March 2015.


We start our crowdfunding campaign on 23 December. It will finish on 1 February 2015.


Competition of ideas:


On 2 of January we will launch a competition of ideas. Custom IoT could has multiple uses. We invited you to get free rein to your imagination. Propose us new ideas or applications. The perk will be a Custom IoT to test it. There will be four winners. 

This is our form of the competition: http://goo.gl/forms/vujKhS7YiS

Forum Open pilot: Custodium conference


Wearables Spain: Conference

Breaking news:
We have been selected for II Program Adventure for HIPIIEs (HIGH PERFORMANCE INNOVATION INTENSIVE ENTERPRISES) in Adventure Network. 
The program will take place along this first semester of 2015 and It will count on the participation of more than 15 mentors and experts. The best projects will be showed to investors of Spain and the USA.
This program is evaluated by Goldsmith methodology created by Randall Goldsmith,  President of t3dc.org, Investor in Residence for the Texas Emerging Technology Fund and Fund Manager for the TRTF Fund I. This model has helped to create more than 1000 business of high potential.

Thank you:
Thanks in advance for contribute to improve our proyect. You are
supporting our growth as a team professionally and also personally.
If you cannot contribute, help to get our campaign in front of those who
can. Share our campaign on  Twitter,
Google+, Linkedin. Get on board!

story:
"These are the forgotten children, the children who no one else cared about. The children that quietly languished in the shadows, hungry and slowly dropping out of school, one by one. The children of Pantanal are the ones that tourists see as annoying street beggars or sad, hopeless causes. But they are not hopeless. They are beautiful souls that desire so much to learn. They are bright children that line up and beg for homework. They are the children that plead for just one more banana from school, because they don’t know when they will be able to eat again. But when they have food and love, they dance and laugh and sing like all the other children across the world. These are the children that we have sworn to never let fall in the shadows ever again.” Help us help them. 
For every $9 donation, we will give a solar-powered lamp to a child in Pantanal. Our goal is to donate 200 lamps, one for every student at Education Plus Nicaragua in Pantanal, Nicaragua. 

Esperanza Market 

Esperanza means Hope in Spanish. The Esperanza Market was born from the idea that businesses can do better. That businesses can align themselves with a deeper mission than maximizing profits. That businesses can both provide high-quality products and services and at the same time help make the world a better place to live.

We will do that in two ways. First, starting in Nicaragua, we will search markets and craft fairs to find and establish relationships directly with artisans. By creating an online marketplace for their handmade products, we are providing the under- and unemployed artisans, mostly women, with an opportunity to earn vital income in poverty-stricken parts of Latin America.  


The second part of the market is donating solar-powered lamps to students who live without electricity. One-third of the Nicaraguan population lives without reliable access to electricity. The Esperanza Market will donate a solar-powered light to students who live in homes without access to reliable electricity. 



Our first giving partner will be Education Plus Nicaragua, a nonprofit that provides free education and food to the children of the Pantanal Barrio outside of Granada, Nicaragua. The first 200 lights will be donated to these students at Education Plus Nicaragua.


The Pantanal barrio was founded in 1992 with no urban planning as a place for natural disaster refugees from other parts of Nicaragua. Since then, it has grown to approximately 13,000 residents, 8,000 of which are children. Many of the homes are wired for electricity, however, families can not afford to actually use it.

Despite their living conditions, the students at Education Plus Nicaragua are happy, motivated and hopeful for a better future.

Your Help

We need your help to bring the ESPERANZA MARKET to life. Our fundraising goals cover the initial inventory order, website development, solar-powered lamps and other basic startup costs.



The Perks!

       

Follow Esperanza Market's board Nicaraguan Travel Magnets on Pinterest.

Please Share

Once you contribute, please share our Indiegogo Campaign with your friends, family and communities. 

  • Remind them that a donation of $9 goes directly towards the purchase and distribution of a solar-powered lamp for a Central American student. 
  • Follow our Instagram Account @esperanza_market for an Online Silent Auction to raise further funds.
  • Follow the hashtag #LightTheWorld for all updates.

Acknowledgement

. The Esperanza Market would not have made it this far without the following people:

  • Axel Guerrero and his company A.G.P. Intermedia for providing photos, video and, at times, much needed Spanish translation.  
  • Bodhi Tree Yoga Resort, Ama Tierra Retreat and Wellness Center and Peace Retreat Costa Rica for straight up DONATING high-value accommodations to be offered for our Perks. Talk about walking the walk! Find them on social media, Like them, Follow them and get yourself to Costa Rica and do some downward dogs with them. 
  • Friends and family that have supplied hours of advice, encouragement and emotional support. You know who you are. 
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you! Let's #LightTheWorld


Visit Esperanza Market's profile on Pinterest.

story:
WE NOW HAVE OVER 200,000 Businesses AND OVER 500,000 OFFERS Just in the US!

The Most Advanced App of its Kind, a Key that opens the world to everyone by:
Bringing the world to consumers.
Bringing consumers to business.
Bringing Business to business.
Earn, Give, Grow!
Our philosophy is “Tashi”! Passing along the good fortune.
 

Duct Tape, Old Pair of Shoes, Smart Phone….. How MobiCard got started.

Hi,

My name is Rob Hunt, I’m the founder and president of MobiCard USA INC. I get asked why I started MobiCard, well to answer this I’ll need to tell you a little bit about how I grew up.

When I was 12 my father broke his neck, as you can imagine, it had quite the impact on our family finances. To say the least, we all had to pitch in. I really liked being in sports, but it took money to be in sports, particularly when it came to equipment. This is where the Duct Tape comes into play!

Duct Tape is truly “the handyman’s secret weapon”! We used Duct Tape to repair, improvise, and create equipment for sports. When it came to my “Old Pair of Shoes”, Duct Tape was used to wrap around them to keep them together, smooth out the tread, and make it possible for me to wrestle. I could have very well ended up on the streets, or could have turned to crime, and drugs… Sports, and Duct Tape won!

I started collage, got married, and started my first business when I was 19. Fast forwarding to now, I have been a businessman for over 25 years. During my carrier I have been in Retail, Service, and Marketing, along with being an inventor holding a major patent, and working on others.

Smartphones came into the picture! In 2013 I was sitting in my office thinking about what I wanted to do, regarding future ideas, and projects. I’ve always wanted to make a difference in the lives of others, so I began working on a way for low income kids to be able to generate income, and “pay it forward” to the next generations to come… This is where MobiCard was born!

In creating MobiCard, I wanted everyone to win! With my business, and marketing background, I knew what businesses needed to succeed, and thought that if I can create a win for Businesses, a win for fundraisers, a win for consumers, and a win for the community…. It would be a huge success!

We now have the balance for everyone! In January of 2016, I thought, why just limit this to kids? Why don’t we let everyone participate? Doesn’t it help kids if we help their mom, or dad, or other members of the family? Doesn’t it help the kids if we help churches, charities, organizations…. Even college students?

With MobiCard, you have only seen the tip of the iceberg, I have more surprises coming! Visit our website: http://www.mobicardusa.com/

This is where we are now! Just think how we can change lives!

Who is with me?

Tashi (pass along the good fortune),

Rob Hunt

 

New Business Count Since Campaign Start

Yesterday Total - 850 Today's Total - 1021

Visit our website http://www.mobicardusa.com/

Save $1,000’s Every Year!

The MobiCard APP is the ultimate discount APP offering online shopping, local shopping, and national discounts … just to list a few. With everything at your fingertips this remarkable APP has it all.

  • Business websites, contact information, and directions to store front are just a click away.
  • Easily see the amazing local offers.
  • New offers added daily
  • Online shopping
  • Specialty store listings (ebay, etsy, facebook, Amazon, website store etc…)
  • Affordable Yearly or Monthly Memberships

 

MERCHANT BENEFITS

Think of MobiCard as a hybrid between a business listing and a discount card. You can even say it is a mix of every type of marketing you have done. Here are a few of our highlights:

* See exactly how many times your discounts have been viewed

* See how many times your coupons have been downloaded

* See how many times your coupons have been redeemed

* No long term contracts (month to month)

* Change your offers anytime

If your offer isn’t working … change it! If your offer is working too well … change it! If you have 500 coupon views, and only 10 people use them, or the opposite happens … change your offer to something that works. It really is that simple!

Why do customers buy Mobicard?

  • Support fundraisers and charities
  • For discounts and shopping
  • Personal mobile resource for local businesses, products, and services

Reach Consumers

  • Locally
  • Regionally
  • Nationally
  • Visiting or Traveling to Your Area

Consumer Exposure… How?

  • Physically Navigating MobiCard
  • Featured on MobiCard’s facebook page
  • Featured on social media
  • Weekly reminders to use MobiCard
  • Redeemable coupons have expiration reminders sent via text

Redeemable offers can be shared by:

  • Social Media
  • Text
  • Email

NOTE: When REDEEMABLE OFFERS are shared, the customer information is added to the customer database associated with your offer. These customers can be marketed to DIRECTLY over and over again!

How Consumers Reach You:

  • GPS Navigation to Your Store
  • Click To Call
  • Social Media Links
  • Website/Online Store Links

What Makes MobiCard Better For You?

  • Choose Your Level of Participation
  • Tracking Coupon View At All Levels

Redeemable Coupon Tracking:

  • Coupon Views
  • Coupon Downloads
  • Coupon Redeems
  • Coupon Shares

* Think of MobiCard As A Hybrid Business Listing

* Include Your Video Commercial

* Manage Your Offers

* Change Your Offers At Any Time

* Current Business Types/Categories Added As Needed

Package Options:

  • Free Option
  • Pay Per Download Option
  • Premium Placement Listing Options

MobiCard links on social media and websites increase your website SEO (Search Engine Optimization, ie. Google Placement)

How Consumers Get MobiCard

  • Direct Sales and Marketing
  • Corporate Sales
  • Fundraisers
  • Charities
  • Affiliate Sales and Marketing

Businesses Types:

  • Retail Chains
  • Dining Chains
  • Entertainment Chains
  • Grocery Chains
  • Travel
  • Resorts
  • Online Shopping
  • Website
  • Online Stores
  • Specialty Shopping
  • Etsy
  • eBay
  • Amazon, as well as others

Why Choose MobiCard for Your Fundraiser?

  • The Premier Mobile APP For Your Fundraiser
  • Your group keeps 50%
  • When people renew, your group still gets 50%! (This is a growing RESIDUAL income)
  • Personalize the APP for your school or group (Logos, Video Clips, Events, etc.)
  • Business Sponsors? Bring them on board MobiCard and you receive 25% (100 businesses could be $2,500 per month for you!)
  • No up front costs! (Custom skin, school logo, branding and more.)
  • More value to your customers
  • More local discount offers
  • Use MobiCard nationwide (where available)
  • Weekly reminders (via APP) to use local offers on the MobiCard
  • No cards or books to lose. MobiCard is always on your smartphone
  • No other discount card offers the Mobility of the MobiCard
  • Easy fundraising! In person and social media. Everyone wants discounts on their phone.
  • Use anywhere! MobiCard works locally and in other cities
  • No money or checks to lose. Supporters buy MobiCard on their phone and have instant access to discounts
  • No more waiting. No cards. No books. No fuss!
  • Buy it now. Use it now. Love it!

Please watch the videos & visit our website:

http://www.mobicardusa.com/

story:
Skafferiet flyttar och fortsätter att växa!

Skafferiet Västerås är en förpackningsfri butik, det innebär kort och gott att våra produkter säljs utan förpackningar! Du tar med dig dina egna behållare - eller köper glasburkar/flaskor hos oss -  och fyller på dem med ekologiska varor i vårat specialdesignade lösviktssystem. Ett annat sätt att handla på helt enkelt!

Skafferiet Västerås kommer inom en snar framtid att flytta till nya lokaler hos Saluhallen Slakteriet. Vi ser det som en fantastisk möjlighet att bli en del av denna samling butiker och matställen som erbjuder lokala råvaror och fantastiska gourmetupplevelser med ett stort fokus på hållbarhet. I samband med detta finns det dessvärre även andra faktorer som sträcker sig utom vår makt och leder till att vi efter en sådan kort tid redan behöver flytta. 

En så pass tidig flytt och renovering av ytterligare en lokal var inte något vi räknat med och som ett nystartat, privatägt företag i startgroparna av sin resa innebär det en tuff situation ekonomiskt för oss. Vi har därför valt att starta en crowdfunding kampanj för att göra det  lättare för oss att kunna hantera de kostnader som denna flytt innebär.

Sedan starten har vi sett en stadig, positiv trend både vad gäller antalet kunder som handlar hos oss och omsättningen i butiken. Det går kanske inte så snabbt som vi hade velat, men det går framåt. Detta motiverar oss att fortsätta att växa som företag och vi ser goda möjligheter att hjälpa till att sätta Västerås på kartan som en innovativ stad som tar emot och huserar hållbara koncept som detta!

Vad kommer pengarna att användas till?

De pengar som samlas in kommer att användas till följande:

  • Kostnader direkt relaterade till flytten av butiken vilket inkluderar flyttbil, ned och uppmontering av vårat specialdesignade lösviktssystem och flyttlådor.
  • Kostnader för renoveringen och iordningställandet av vår nya lokal på Saluhallen Slakteriet.
  • Kostnaderna för en marknadsföringskampanj av vår butik i dess nya lokaler för att sprida ordet om var vi flyttar och vad vi erbjuder.

Vill du hjälpa oss att fortsätta växa i våra nya lokaler?

Om du brinner för det vi gör och den förändring som vi kämpar för att få igenom vad gäller hållbar tillverkning och konsumtion av ekologiska och förpackningsfria livsmedel så har du nu en chans att direkt stödja oss i vår största utmaning hittills! Även små bidrag gör skillnad så känn inte någon press att skänka en stor summa, vi uppskattar allt stöd oavsett storleken på ditt bidrag!

 

----ENGLISH----

 

Skafferiet is moving and continues to grow!

Skafferiet Västerås is a zero waste shop, meaning our products are sold package-free! Bring your own containers - or buy glas jars/bottles at the shop - and fill them with organic produce from our bulk system especially designed for zero waste shopping. Simply put, a different way of shopping!

Skafferiet Västerås will shortly be moving to its new premises at Saluhallen Slakteriet. We see this as a great opportunity to become a part of this collection of shops and eateries offering local produce and fantastic gourmet experiences with a strong focus on sustainability. In connection with this there are also unfortunately other factors beyond our control which leads us to move from our current place after such a short amount of time. 

Such an early move and renovation of another place for our shop was not something we had planned and as a private, newly opened business it puts us in a rather tough economic situation. That is why we have decided to launch this crowdfunding campaign in order to make it easier for us to cope with the extra costs related to the move.

Since opening on day one we have seen a gradual, positive increase in customers and revenue. It might not be increasing as fast as we'd like but it is nonetheless going forward from day to day which motivates us to keep growing as a company and also putting Västerås on the map as a city that welcomes sustainable concepts such as our shop!

What will the funds be used for?

The money collected from this campaign will be used for the following causes:

  • Costs directly associated with the move to our new place in Saluhallen including the assembly of our special bulk units, hiring a truck/car for the move and moving boxes.
  • Costs directly associated with renovating and getting our new space ready for the shop.
  • Costs directly associated with marketing campaigns for our shop on its new premises and for its continued growth in Västerås.

Do you want to help us to keep growing in our new premises at Saluhallen?

If you love what we do and the changes that we are fighting to make regarding sustainable production and consumption of organic and package-free products, here is your chance to make a direct contribution to our biggest challenge yet! Even small contributions are a big help and are very much appreciated so don’t feel pressured to donate more than you can spare!
