Vill du hjälpa oss att fortsätta växa i våra nya lokaler?
Om du brinner för det vi gör och den förändring som vi kämpar för att få igenom vad gäller hållbar tillverkning och konsumtion av ekologiska och förpackningsfria livsmedel så har du nu en chans att direkt stödja oss i vår största utmaning hittills! Även små bidrag gör skillnad så känn inte någon press att skänka en stor summa, vi uppskattar allt stöd oavsett storleken på ditt bidrag!
 
----ENGLISH----
 
Skafferiet is moving and continues to grow!
Skafferiet Västerås is a zero waste shop, meaning our products are sold package-free! Bring your own containers - or buy glas jars/bottles at the shop - and fill them with organic produce from our bulk system especially designed for zero waste shopping. Simply put, a different way of shopping!
Skafferiet Västerås will shortly be moving to its new premises at Saluhallen Slakteriet. We see this as a great opportunity to become a part of this collection of shops and eateries offering local produce and fantastic gourmet experiences with a strong focus on sustainability. In connection with this there are also unfortunately other factors beyond our control which leads us to move from our current place after such a short amount of time. 
Such an early move and renovation of another place for our shop was not something we had planned and as a private, newly opened business it puts us in a rather tough economic situation. That is why we have decided to launch this crowdfunding campaign in order to make it easier for us to cope with the extra costs related to the move.
Since opening on day one we have seen a gradual, positive increase in customers and revenue. It might not be increasing as fast as we'd like but it is nonetheless going forward from day to day which motivates us to keep growing as a company and also putting Västerås on the map as a city that welcomes sustainable concepts such as our shop!
What will the funds be used for?
The money collected from this campaign will be used for the following causes:

Costs directly associated with the move to our new place in Saluhallen including the assembly of our special bulk units, hiring a truck/car for the move and moving boxes.
Costs directly associated with renovating and getting our new space ready for the shop.
Costs directly associated with marketing campaigns for our shop on its new premises and for its continued growth in Västerås.

Do you want to help us to keep growing in our new premises at Saluhallen?
If you love what we do and the changes that we are fighting to make regarding sustainable production and consumption of organic and package-free products, here is your chance to make a direct contribution to our biggest challenge yet! Even small contributions are a big help and are very much appreciated so don’t feel pressured to donate more than you can spare!

story:
GYMNASE - atelier de sérigraphie existe depuis novembre 2015. Nous sommes un studio de sérigraphie situé dans le Mile-End à Montréal. Le concept du studio est d’accueillir les artistes et de mettre à leur disposition tous les équipements nécessaires à l’impression en sérigraphie. Nous offrons aussi le service d’impression à des festivals, des compagnies en démarrage, et des artistes locaux.

 

 

 

 

 

Lors d’une soumission pour un projet à imprimer, il y a plusieurs aspects qui peuvent faire changer le prix final. Les clients ne sont pas toujours au courant de ce qui pourrait les avantager et lors du premier échange de courriel, il y a souvent des informations manquantes. La plupart du temps, le médium de la sérigraphie est abstrait pour le client et c’est dur de prévoir les informations à donner. C’est pourquoi nous voulons créer une solution interactive sur notre site web pour permettre aux clients d’avoir leur prix instantanément. De plus, en changeant les éléments de sa soumission, le client peut tout de suite voir comment ses choix influencent le prix de son projet. Nous sauverons donc beaucoup de temps aux clients et à notre équipe!

Le formulaire de soumission intéractif permettra aux clients (vous!) de non seulement faire plusieurs scénarios (différentes quantités, chandails, couleurs, etc.) pour choisir lequel est le plus avantageux, mais aussi de sauver beaucoup de temps!

Le formulaire de soumission permettra aux clients d’avoir une expérience transparente, unique et rapide, tout en restant personnalisée!

 

 

Voici les détails de la soumission de notre designer JoMor :)

 

Pour la direction artistique et le développement du site web + la soumission interactive : 4 675$

Nous avons la chance d’avoir un designer qui aime la sérigraphie alors nous avons fait une entente avec lui: il peut venir au studio imprimer quand il veut toute une année, ce qui réduit le prix de la soumission à 3 235$!

Nous avons donc comme premier objectif de ramasser 3 500$ (3 235$ pour le site web + 265$ pour gérer les imprévus à la mise en ligne du site).

Nous avons déjà fait le dépôt pour pouvoir entamer le projet et vous montrer le design avant la programmation. Avec le financement, nous pourrons entamer la programmation.

Notre deuxième objectif est d’amasser les fonds nécessaires à la production des contreparties, soit un deuxième 1 765$. Si jamais nous dépassons le montant total, ce qui serait génial!, nous investirons pour inclure une méthode de paiement avec votre soumission et un système de suivi de votre commande.

Notre objectif total est d’amasser 5 000$!

 

 

 

En nous aidant à financer notre site web, vous nous aidez à mieux servir. Étant une petite équipe nous voulons produire vos projets le plus rapidement possible. Par contre, nous passons beaucoup de temps à répondre aux courriels de soumissions et il y a souvent beaucoup d'aller-retour. Ceci est normal puisque ce n'est pas tous nos clients qui s'y connaissent en sérigraphie et ça peut être abstrait lorsqu'on essaie d'expliquer comment ça fonctionne.

Avec notre nouveau formulaire, le client n’aura qu'à répondre aux questions préétablies, ce qui l'amènera à avoir directement le prix que ça lui coûtera pour créer son projet. Il pourra donc créer différents scénarios: par exemple avec plus ou moins de couleurs ou avec des chandails de différentes qualités dépendant du budget. Et nous ça nous laisse plus de temps pour l'impression du projet puisqu’une partie de notre travail se fera en ligne! C'est gagnant-gagnant, comme on dit!

 

Scénario d’utilisation du formulaire

1 - Répondre aux questions préétablies selon les besoins

2 - Avoir un premier prix pour la commande totale

3 - Changer d’idée (parce que ça arrive) - Ex: Changer le nombre de couleurs et choisir des chandails à manche longues à la place des t-shirts

4- Obtenir un nouveau prix pour la commande totale

5- Être content/e

6- Passer sa commande

Au besoin: Nous appeler ou nous écrire, parce que même si on a un système de soumission en ligne, ça veut pas dire qu’on veut pas vous parler jamais!

8- Recevoir un courriel personnalisé confirmant la réception de la commande

9- Recevoir sa commande et être content

10- Recommander nos services parce que vous êtes content

 

Si vous voulez nous aider, partagez notre page Indiegogo le plus possible!

 

**Toute cette campagne a pu être réalisée grâce à l'aide des membres du GYMNASE. Merci à Maxime Pouliot pour le vidéo, Samuel Jacques, Amélie Tourangeau, Sarah Marcotte Boislard, Lea Mercante et Pierre-Nicolas Riou pour leurs créations. Merci à Raphaëlle Côté-Parent pour ses talents d'éditrice.**

story:
Danny Hart Special Pendant

For a limited time we are offering an exclusive Danny Hart pendant stuffed into your A.R.T. Survival Tote.  This is a very special edition Danny Hart pendant made from wood that was reclaimed from a tree on Central that was cut down during A.R.T. demolition.    Danny was generously provided the wood, and has generously shared this with us.  Take the opportunity with Danny Hart and Octofox to find some beauty in the destruction on Central.

 

(505) FACES + Octofox

The good peeps at (505) Faces have donated 5 books to us to help Save The Octofox! Get this perk and you'll receive a copy of 'New Mexico: Portraits & Profiles' stuffed into your A.R.T. Survival Tote.

 

Save The Octofox!

The Octopus & The Fox could be CLOSING FOR GOOD.  No joke, we have been hit so hard by the A.R.T. shenanigans that we nearly had to close our doors last month. Instead of throwing in the towel though, we've decided to give it one last shot.  We’re launching the “Shop Like You Give A F*ck” campaign.  By clicking to support our project and help Save The Octofox! You can get all sorts of great stuff.  The Shop Like You Give A F*ck: A.R.T. Survival Gear is meant to act as a reminder.  Not only to come into our store and shop local, but to support all the other businesses up and down Central Ave. that are experiencing the same A.R.T. blues.

 

Help Keep Albuquerque Cooler Than Portland

 

Shop Like You Give A F*CK T-Shirt

 

Balloons!!!

 

The perks:

$15 - Get an Octofox balloon!

Who doesn't love balloons?  Get this perk, stop by the shop and get your own Octofox balloon.  While you're there you'll also get 10% off any purchase you make.

$45 - Albuquerque: Cooler Than Portland T-Shirt

Get yourself an Albuquerque: Cooler Than Portland t-shirt + an Octofox balloon + 15% off when you come into the store to pick up your perk.

$75 - 'Shop Like You Give A F*CK' A.R.T. Survival Tote

Get your very own 'Shop Like You Give A F*CK' A.R.T. Survival tote.  A reusable reminder to shop local, and support stores along Central that are struggling as construction continues.  It comes stuffed with an Albuquerque: Cooler Than Portland t-shirt + you'll get an Octofox balloon when you come in to pick it up.

$100 - 'Shop Like You Give A F*CK' A.R.T. Survival T-Shirt

Get your exclusive 'Shop Like You Give A F*CK' t-shirt.  It comes stuffed in your A.R.T. Survival Tote with an Albuquerque: Cooler Than Portland T-Shirt + a balloon + 25% off when you come in to pick it up.  It just keeps getting better and better.

$250 -  VIP Screen Printing Lesson

You'll be invited to a special screen printing lesson at The Octopus & The Fox.  You'll not only get to learn the basics of silk screening for yourself, but you'll get to print one of each of the above listed 'Shop Like You Give A F*CK' Survival Gear.

PS - You'll get a balloon too :)

$888 - The Octofox Special

If you contribute at this level, we will create a custom Octofox design in your honor.  You will receive a t-shirt, tote, and poster of the design hand screen printed by us, for you.  We'll also make another poster and proudly hang it in the store.  There will be other awesomeness, we just can't talk about it right now.  Thank you!

If you are outside of Albuquerque and cannot come into the store to pick up your perk, but would like to contribute; please process payment and contact us directly at hello@octofoxshop.com with your information.  We'll figure something out, we promise ;)

 

The Impact & Risks

Since business has slowed down so dramatically, we have had to dip into what small cash savings we have just to stay open.  We can't take many more months like this.  We are looking to raise enough funds to weather the A.R.T. storm.  The risk here is that even with a community sourced injection of capital, the construction has no end in sight and we still may have to consider closing.  We're willing to take that risk and get you some cool A.R.T. Survival Gear while doing it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  

Business has been so slow it gets lonely sometimes. Stop in the shop and say hi.  Maybe you'll find something you like :)  It's easiest to use Coal or Lead and come in through the back way on Edith.

Also, you can use the Indiegogo share buttons to spread the word far and wide.

We're located at 514 Central Ave. SE, Albuquerque, NM 87102

 

This is an all-or-nothing, fixed funding campaign.

If this campaign isn't fully funded we won't receive a dime, and you're contribution will be fully refunded.  Together we can Save The Octofox!!!

Survival Gear while doing it.

Business has been so slow it gets lonely sometimes. Stop in the shop and say hi.  Maybe you'll find something you like :)  It's easiest to use Coal or Lead and come in through the back way on Edith.
Also, you can use the Indiegogo share buttons to spread the word far and wide.

story:
Hi IndieGoGo! Thanks for checking out our campaign!  Good News Reuse™ has created the first ever reusable pizza box made from sustainable materials. We call it the Pi Pan. Our goal is to replace the 3 billion cardboard pizza boxes used each year with the Pi Pan. It's a lofty goal so we need to get started now.

Please watch our video and help us reach our target by clicking the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button to the right. If you'd like to learn more see our FAQs below.



FAQs:

What is the Pi Pan made of?
The Pi Pan is made of thin commercial food grade stainless steel, as thin as a reusable water bottle. It is BPA-free and does not contain other unhealthy chemicals.

How long does a Pi Pan last?
Stainless steel lasts forever but we modestly claim 1,000+ uses. The Pi Pan is recyclable at any point in its lifetime.

Tell me more about it...
The Pi Pan has an innovative yet timeless design. Advanced engineering ensures that the reusable Pi Pan is lightweight yet strong, keeps pizzas hotter for longer, and is easy to clean. The initial Pi Pan is designed to fit a 14” or 16” pizza, the most common sizes for take-out and delivery. The geometries of the design are easily extendable to different sizes. Aluminum and stainless steel pans are widely used in pizza operations so there is already a familiarity of use for operators and consumers.



Does the Pi Pan require assembly?
Unlike a traditional cardboard pizza box, there is no assembly required.

What are some of the benefits of the Pi Pan?
  • Reusable - lasts forever
  • Pays for itself after 30 uses in businesses with reoccurring deliveries
  • Delivers a hotter, crispier, tastier pizza - no cardboard taste
  • Adapts easily into existing food operations
  • Attractive, simple, lasting design
  • Environmental contribution and statement
  • BPA-free, with no other unhealthy chemicals

How much will the Pi Pan cost?
For commercial food operators, we plan to sell the Pi Pan for $15 to $20 at volume production (the average cost of a cardboard pizza box is $0.50). For retail customers, we plan to sell the Pi Pan for $34.95.

Why are you first promoting the Pi Pan for use at pizzerias and food companies instead of to individual consumers?  
We are targeting food service companies who make reoccurring deliveries to schools and businesses because we think we can make the quickest environmental impact here. Schools are especially important to us because kids learn by doing.

Will you sell Pi Pans to individuals?
Ultimately we want all pizza lovers to have a reusable Pi Pan. Individual Pi Pans will be available on our website soon. 

Could I use a Pi Pan at home?
Yes. There are several home uses.
  • Transport your pizza from your local pizzeria, saving a cardboard box. It’s just like bringing in your own reusable shopping bag.
  • Reheat your pizza on the Pi Pan bottom.
  • Serve your pizza on the Pi Pan, just as if you were eating in a pizzeria.

Cleaning is easy. Just use soap, water, and a gentle scrub brush as needed. For businesses, it is commercial dishwasher safe.



A cardboard pizza box works perfectly well. Why do we need a reusable one?
It is cheaper, healthier, more sustainable and the pizza tastes better.

Most people are surprised to learn that pizza boxes are not recyclable. People also don’t realize that recycled cardboard contains BPAs.

Pizza box waste impacts the environment negatively in three ways:
  • Destruction of trees and other environmental resources;
  • Excessive waste in our landfills and/or contamination of community recycling projects, as food contaminated containers are not recyclable or compostable in most communities;
  • Perpetuation of the single-use mentality among consumers, particularly school age children.

Is the Pi Pan patented?
Yes we have a provisional patent. 

The $100+ perks include MiiR reusable water bottles. What is your connection to MiiR?
Good News Reuse™ has partnered with MiiR on their one4one initiative. This means that for every MiiR/Good News Reuse™ reusable water bottle purchased, you will be providing one deserving person with clean water for an entire year.

Why don't you offer the Pi Pan as a perk?
We had hoped to offer the Pi Pan as a perk, but decided to seek just enough money to manufacturer the prototype and samples for potential businesses. Once we are up and running, all IndieGoGo supporters will have the opportunity to purchase the first Pi Pans at discounted prices.

What will the money from IndieGoGo be used for?
  • Produce the tooling dies for the top and bottom of the Pi Pan
  • Make samples for marketing and sales
  • Complete all product and engineering tests for product launch

The funding goal of $70,000 was determined after receiving several quotes from manufacturers. If we meet this goal, we will have a finished prototype plus Pi Pan samples for potential customers. Based on manufacturers' timetables, the Pi Pan would be available within 6 months.

$70,000, less IndieGoGo fees, payment processing fees and perks, is the amount needed for the first phase of our business plan. If we receive more than $70,000, we will produce more samples and build a team to launch the Pi Pan. The more money we receive, the more significant impact we can make.

We want to express our sincere gratitude in advance for your contribution to this new venture. If successfully funded, we will hit the ground running and keep you in the loop throughout the process. If we don't reach our goal, these funds will be used towards the company's second revolutionary reusable concept, currently under development.



What is Good News Reuse™? 
Good News Reuse™ is a start-up dedicated to reducing waste in the food and beverage industry.
We decided to create the Pi Pan after discovering that Americans throw away 3 billion single-use cardboard pizza boxes every year. Ultimately we want to introduce other reusable concepts to replace the vast amount of single-use containers that crowd our landfills.

Once profitable Good News Reuse™ will donate at least 1% of annual sales to nonprofits working to protect our environment and promote environmental awareness. In the meantime, our way of helping is by partnering with MiiR on their one4one water initiative.

Who are the creators of Good News Reuse™?
Susan is a die-hard foodie and longtime environmentalist in Mill Valley, California. She is the creative force behind Good News Reuse™. With broad experience in all facets of food service, she is fully dedicated to providing reusable sustainable solutions to the excessive waste in the industry.

Jeff is the key strategist for Good News Reuse™. He loves food and technology and is a consumer products guru. He hails from San Francisco and has held executive positions with Fortune 100 companies and start-ups, from semi-conductors to LED lighting.

Together, Susan and Jeff have combined their talents to develop Good News Reuse™ and the Pi Pan.



How can I help?
93% of our population eats pizza once a month. Every take-out pizza comes in a cardboard box and most end up in our landfills.............3 billion in the USA alone, every year.

The dream of Good News Reuse™ is to halt this wasteful practice. So far we have been entirely self-funded, but now we need your help to produce and bring the Pi Pan to market. We hope you are inspired by Good News Reuse™ and the Pi Pan. 

Please support us today by clicking the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button to the right and following the simple payment instructions.

Spread the good news and share our idea with your pizza-loving, eco-conscious friends and family! We can make this happen if you help get the word out via email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or in conversation.

FAQs:What is the Pi Pan made of?


The Pi Pan is made of thin commercial food grade stainless steel, as thin as a reusable water bottle. It is BPA-free and does not contain other unhealthy chemicals. How long does a Pi Pan last?Stainless steel lasts forever but we modestly claim 1,000+ uses. The Pi Pan is recyclable at any point in its lifetime.Tell me more about it...The Pi Pan has an innovative yet timeless design. Advanced engineering ensures that the reusable Pi Pan is lightweight yet strong, keeps pizzas hotter for longer, and is easy to clean. The initial Pi Pan is designed to fit a 14” or 16” pizza, the most common sizes for take-out and delivery. The geometries of the design are easily extendable to different sizes. Aluminum and stainless steel pans are widely used in pizza operations so there is already a familiarity of use for operators and consumers.



Does the Pi Pan require assembly?Unlike a traditional cardboard pizza box, there is no assembly required. What are some of the benefits of the Pi Pan?
Reusable - lasts forever
Pays for itself after 30 uses in businesses with reoccurring deliveries
Delivers a hotter, crispier, tastier pizza - no cardboard taste
Adapts easily into existing food operations
Attractive, simple, lasting design
Environmental contribution and statement
BPA-free, with no other unhealthy chemicals

How much will the Pi Pan cost?For commercial food operators, we plan to sell the Pi Pan for $15 to $20 at volume production (the average cost of a cardboard pizza box is $0.50). For retail customers, we plan to sell the Pi Pan for $34.95. Why are you first promoting the Pi Pan for use at pizzerias and food companies instead of to individual consumers?  

We are targeting food service companies who make reoccurring deliveries to schools and businesses because we think we can make the quickest environmental impact here. Schools are especially important to us because kids learn by doing.


Will you sell Pi Pans to individuals?


Ultimately we want all pizza lovers to have a reusable Pi Pan. Individual Pi Pans will be available on our website soon. 


Could I use a Pi Pan at home? Yes. There are several home uses. 

Transport your pizza from your local pizzeria, saving a cardboard box. It’s just like bringing in your own reusable shopping bag.


Reheat your pizza on the Pi Pan bottom. 


Serve your pizza on the Pi Pan, just as if you were eating in a pizzeria. 


Cleaning is easy. Just use soap, water, and a gentle scrub brush as needed. For businesses, it is commercial dishwasher safe.




A cardboard pizza box works perfectly well. Why do we need a reusable one?It is cheaper, healthier, more sustainable and the pizza tastes better.Most people are surprised to learn that pizza boxes are not recyclable. People also don’t realize that recycled cardboard contains BPAs.Pizza box waste impacts the environment negatively in three ways:
Destruction of trees and other environmental resources;
Excessive waste in our landfills and/or contamination of community recycling projects, as food contaminated containers are not recyclable or compostable in most communities;
Perpetuation of the single-use mentality among consumers, particularly school age children.

Is the Pi Pan patented? Yes we have a provisional patent. 



The $100+ perks include MiiR reusable water bottles. What is your connection to MiiR?

Good News Reuse™ has partnered with MiiR on their one4one initiative. This means that for every MiiR/Good News Reuse™ reusable water bottle purchased, you will be providing one deserving person with clean water for an entire year.

Why don't you offer the Pi Pan as a perk?
We had hoped to offer the Pi Pan as a perk, but decided to seek just enough money to manufacturer the prototype and samples for potential businesses. Once we are up and running, all IndieGoGo supporters will have the opportunity to purchase the first Pi Pans at discounted prices.

What will the money from IndieGoGo be used for?


Produce the tooling dies for the top and bottom of the Pi Pan
Make samples for marketing and sales 
Complete all product and engineering tests for product launch



The funding goal of $70,000 was determined after receiving several quotes from manufacturers. If we meet this goal, we will have a finished prototype plus Pi Pan samples for potential customers. Based on manufacturers' timetables, the Pi Pan would be available within 6 months.



$70,000, less IndieGoGo fees, payment processing fees and perks, is the amount needed for the first phase of our business plan. If we receive more than $70,000, we will produce more samples and build a team to launch the Pi Pan. The more money we receive, the more significant impact we can make.





We want to express our sincere gratitude in advance for your contribution to this new venture. If successfully funded, we will hit the ground running and keep you in the loop throughout the process. If we don't reach our goal, these funds will be used towards the company's second revolutionary reusable concept, currently under development.






What is Good News Reuse™? 



Good News Reuse™ is a start-up dedicated to reducing waste in the food and beverage industry. We decided to create the Pi Pan after discovering that Americans throw away 3 billion single-use cardboard pizza boxes every year. Ultimately we want to introduce other reusable concepts to replace the vast amount of single-use containers that crowd our landfills. 



Once profitable Good News Reuse™ will donate at least 1% of annual sales to nonprofits working to protect our environment and promote environmental awareness. In the meantime, our way of helping is by partnering with MiiR on their one4one water initiative.



Who are the creators of Good News Reuse™? 



Susan is a die-hard foodie and longtime environmentalist in Mill Valley, California. She is the creative force behind Good News Reuse™. With broad experience in all facets of food service, she is fully dedicated to providing reusable sustainable solutions to the excessive waste in the industry. Jeff is the key strategist for Good News Reuse™. He loves food and technology and is a consumer products guru. He hails from San Francisco and has held executive positions with Fortune 100 companies and start-ups, from semi-conductors to LED lighting. 


Together, Susan and Jeff have combined their talents to develop Good News Reuse™ and the Pi Pan.




How can I help?

93% of our population eats pizza once a month. Every take-out pizza comes in a cardboard box and most end up in our landfills.............3 billion in the USA alone, every year. 
 

The dream of Good News Reuse™ is to halt this wasteful practice. So far we have been entirely self-funded, but now we need your help to produce and bring the Pi Pan to market. We hope you are inspired by Good News Reuse™ and the Pi Pan. 


Please support us today by clicking the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button to the right and following the simple payment instructions.









Spread the good news and share our idea with your pizza-loving, eco-conscious friends and family! We can make this happen if you help get the word out via email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or in conversation.

story:
Our Story

Suprpod was founded to address two key issues that marketers face: 

  1. There is no portfolio tool to make marketing campaign content/data visually appealing
  2. Freelancers and small marketing teams lack the power that larger groups of creatives have
We want to create an exclusive community of creative marketers. A place where ideas are dreamt up and shared, and users have a simple way to display their best content and data. 

The Impact

Artists create beautiful portfolios, scientists perform hard-hitting studies. Marketing is somewhere between an art and a science, where we pair creativity with metrics to produce some amazing results.

You are the talent. Suprpod provides you with a platform to show off your talent to a community that appreciates it. We are the ones who eat, sleep, breathe marketing. Join us. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to get Suprpod developed and launched. We need the full website up and running so marketers can start using it!

Any residual funding we receive will go into our launch efforts, events to bring together our community (of course our funders are welcome!), and opportunities for education sessions.

You will not only receive our undying gratitude, but also the perks outlined by contribution level. We so very much appreciate your support while we launch. Thank you.

Our Suprpod Cards:

Our official Suprpod T-Shirts!

Our first of three poster designs!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign - use the share tools through this site to make your friends aware.

story:
Imagine one 6:00 a.m. heading to work from your home which is about a 2 hour drive away and realizing that you’re not feeling as pep as you normally are.  Despite this gnawing feeling, you tough it out anyway.  As the day progressed, the feeling of malaise worsened.  Then you just pass out.  This happened to my boss, Brenda, at work at the Unleashed in Long Beach, CA.  She could not recall passing out but recalled finding herself in the ICU not aware for what reason.  She was told that she was having issues with her heart and kidneys and would have to stay in the hospital until they could determine the nature of the problem.  The only things that Brenda could think about were her five kids at home which again was at least a 2 hour drive back.  There was also her disabled boyfriend who, just two months back, was in a serious car accident and was left debilitated and could not work.  Because Brenda is the sole earner for this family of seven (four boys, one girl, her boyfriend and herself), her thoughts immediately were of the financial impact this hospital stay would create in their already surmounting financial decline.

 

Despite her fear of the financial uncertainty, Brenda continued with her treatments at the hospital for 3 weeks—all away from her precious family.  This was in late October.  While recuperating at home, she was looking forward to returning to work so that she could continue to provide the financial support to the family with the upcoming holiday season.  She initially was given notice to return to work early this month, December 2012.  Prior to coming back to work, she needed to see the doctors again to release her only to find out that she had an aneurism in her heart and that she was bleeding in that area.  Needless to say, she immediately underwent open heart surgery.  Although Brenda is back at home, she has very limited mobility.  She shares with us the scar she received from the surgery which stems from the right side of her neck to her belly button and another scar of the same length parallel to this on the left.  Because of her lack of mobility, Brenda is practically bed-ridden.  She labors to do everything including talking.  It goes without saying, she is unable to drive to work, much less work.  Because the holidays are coming and because she will be out of work for a minimum of three (3) months, I am appealing to your sense of humanity and spirit of giving in this season to help out this family.  The funds raised will be to assist her in maintaining their household for the next three months.  I am seeking enough funds for the members of her household to be able to live on for the next three months estimated at $1000 per person.

 

Please join me in showing random acts of kindness to this family who needs us most in this very trying time.  My connection to this cause and to Brenda:  she is currently my boss where I work on a part-time basis.  She took a chance in hiring me and giving me the opportunity to provide for my own family.  With your help, I can return the excellent deed she did for me.  Good deeds have been ingrained in me since I was a child, and I know many of you have that same sense of community and giving.  So let’s all come together and help Brenda win this battle.

story:
Joseph Robert Ludwick (“Joey”) passed away suddenly on July 19, 2012 in a car accident.  He leaves behind three young children, Tyler, Mason, and Leanna.  Joey was an amazing father, son, brother, coach and friend...who left us before we were ready to let him go.
 
The purpose of this trust is to provide financial assistance to Joey’s family, and particularly to pay for the cost of Joey’s funeral expenses and provide for the general welfare and security of his children.
 
No one is prepared when things like this happen.  Your support is greatly appreciated.
 
If you wish to donate IN PERSON, an account has been set up at Chase Bank under Joseph Ludwick Memorial Trust, account number 3016713470.
 
For more information contact Richie Ludwick at (858) 201-1413

story:
Here's the story...

My super awesome girlfriend just moved across the country with her son, some clothes, and a few other belongings.  We spend over 2 straight days on a train together going from Washington to New York.  And she spent all of her savings on the tickets, getting an apartment, and a couple other things she needed around her apartment.  But she has been really sick lately, and in a lot of pain due to some medical issues.  Because of these issues, she is unable to work.

Chandra would never ask someone for help, but she could really use a little help to get on her feet and moving here in NY.  Even if you have just a couple dollars to spare, it would go a long way in getting Chandra and her boy, Gavin, settled with what they need to make their apartment a home, and cover some expenses until she can get back on her feet.

So, yeah this would definitely be a blessing for her and Gavin!  

Spread the word, but keep it a secret.  I want this to be a surprise ;)

Thanks and God bless!

story:
On May 21 Jacob's mom Amanda got a call at work that said that Jacob had passed out at school and he was at the hospital and they were about to transport him to Scottish Right Hospital in Atlanta.  

After several blood transfusions and some tests, it was determined that he has Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia, a very serious, fast progressing form of leukemia.

Over the last 4 weeks he has had several rounds of chemotherapy and several blood transfusions that have taken the family back and forth from Thomaston to Atlanta and have take Jacob on a rollercoaster ride of ups and downs.  He appears to be responding well to the treatments but this is just the beginning for the family.

After he becomes stable he will still have to have chemotherapy monthly for the next 3 years and the medications that they has to take cost $100 per pill.  

Amanda being out of work for the last 4 weeks and many more to come needs our help in covering the cost of gas, bills, groceries, and medications, and on top of that the family will have to move into a house with central heat and air to regulate the temperature and moisture better to keep Jacob from getting sick.

If you are reading this and can afford to give even a little, please help.  Jacob is also stressed because he knows that his mother is not working and is concerned about the family finances.  Please help relieve their stress and help them get through this tough time.  If you are unable to give, your prayers will definately be appreciated.  Thank you.

P.S. To make this campaign successfull please share this link on facebook or through email to get more people involved.

story:
*Updated perk!*

For donors who contribute $10 and up to our campaign between Oct. 9 - 20th, receive 1 kg of vacuum-packed handcrafted chorizo sausages. These delectable chorizos won 2nd place in the Fraser Valley Sausage Competition in the professional chef category - and we're excited to share the taste sensation with you!

 

Our Food Story… Crumbs ‘n all  

  

Here, we’re looking for the people who love to eat and love to cook… but don’t want to learn cooking the way your grandma did.

The vision began with Waldemar in cooking school way back in Santa Barbara in the early 2000’s. Now fast-forward a decade, and his dream for his own commercial kitchen for cooking classes, catering and a private dinner club is coming alive.

See, we think cooking out of a recipe book isn’t really that interesting. In fact, it’s kind of messy – ever wanted to rip out that page or laminate it for fear of food (oh, the horrors!) stains on it? Yeah.

How about sitting in front of your TV watching the Food Network, wondering why it’s so damn easy for Cute Chef to cook that pasta dish with commercials in between, and not even break a sweat?

Yeah. Cooking bites sometimes. Or sometimes you’re just lazy and don’t feel like cooking. That’s why we’re here.

 

The Entrée-Sized Version of Our Story: 

We want to meet you… if you’re the kind of person who craves learning to cook in a fun way. An easy way. Where your cooking class is easy to get to (think 5 minutes from downtown Vancouver), parking is free, your chef is easy to follow and talk to, and what happens when you’re well fed and grooving to music? You even learn something along the way! 

Waldemar’s run enough cooking classes over the past number of years to know that nobody likes a quiet, awkward cooking class where you feel like the high school nerd.

We want you to fall in love with the reason why you’re alive. Hint - no, it’s not processed junk food – it’s real food that came from the ground, the farm and made it to your table.

We’re talking about food appreciation. Learn about all the ways you can learn to cook that seafood, bring the recipes home and enjoy the awe and taste sensations of “Whoa…I really made THAT!”

Because food is so much more than nuking a frozen dinner, or making something that makes you bored to tears because you’ve had it the last ten weekends in a row.

Food is about passion.

Sharing stories over a glass of wine or beer and laughing with your friends.

It’s about bringing your friends along TO the class you’re going to take, or ordering dinner and watching it cooked live in front of you.

If you think cooking is boring, or that it’s just your girlfriend’s job…think again. Get out of your granny mentality.

 


The Scoop on Indiegogo – Where the $$ is Going  

You’re helping our location become a Vancouver destination. Your contributions are going to help build and sustain a food culture in a commercial kitchen that’s ready for action.

 

Your donation shows your commitment to food appreciation.

 

We Chose Flexible Funding in 40 days, 40 nights.

We chose this option because no matter WHAT the amount, we are going to be grateful to be using it towards the list of items we need to finish off the kitchen with.

Every little bit helps at this point, to help us pay off the costs of building this place.  Commercial kitchen equipment is bloody expensive.

When we started the project and secured the building lease last winter, the 3,000 square-foot location was in fact half an office space and a complete wreck. But the vision was set, and we just had to go for it. 

It had to be completely demolished. All the plumbing and electrical work had to be done from scratch (behind the walls is now a stunning pipe job), and the construction effort, which began this spring, has taken over much of our time and budget.

In short, the funds will be used to pay off:

-construction costs: electrical, plumbing, & ventilation; and

-costs of the custom commercial kitchen equipment we’ve installed.

 

What We’re Cooking Up 

 

Here’s the tour of the plans for our kitchen. What’s happening:

Cooking Classes

Here, everybody gets to eat a full-course dinner in every class they sign up for.

Learn to cook with 15 types of seafood in an evening. If you’re horrible with your knife skills, come learn how to chop like a Top Chef.

During the class, come in and have appies.  Enjoy the music. Have a beverage.  Joke around with the chef, roll out the dough, talk about your first burned college dorm meal. Why not? Because it’s going to be that kind of space.

Forget the chef in the stiff white hat… we’ll be bringing in Executive Chefs from the best restaurants around town and around the world who want to joke around and have fun with their audience.

Our classes are semi-interactive – meaning that you get to volunteer if you’re super-keen, but if you’re shy that doesn’t mean you don’t get to eat.

Here…everyone eats!


Private Catering

 Our philosophy is that you’ll hire us to work hard at your evening, so you don’t have to. Waldemar has been in the private catering industry for over 10 years, and he knows that the client deserves to enjoy their evening as much as the guests they’ve invited – from the start to finish, until the last guest tips his hat out the door. 

Our catering menu selections are adapted to your evening and are designed to showcase the chef’s culinary skill while providing maximum visuals for your guests. Cooking with fire? Check. Beautiful food plated in front of your eyes? Check. It’s fun food entertainment.

In-House Catering for Meetings & Private Events

Our lounge and open kitchen space is built for a small group of people (25-40) looking for an evening meeting space with catered food going for a reasonable rate. 


Private dinner club

We’re also going to be launching an exclusive dinner night on Fridays. Our sittings will be for 20 at a time, so it’s nice and cozy. We have a select menu for you to choose from, for everyone from carnivores to vegetarians. 

What’s on course? It’s going to be one price, all-inclusive for an appetizer, complementary beverage, entrée, and dessert.

Check out the live music, order your food and watch it cooked right in front of you. You’ll know it’s stunningly fresh, clean and might learn a few cooking secrets along the way.

 


Perks for Your Contributions (The Dessert)

We really want to thank you first for making it THIS far down our project description! The perks we’re offering range from…

 

A dish named after you: Get it as a gift for a friend, or just for you – Waldemar will name a special dish after you. We’ll feature it in a cooking class and post it on our blog. Yummy. 

The educational (and fun): Of course, we’re selling cooking class tickets too – so get ‘em while they’re hot. Book in the first 2 months of our classes and get a 16 oz. Govino wine glass!

The super-personal: Get your name & photo up on our Wall of Fame everyone will see when they walk into a cooking class and lounge event.

Chef’s Dinner & Smoke Night: Grab your best friends and enjoy a private cooking class (up to 8 people), followed by a cigar tasting in our lounge. We’ve got a selection of teambuilding or cooking classes to suit your style – great for birthdays, or just a fun night out with your friends.

If you’ve got any questions or need details for any of the perks, please ask and we’ll do our best (and fastest) to post updates and answer them on Indiegogo.

 

L’Apertif: Other ways you can help 

IF YOU READ THIS FAR WE’RE GOING TO GIVE YOU A FREE BEER ON THE HOUSE WHEN YOU STOP BY OUR KITCHEN!!

Now, if you’re truly short on change, that’s ok. You can help in a big way by sharing this campaign with one or two people you know who love food (those folks who watch the Food Network, imagine that they’re Gordon Ramsay, you KNOW the type) and love playing with their food.

Share the love. Follow us on Twitter @WLive_cooking; retweet, and like us on Facebook…

Ok. We confess. We’re not on Facebook – so we’re a little anti-establishment, but we believe that a great product and experience will sell itself better through word of mouth than a million likes on a Facebook page. However, if you DO dig Facebook,  give us a mention… you can be our Facebook rep!

Thank you so much… we want to share our vision with you and others like you, and we’re moving our business forward because of the time you’re taking to share OUR mission!

We want you to fall in love with the reason why you’re alive. Hint - no, it’s not processed junk food – it’s real food that came from the ground, the farm and made it to your table.
We’re talking about food appreciation. Learn about all the ways you can learn to cook that seafood, bring the recipes home and enjoy the awe and taste sensations of “Whoa…I really made THAT!”
Because food is so much more than nuking a frozen dinner, or making something that makes you bored to tears because you’ve had it the last ten weekends in a row.
Food is about passion.
Sharing stories over a glass of wine or beer and laughing with your friends.
It’s about bringing your friends along TO the class you’re going to take, or ordering dinner and watching it cooked live in front of you.
If you think cooking is boring, or that it’s just your girlfriend’s job…think again. Get out of your granny mentality.
 
The Scoop on Indiegogo – Where the $$ is Going  
You’re helping our location become a Vancouver destination. Your contributions are going to help build and sustain a food culture in a commercial kitchen that’s ready for action.
 
Your donation shows your commitment to food appreciation. 
 
We Chose Flexible Funding in 40 days, 40 nights.
We chose this option because no matter WHAT the amount, we are going to be grateful to be using it towards the list of items we need to finish off the kitchen with.
Every little bit helps at this point, to help us pay off the costs of building this place.  Commercial kitchen equipment is bloody expensive.
When we started the project and secured the building lease last winter, the 3,000 square-foot location was in fact half an office space and a complete wreck. But the vision was set, and we just had to go for it. 
It had to be completely demolished. All the plumbing and electrical work had to be done from scratch (behind the walls is now a stunning pipe job), and the construction effort, which began this spring, has taken over much of our time and budget.
In short, the funds will be used to pay off:
-construction costs: electrical, plumbing, & ventilation; and
-costs of the custom commercial kitchen equipment we’ve installed.
 
What We’re Cooking Up 
 
Here’s the tour of the plans for our kitchen. What’s happening:
Cooking Classes Here, everybody gets to eat a full-course dinner in every class they sign up for.
Learn to cook with 15 types of seafood in an evening. If you’re horrible with your knife skills, come learn how to chop like a Top Chef.
During the class, come in and have appies.  Enjoy the music. Have a beverage.  Joke around with the chef, roll out the dough, talk about your first burned college dorm meal. Why not? Because it’s going to be that kind of space.
Forget the chef in the stiff white hat… we’ll be bringing in Executive Chefs from the best restaurants around town and around the world who want to joke around and have fun with their audience.
Our classes are semi-interactive – meaning that you get to volunteer if you’re super-keen, but if you’re shy that doesn’t mean you don’t get to eat.
Here…everyone eats!

Private Catering
 Our philosophy is that you’ll hire us to work hard at your evening, so you don’t have to. Waldemar has been in the private catering industry for over 10 years, and he knows that the client deserves to enjoy their evening as much as the guests they’ve invited – from the start to finish, until the last guest tips his hat out the door. 
Our catering menu selections are adapted to your evening and are designed to showcase the chef’s culinary skill while providing maximum visuals for your guests. Cooking with fire? Check. Beautiful food plated in front of your eyes? Check. It’s fun food entertainment.
In-House Catering for Meetings & Private Events 
Our lounge and open kitchen space is built for a small group of people (25-40) looking for an evening meeting space with catered food going for a reasonable rate. 
Private dinner club 
We’re also going to be launching an exclusive dinner night on Fridays. Our sittings will be for 20 at a time, so it’s nice and cozy. We have a select menu for you to choose from, for everyone from carnivores to vegetarians. 
What’s on course? It’s going to be one price, all-inclusive for an appetizer, complementary beverage, entrée, and dessert.
Check out the live music, order your food and watch it cooked right in front of you. You’ll know it’s stunningly fresh, clean and might learn a few cooking secrets along the way.
 
Perks for Your Contributions (The Dessert)
We really want to thank you first for making it THIS far down our project description! The perks we’re offering range from…
 
A dish named after you: Get it as a gift for a friend, or just for you – Waldemar will name a special dish after you. We’ll feature it in a cooking class and post it on our blog. Yummy. 
The educational (and fun): Of course, we’re selling cooking class tickets too – so get ‘em while they’re hot. Book in the first 2 months of our classes and get a 16 oz. Govino wine glass!
The super-personal: Get your name & photo up on our Wall of Fame everyone will see when they walk into a cooking class and lounge event. Chef’s Dinner & Smoke Night: Grab your best friends and enjoy a private cooking class (up to 8 people), followed by a cigar tasting in our lounge. We’ve got a selection of teambuilding or cooking classes to suit your style – great for birthdays, or just a fun night out with your friends.
If you’ve got any questions or need details for any of the perks, please ask and we’ll do our best (and fastest) to post updates and answer them on Indiegogo.
 

L’Apertif: Other ways you can help 

IF YOU READ THIS FAR WE’RE GOING TO GIVE YOU A FREE BEER ON THE HOUSE WHEN YOU STOP BY OUR KITCHEN!!
Now, if you’re truly short on change, that’s ok. You can help in a big way by sharing this campaign with one or two people you know who love food (those folks who watch the Food Network, imagine that they’re Gordon Ramsay, you KNOW the type) and love playing with their food.
Share the love. Follow us on Twitter @WLive_cooking; retweet, and like us on Facebook…
Ok. We confess. We’re not on Facebook – so we’re a little anti-establishment, but we believe that a great product and experience will sell itself better through word of mouth than a million likes on a Facebook page. However, if you DO dig Facebook,  give us a mention… you can be our Facebook rep!
Thank you so much… we want to share our vision with you and others like you, and we’re moving our business forward because of the time you’re taking to share OUR mission!

story:
Geek Brew Cafe needs your help to open-

WE DO NOT NEED THE 10,000 TO OPEN. Our down payment to get things MOBILE will be about 6,000 dollars. We need about half that in contributions to get Geek Brew off the ground.

      We want to be open to provide great things to the community, including:  great coffee with organic syrups and sugars; gluten free, vegetarian and organic pastries; fair trade and organic chocolate bars and teas; and healthy energy drink options, all in recyclable and compostable materials for your drive-thru or walk in needs. 

      It doesn’t stop here! Helping us open Geek Brew Cafe in this coffee stand will also be helping us open a full cafe in the future; for the community, by the community and in the community. We want this cafe to have the space and capacity for seating and serving, concerts, open mic nights, group meetings and similar events. In this way we will draw in and maintain a larger stakeholder base, for whom we envision Geek Brew Cafe as a gathering point and social hub. We plan to provide a spiritual gift shop inside of this bigger facility, a meeting space open to community members, a gamer room that can satisfy our geeky gamer needs, and a self-sustaining orchard/garden, maintained by and for the benefit of community members. These are just few of the things that our dream for Geek Brew can become. 

You can be a part of that dream by helping us open our doors. 

Let's Break It Down-

We have a bank who is willing to fund us, but the days of funding with no down payment are over. We need to put 6 down to be able to open our doors. Both Kat and I are investing about half of that amount and we need the community to help us come up with the rest (and get some perks in the process!).

We will use this money for:

Down payment on the loan that will pay for the stand in which Geek Brew Cafe will reside. 

What will we do without the money from the community?

We will continue to save our money to gather enough for a down payment for a loan to open business. (which might take a very long time)

What would we do with more than the 6k we are hoping to fundraise? 

We would put more money as a down payment, or use some as a cushion once our doors are open to make it through the early stages when most businesses are 'in the red'. 

 

What your Contribution Will Do-

Your contribution will make it possible to open Geek Brew Cafe. It will make it possible to provide:  healthy pastries made by local community members; great coffee (and amazing discounts) by a well known and preferred local roaster; jobs for community members that wouldn't fit a normal barista ideal (our Geek Brew employees will be guys and girls with great passion, flair, and intellect that fit all different cultural varieties); and a place to connect with all things in the community. For instance, Geek Brew, even in our small coffee stand form, will be showcasing community members' artwork on our walls for sale and for pleasure. We will be selling vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free pastries made by local community members, making no money off of their products so that they can retain the full profit. We will keep a community message board that will contain announcements, goods and services that people in the community need or have so that they can connect with others in the community who might wish to exchange services. These are only a few community benefits that we will offer at our coffee stand; and many, many more that we can offer when we expand to the Cafe. 

Other Ways You Can Help-

Can't help us with any monetary contributions? No worries, we totally understand.

What can you do instead?

Help us get the word out there! Make some noise, re-post and share this campaign on your Facebook page, G+, or Twitter every day while the campaign is running; e-mail your friends, tell them about all of the beautiful and exciting benefits that can come from opening Geek Brew Cafe as an asset to our community.

story:
Hi, we are Tara & Raciel Esperanza, owners of Tara's Organic Ice Cream.  We produce small-batch, artisanal ice cream and sorbets.  We are a Certified Organic Company and Certified Bay Area Green Business.   More about TOIC in the videos, but here's the scoop...

Tara's Organic Ice Cream is growing!

We currently have scoop shops in Berkeley and Oakland CA and sell pints in 30+ natural grocery stores in California.  We are receiving inquiries from shops and restaurants that want to offer our ice cream to their customers and customers who want to see our ice cream in their local grocery stores PLUS we are working on opening a third shop in Pleasenton CA but need your help to get there.  We are running on a bootstrap budget with only 1 machine that produces all of this product in small batches of 2 or 3 gallons at a time and making all the deliveries with our own personal vehicles.

What we need:

  • Capacity!  We need a 2nd machine to double our productivity and have a back-up option should our only hard-working machine ever need service. It's a necessary purchase to take Tara's Organic Ice Cream to the next level.
  • Mobility!   We need a fuel-efficient, dedicated delivery vehicle to be able to service the growing wholesale business as well as support our 3rd shop opening this summer in Pleasanton CA!

Why Give?

  • You love artisanal ice cream (who doesn't?)
  • You love businesses committed to local and organic food
  • You love businesses committed to green and sustainable practices
  • You want to see more TOIC in Bay Area grocery stores
  • You want a TOIC scoop shop in Pleasenton CA
  • You feel and want to help spread the organic ice cream love

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can help by spreading the word on your FB page and just generally make some noise about our campaign! It's a solid endeavor and Tara's Organic Ice Cream is committed to the Bay Area community, our environment and organic, sustainable living!

With your help, we can make more ice cream and spread the Organic Ice Cream Love. Any amount helps! We know that we are asking a lot! It's not easy to ask, but these items are very expensive. So with that in mind, please help us spread the word, and share this with your family and friends.

Although we cannot promise you enlightenment for your generosity, we can give you kickbacks for your good Karma.  Your good deeds will be recognized. We are eternally grateful for your support, love, and love of Organic Ice Cream!

THANK YOU.
Sincerely and dearly,
Tara, Raciel, and the entire Tara's Organic Ice Cream team!
www.tarasorganic.com

More About TOIC

Tara's Organic Ice Cream is different.  It is made in small batches with fresh, organic ingredients with no artificial flavorings or stabilizers.  Bold flavors with a less-sweet flavor profile let the true flavors of fresh herbs, spices and fresh ingredients dominate.  TOIC has created 130+ different unique organic flavors, including specialized offerings for our gluten-free and diabetic customers.

The Fine Print on Perks

Cone Certificates:  If your perk includes a cone certificate, you will be able to pick it up at Tara's Organic scoop shop locations in Berkeley, Oakland, or coming soon to Pleasenton CA. 

T-Shirts: If you are one of the lucky few to get a TOIC Tshirt, It will be available for pickup at the Berkeley location, or we will happily mail it to you anywhere.  Supplies are limited.

Online Thanks:  We will be thanking all our Contributors on www.tarasorganic.com and our facebook page .  The Platinum Funders will include a link if you like and Angel Funders will also include a photo or logo if you like.

Custom-Made Cakes: 7 Days notice for order; pickup in Berkeley only.

IndidGoGo Pint Club:  If your perk includes membership in our indiegogo pint club, you will get a pint club card to bring in when you pick up your pint at any TOIC scoop shop.  Pint clubs include 1 pint per month for up to one year from May  2013 – May 2014.  If you have a 4 month card, you can come in to pick up a pint in any 4 months, months do not need to be consecutive.  Sorry, no rollover pints.

Ice Cream Socials:  If your perk includes an Ice Cream Social, you will be able to bring your friends into any TOIC scoop shop and each person can order any item with a topping (up to $10 value per person; excluding pints and cakes).  Must be scheduled 7 days in advance.

Ice Cream House Party:  Valid within a 60 minute drive from the Berkeley shop.  Must be scheduled 30 days in advance and will be subject to Tara's availability.  Blackout dates will apply if there is a street festival, fair or farmer's market that Tara needs to attend.  Otherwise, we will do all we can to accommodate you and look forward to serving you whatever you like!

Private Tastings:  Invitation for two people to attend a private TOIC tasting event hosted by Tara.  Tastings will including 5 flavors (which we'll agree on beforehand with your input).

Ice Cream Shipments:  If your perk includes a shipment of ice cream, the destination must be in the continental US.  You can choose from the following shipping dates for two-day shipping: June 3, September 3, December 3 2013 and March 3, 2014. 

Your Own Flavor:  If your perk includes a custom flavor, we can either create any flavor you like or consult with you to dream up the right flavor for you.  This flavor will be certified organic by CCOF named by you or after you.  (subject to approval)

All perks are valid until May 31, 2014 and will be honored at Tara's Organic scoop shops in Berkeley, Oakland, and coming soon to Pleasenton CA.

story:
THANK YOU to everyone who helped make Bloomfield Farm possible!  Check back soon for a full campaign update.  For now, if you did not get a chance to donate and would still like to start a farm in five minutes, please visit our website.  

www.BloomfieldFarmAlmonte.com

 

 

Check out media coverage of this campaign in USA TODAY , the Ottawa Citizen, and CBC.

http://www.usatoday.com/story/money/personalfinance/2013/05/22/crowdfunding-a-farm/2141255/

http://www.ottawacitizen.com/mobile/news/latest-updates/Organic+farm+crowdfunds+seed+money/8431648/story.html

 

http://www.cbc.ca/player/News/Canada/Ottawa/ID/2392517206/

 

The Project

I have been given an incredible opportunity to farm on a beautiful piece of land in Almonte, outside of Ottawa, Ontario. This community is excited to eat local food, and I am excited to grow it.

Much of my work has been guided by my interest in how food makes its way from farm to fork.  My first experience farming in Italy ignited a deep passion for righting the path of our food system, and connecting people to the sources of their food.  I have farmed in Connecticut, and taught at The Edible Schoolyard in Berkeley CA.  In Michigan, I managed a year-round CSA at Michigan State University's Student Organic Farm, managed MSU's Organic Farmer Training Program, and consulted with Ann Arbor's Parks & Recreation Commission to create a sustainable, productive, educational, and community-focused farm in a city park.

I believe that these experiences position me well to start my own farm, and to manage an educational farming program. 

Where Will the Money Go?

Take a look at how your donations can be used:

$10: A harvest knife

$50: Trellising supplies for growing heirloom tomatoes

$250:  A tool that efficiently seeds salad greens

$500: Compost for soil fertility management

$750: Supplies for pest management and irrigation 

$1,000:  Hand tools for cultivating, weeding, and harvesting

$10,000: A deer fence that will allow for a significant increase in production, as well as wages for two local youth

$25,000: Larger quantities of the supplies/tools listed above, as well as wages for more employees, allowing us to increase production

Anything beyond this will be used to create a vibrant educational farming program where local youth learn leadership and farming skills while providing wholesome food to their community.

The Impact

If you have ever seen the look on a kid's face when he unearths a potato or when she sees that a planted seed has sprouted, you know that connecting people to the sources of their food is not a small thing.   Imagine if everyone knew their farmers, just as they know their doctors, dentists, lawyers and plumbers.  The world would be a different place.

Initially, the farm will provide food to the community and local restaurants.  Over time, the educational program will teach young people where food comes from, provide them with meaningful work, and build community. 

Can't afford to Donate? You can still help!

Please consider helping me to get the word out about this project.  Indiegogo has great sharing tools, and I think that we can harness a lot of support from our family, friends, community, and social networks together.

Questions?

Please do not hesitate to contact me with questions.  Email is best.  rebecca.bloomfield(at)gmail.com

story:
I have decided to re-launch this project as a new and fixed funds campaign.

I feel that with the flexible funding option I chose first was not a good choice,  the problem is that If the minimum funding I needed to actually launch my project was not pledged, my project could never proceed and your contributions you made in good faith and with your trust in me would be in question. 

That would bother me.

With the fixed funding option, if the financial  goal is not met you get your money back.

That would have been much better original choice.

This is the Link to New fixed project

 

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/my-have-a-goo...

 

Thx 

Glen Burford
story_txt:
I have decided to re-launch this project as a new and fixed funds campaign.
I feel that with the flexible funding option I chose first was not a good choice,  the problem is that If the minimum funding I needed to actually launch my project was not pledged, my project could never proceed and your contributions you made in good faith and with your trust in me would be in question. 
That would bother me.
With the fixed funding option, if the financial  goal is not met you get your money back.
That would have been much better original choice.
This is the Link to New fixed project
 
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/my-have-a-goo...
 
Thx 
Glen Burford

story:
Hello guys!

I am Federico, I am 23 years old and I live in Italy!

I have been producing my own beer with my girlfriend, my co-brewmaser, from some months now and I am enjoying it very much, I also had some pretty good results with these.

We have used the prepared kit for the moment, but we want to achieve better results now.

 In these productions we used a small kit  but now we need more instruments to take it to the next level.

Unfortunately my actual work doesn't allow me to buy the new tool that i need.

I love very hoppy beers, which in Italy are just starting to have some success.

 During the donation we will constantly update this page to show you what we can buy with the money we collect.

My final purpose would be producing my own beer, for me and my friends and maybe in the very next future I will also try to sell my beer to some pubs and restaurant in my city!

I want to thank you all in advance for reading this and hopefully support my project!

story:
Short Summary

 

 

 

I had a friend from San Antonio who flew to Dallas to have her face and neck lift. Her plastic surgeon had an out of town package with a 4-5 star hotel for her to recover in for about 3days. She had to hire a nurse for the three days which includes room and board. My friend had to buy a lazyboy recliner because she had to lay at an angle, after this she donated the recliner to the hotel for the next patient.

The problem in the US is there are no full facilities to accommodate the high demand of medical/wellness tourism. The Revivify3 concept will provide an outlet for the demand by combines traditional spa treatments with clinically proven surgical and non-surgical skin and body rejuvenation procedures, anti-aging, preventive medicine, medical/wellness tourism, education & hospitality with superior service and privacy.

Revivify3 is to impart new life, energy, and spirit by offering the best plastic surgery, intergrated wellness center, spa, luxury suites, gourmet' dinning.

The best part is we will have Doctors, RN's, and Profesional staff working at our medical/wellness Resort. So no buying extra things, hiring extra personal nurses or instructors for the spa & fitness center,we will have all that is needed plus all the educational tools to get or keep your healthy lifestyle. 

 

What We Need

I am seeking 500,000. This is to buy the land, also pay the architecture for the building plans and remodeling the existing buildings. This will get us started putting together Revivify3 medical / wellness Resort. Also with this money I will be hiring some key employees to help with the organization of the Resort. When we are ready to open we will have hired at least 50 people and introduced medical tourism in the United States. This type of resort will be first to market. How exciting to know you have help create a dream come true and put the USA on the map for Medical Tourism.  Can you help me?

What set the Revivify3 medical and wellness resort is we will not be a big place but a place that is elegant and yet casual. We will have 32 luxury suites with every amenities ( yes, that means most media stuff) that we can offer for our guest that would like to relax or recover from surgery. We will have our RN and staff looking after you for your entire stay. Our Spa and fitness center will have fitness and lifestyle instructor on hand to offer classes or consultation. We will have alternative medicine such as acupuncture, acupressure, Yoga, Ti Chi, meditation, and don’t forget our fitness center and when you are done go to our spa and relax. Need a haircut or a golf putting green just for practice. We specialize in pampering for the Men and Women.

The six acres of the Revivify3 grounds will feature walking and running paths, ecofriendly

landscaping for water and energy conservation, fountains fed from natural

water sources and outdoor treatment and relaxation spaces.

The restaurant will serve gourmet healthy cuisine with visiting guest chefs from

around the world scheduled regularly.

 

 Our funds will go into the business and we will seek other investors or donations.  I will persevere in achieving my goal.  I have waited for a long time to put this new medical concept on paper and into action. I put together a business plan and a financial proforma so I would let the investors know what we are about and our growth plan. I have had great response from Investors, plastic surgeons, and anybody that would listen. They all loved it but did not want to be the first to invest in this Economy and told me I need more skin in the game, as they put it. So I went and asked my friends and family.We raised a little bit to get us started, but like most people we are all watching our expenses. Now is the time for action, please donate and make this a reality.

The Impact

The vision and mission for Revivify3 is to impart new life, energy and spirit by offering the best plastic surgery, spa, medical spa and hospitality experience while teaching the importance of a well balanced lifestyle. Revivify3 will accomplish this goal through its highly personalized service in a five diamond level facility.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help--Help bring in Medical Tourism in the USA.

  • Please let everyone you know about our exciting medical/wellness Resort
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Le Village de Zellidja Boubeker

Je m'appelle Ilhame-Irène Lamrani, fruit d'un mariage mixte.

J'ai toujours vécu entre la France et le Maroc, une expérience unique. Posséder une double culture est très enrichissant, je pense que tous ceux qui sont dans ce cas là ne me contrediront pas  ! Depuis 5 ans, je suis gérante d'une société de production audiovisuelle avec mon mari. Passionnés par les images, par les histoires, c'est celle de mon père que je souhaite vous faire partager. 

Mon père est issu d'un tout petit village minier situé au sud-est de la ville dOujda. Un tout petit village perdu au fin fond du Maroc : Zellidja Boubeker. Pourtant il ne s'agit pas d'un village comme les autres, avec presque 26 nationalités représentées.

En 2005, mon père nostalgique de Zellidja Boubeker décide de créer un site internet pour retrouver ses habitants, partager les souvenirs, échanger des photos, ...

C'est un véritable raz de marée qu'il va provoquer ! Un an après, une association voit le jour, puis deux, puis trois. Ils sont plus d'une centaine à se retrouver en Espagne en 2010 venus de France, Allemagne, Suisse, ...

Je voulais rendre hommage à mon père à travers ce film. Un homme nostalgique qui a réussi à partir d'un site internet a rassembler plusieurs communautés pour faire revivre un village. Ainsi de nombreuses actions ont été menées pour donner un second souffle : un Centre Social, une Boulangerie, une école, ... 

Le film que je souhaite réaliser avec mon époux retraçerait tout ce fabuleux parcours et permettrait surtout de continuer à développer les différentes actions mises en place. Ce film apporterait une visibilité encore plus grande pour dégager des subventions et pourquoi pas reconstruire le village dans son intégralité ou du moins à en préserver et entretenir ce qu'il en reste.

Alors quoi de plus beau pour une fille que de pouvoir raccompagner son père sur les lieux de ses racines et de voir ses yeux briller devant le village de son enfance.

C'est grâce à vos contributions que je serais en mesure de payer les billets d'avions à notre équipe de tournage pour se rendre au Maroc mais aussi en Espagne pour aller à la rencontre des enfants de Zellidja. Ce sont vos contributions qui permettront de payer l'hébergement, les repas, ... et la réalisation complète d'un reportage d'une durée de 52 minutes.

 

Si l'objectif n'est malheurseuemt pas atteint, l'intégralité des fonds seront reversés aux différentes associations oeuvrant pour les bienfaits du village. La somme allouée pourra être répartie sur une des actions menées dans le village.

Je m'adresse à vous tous ! Ce documentaire offrirait un éclairage nouveau sur Zellidja. Découvrir ce qui a été réalisé et tout ce qu'il reste encore à faire. L'ambition est forte et les projets nombreux : dépolluer le village, le reconstruire partiellement, créer des emplois, redynamiser le tourisme, ....

Parti de l'idée d'un seul homme et rapidement rejoint par des proches, des amis, des sympathisants, le projet a pris une ampleur inespérée ... alors je n'ose  imaginer le résultat avec toutes les communautés à nos côtés. Les projets pour ce village sont tellement nombreux et je serais tellement fière de pouvoir laisser quelque chose, moi qui n'ai pas eu la chance de connaître ce village, mes origines, mes racines, ...

story:
Short Summary

We are a team of designers, landscape architects, and engineers from Hyphae Design Laboratory and Urban Biofilter in Oakland, CA who came together outside of work hours to prototype a piece of urban infrastructure that could improve the lives of San Francisco residents.

The result? PPlanter.

The motivation?

  • Celebrating San Francisco’s progression towards mobile and outdoor services including food trucks, beer gardens, and parklets by providing a place for people to relieve themselves while being outside!
  • Turning a nuisance (public urination) into a nutrient for hungry bamboo biofilters
  • Experimenting with smart urban infrastructure that tracks usage + includes a mobile app for user feedback to inform future design solutions! 

The design?

PPlanter is a rapidly deployable, reconfigurable public urinal and sink that uses modular bamboo biofilters to treat urine and wastewater. A network of sensors for automated monitoring and a responsive web application enable public feedback and participation in the design of future iterations.

The event?

Our prototype will be seen (and used!) by thousands of people at the Urban Prototyping festival on October 20th!! After the festival is over, we will tweak the design based on user feedback and begin promoting the PPlanter as an option for events, construction sites, and businesses that need urinals + greenery.   

What We Need & What You Get

Although we received $1000 in grant funding from Urban Prototyping, we need at least $1500 to bring PPlanter to life. Our materials list includes sensors, plumbing, plastic sheeting and signage, along with machining/services costs such as vaccum forming a sink and urinal, laser cutting, and printing. 

As tokens of our gratitude, we'll make stickers, custom P-mate urine funnels, and Tshirts to send your way, and list your name on our website. If you give more than $250, you can become an official sponsor!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we do raise will go to reimburse our project expenses and the rest will have to come from our pockets.

The Impact

You can feel AMAZING for having helped San Francisco become a less smelly place to walk around! 

Hyphae Design Lab and our partner non-profit organization, Urban Biofilter, have extensive experience designing and building water treatment systems, green roofs/walls, biofiltration units, and toilet systems. The PPlanter will inform Hyphae's design of future urban eco-infrastructure and allow us to help improve urban life and create greener cities!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends, tweet about us (#pplanter) and attend our upcoming events!!

October 8th - Refreshed + Relieved: a Fundraiser @ 111 Minna Gallery in SF

October 20th - Urban Prototyping SF: we will be located @ 5th and Minna Streets... just look for the bamboo!

Please also check out and support Urban Biofilter!

story:
What We Do

The Fareground Cafe, in downtown Beacon, New York, will be a pay-what-you-can cafe serving delicious, locally-sourced, nutritious meals. People will pay what they can for the food they eat, work in exchange for a meal, and have opportunities to learn and work through the food service job training built into the community cafe concept. Fareground will offer education and volunteer opportunities and be a gathering place where the entire community can share a good meal. Additionally, collaborations with other organizations focused on addressing food insecurity will further focus the cafe as a hub of resources for the community. 

Fareground intends to create a bridge between community, poverty, and sustainability in Beacon, which has a poverty level of 15.5% and a wide range of ethnic and economic diversity. The cafe is modeled on One World Everybody Eats, a successful restaurant in Salt Lake City, Utah whose non-profit management is serving as consultants on this project and which has been replicated in other cities. Two major features of the cafe are a variable menu and flexible pricing which makes it affordable for all people. The cafe will emphasize organic and unprocessed ingredients from local farms, so the buffet-style menu will change based on availability and provide access to fresh nutritious food. Customers cooperatively participate in determining portion size and a fair price for their meal. The cafe will be operated by those working in exchange for meals as well as by paid employees. Providing workshops on nutrition, gardening, composting, and  cooking in conjunction with sharing space with other organizations focused on food security will reinforce the goals of the cafe.

How It Works



Who We Are

Fareground was founded by Kara M. Dean-Assael, LMSW and Margot Schulman, Chef, Holistic Health Counselor, and joined by Tara Bernstein, JD, MPA. We work with an advisory board of community members, two interns from Vassar College, and a network of fantastic folks who donate their time to our cause of building local food security.




Above: Co-Founders Kara & Margot

What We Need

We need funds to lease a commercial space, purchase kitchen equipment  and supplies, fund salaries, and other start-up costs. After the initial year, the cafe will be funded through its own revenue. Please help us open our doors!

Also, see our wish list of items for the cafe in the "gallery" tab above(it's a link to a pdf file entitled "Wish List for Cafe")!

After you donate, please help spread the word about our project and our plan to bring this great project to Beacon!  Use the share tools below.
