story:
Help create the Women are Medicine Retreat Participation Fund

Your contribution will support Sikhethiwe and other women, who would otherwise not be able to afford it, to participate in the Women are Medicine retreat.

More about the retreat here: http://www.womenaremedicine.com/retreat

"My name is Sikhethiwe and I  am a  mother of two boys. I work at Kufunda Learning Village www.kufunda.org  as a youth facilitator as well I work with a women’s  group at Kufunda with the aim of supporting each other in being and becoming whom we want to be. We also make jewelry as a way of generating income for our families.

I have been working with Kufunda for the past ten years.  I am  inspired with the work we are doing  here as it has much meaning in  life we are living today. Working with Kufunda  is becoming a great life journey for  me, I have come to realize my passion my purpose of being in life and the path I would like to take. 

My greatest passion is to work with women from grass root level in my country. Realizing that they have much wisdom in them, as well to be out of  a lot of responsibilities  they carry in their lives  and have time to support each other in a  healthy  space.  I have strong feeling that  women  have a lot of potential in them as long as they are given an opportunity  and support they need.

As well.  to be in a journey of exploring what life is calling me  for ,as a women.  I    would like to challenge some  cultural beliefs  about  women in life and become a strong women who leads by a good example.

I gained a lot of courage in working with women through attending a leadership programme at  ALIA   Institute.  This programme opened  up a lot of  ideas on how I can work with women  and  how to  help identify the needs of women in my community.

I would like to participate in Women Are Medicine retreat as I feel the strong calling in me that there is much I can learn from other women who have the same vision with me of bringing life into the world through supporting each other as women. As well,  I can learn a lot from others as  there will be women from all background that will benefit me and how I can take women’s work to a next level. "


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Who are we?

We are four soul sisters whose paths have crossed in different times of our lives. We are all connected through a practice called the Art of Hosting meaningful conversations, which has found its way deep into all our work. We kindle the light in places where others see mostly darkness and chaos like rural Zimbabwe and Cairo. We amplify stories of a brave new world emerging. We are working with the gift economy. We create circles of support around women through doularship. We see parenting as a spiritual practice. We are all on the path of liberating our souls to come into their fullest expression in service of life and our planet.

Why are we organising the Women are Medicine retreat?

Our friendships have woven into a strong web that can hold a lot. We are inviting women who are ready to step into their fullest expression to weave their own threads into this web, because together we can hold even more. By holding we mean walking through life with strength and grace, bringing fierce loving kindness to whatever we do - my that be in our role as leaders, artists, mothers, sisters, daughters or professionals of any kind. We want to create a space for everyone to bring their gifts and see what emerges from that.

We carry a deep believe that all living beings on this planet are connected. One of the main causes of human suffering is our sense of separation from each other and our planet. At the core of our work is to create spaces where humans can reconnect to a sense of wholeness within ourselves and through authentic connection with each other and nature. We don't have the answers to what is it the worlds needs right now, but we have a sense that it needs us to reconnect. And this is what we are inviting: a space for reconnection. Creating such spaces is an integral part of our work and we have done so in many countries over the last decade (some of us even longer ;)).

If you are curious to learn more about the retreat or to join us see: http://www.womenaremedicine.com/retreat

 

What We Need & What You Get

If we reach our funding goal we will be able to cover Sikhithewe's flight and accommodation/food for her and 3 other women. If we raise more, more women will be able to participate.

A flight from Zimbabwe to Turkey costs about 1000€, the cost of accommodation and food for the 5 days we will spend there together is ca. 220€. 

For this retreat we are working with the gift economy. The hosting team is not charging a fee but inviting participants to gift towards covering our costs and time.

By contributing to this fund you will enable some wonderful women to strengthen their capacity to host their families and projects with grace and strength through connecting to other women and becoming part of a strong web of relationships that can hold the world in its loving arms.

"When spiders unite they can tear down a lion" an African proverb

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute but still want to help?

Help us spread the campaign and invite others to contribute. 

Indiegogo has some great share tools.

Thank you very much for any help you are offering. We grately appreciate it. <3
story_txt:
Help create the Women are Medicine Retreat Participation Fund
Your contribution will support Sikhethiwe and other women, who would otherwise not be able to afford it, to participate in the Women are Medicine retreat.
More about the retreat here: http://www.womenaremedicine.com/retreat



"My name is Sikhethiwe and I  am a  mother of two boys. I work at Kufunda Learning Village www.kufunda.org  as a youth facilitator as well I work with a women’s  group at Kufunda with the aim of supporting each other in being and becoming whom we want to be. We also make jewelry as a way of generating income for our families.
I have been working with Kufunda for the past ten years.  I am  inspired with the work we are doing  here as it has much meaning in  life we are living today. Working with Kufunda  is becoming a great life journey for  me, I have come to realize my passion my purpose of being in life and the path I would like to take. 
My greatest passion is to work with women from grass root level in my country. Realizing that they have much wisdom in them, as well to be out of  a lot of responsibilities  they carry in their lives  and have time to support each other in a  healthy  space.  I have strong feeling that  women  have a lot of potential in them as long as they are given an opportunity  and support they need.
As well.  to be in a journey of exploring what life is calling me  for ,as a women.  I    would like to challenge some  cultural beliefs  about  women in life and become a strong women who leads by a good example.
I gained a lot of courage in working with women through attending a leadership programme at  ALIA   Institute.  This programme opened  up a lot of  ideas on how I can work with women  and  how to  help identify the needs of women in my community.
I would like to participate in Women Are Medicine retreat as I feel the strong calling in me that there is much I can learn from other women who have the same vision with me of bringing life into the world through supporting each other as women. As well,  I can learn a lot from others as  there will be women from all background that will benefit me and how I can take women’s work to a next level. "
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Who are we?
We are four soul sisters whose paths have crossed in different times of our lives. We are all connected through a practice called the Art of Hosting meaningful conversations, which has found its way deep into all our work. We kindle the light in places where others see mostly darkness and chaos like rural Zimbabwe and Cairo. We amplify stories of a brave new world emerging. We are working with the gift economy. We create circles of support around women through doularship. We see parenting as a spiritual practice. We are all on the path of liberating our souls to come into their fullest expression in service of life and our planet.

Why are we organising the Women are Medicine retreat?
Our friendships have woven into a strong web that can hold a lot. We are inviting women who are ready to step into their fullest expression to weave their own threads into this web, because together we can hold even more. By holding we mean walking through life with strength and grace, bringing fierce loving kindness to whatever we do - my that be in our role as leaders, artists, mothers, sisters, daughters or professionals of any kind. We want to create a space for everyone to bring their gifts and see what emerges from that.
We carry a deep believe that all living beings on this planet are connected. One of the main causes of human suffering is our sense of separation from each other and our planet. At the core of our work is to create spaces where humans can reconnect to a sense of wholeness within ourselves and through authentic connection with each other and nature. We don't have the answers to what is it the worlds needs right now, but we have a sense that it needs us to reconnect. And this is what we are inviting: a space for reconnection. Creating such spaces is an integral part of our work and we have done so in many countries over the last decade (some of us even longer ;)).
If you are curious to learn more about the retreat or to join us see: http://www.womenaremedicine.com/retreat
 

What We Need & What You Get
If we reach our funding goal we will be able to cover Sikhithewe's flight and accommodation/food for her and 3 other women. If we raise more, more women will be able to participate.
A flight from Zimbabwe to Turkey costs about 1000€, the cost of accommodation and food for the 5 days we will spend there together is ca. 220€. 
For this retreat we are working with the gift economy. The hosting team is not charging a fee but inviting participants to gift towards covering our costs and time.
By contributing to this fund you will enable some wonderful women to strengthen their capacity to host their families and projects with grace and strength through connecting to other women and becoming part of a strong web of relationships that can hold the world in its loving arms.
"When spiders unite they can tear down a lion" an African proverb
 



Other Ways You Can Help
You can't contribute but still want to help?
Help us spread the campaign and invite others to contribute. 
Indiegogo has some great share tools.

Thank you very much for any help you are offering. We grately appreciate it. <3

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ashley.  I am soliciting support and sponsorships in order to continue the Pink Boat Regatta in Seattle, WA. Last year, in its first year, as a result of this regatta we wrote a check to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation for $36,000.
 
This year I'm going rogue by enlisting your support to cover the costs associated with this event in order to donate 100% of proceeds to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation. 
 
Here is a recent article describing how we're trying to save the regatta and why I need YOU to help:
 
http://threesheetsnw.com/blog/2013/05/pink-boat...
 

Event Highlights & Details

  • Date: August 17th, 2013 in the waters of Shilshole Bay in Seattle, WA. Sailboat race will take place from noon-3pm.
  • Party to follow at 7755 Seaview Ave Nw, Seattle (Corinthian Yacht Club)
  • FREE beer courtesy of Emerald City Brewing Company
  • Mystery Bay Seafood & Catering will be on site
  • We already have some AMAZING auction items!
This race is unique because fundraising dollars translate to buoys on the race course - so participating boats can actually increase their chances of winning just by soliciting donations to the cause.  Furthermore, ANYONE can raise money and decide right up until 5pm on race day how they would like their dollars turned into buoys!  Throw the race!  Cheat to win!  The race is scored twice - including, and not including, "purchased buoys" - which means it remains competetive for those serious racers out there.
 
There is also a pinkest boat award.  This translates to ridiculous amounts of awesomeness.
 
 
Check out the photos from last year's event, they speak for themselves:
 
http://janpix.smugmug.com/Boats/Pink-Boat-Regatta-2012/25286801_kMD9SK#!i=2077395447&k=kd7HRGC
 
Check out our event page with BCRF:
 
http://www.fundraiseforBCRF.org/pinkboatregatta
 
Please note that any donations made via our event page go straight to BCRF.  So please, HELP us make the impact I know we can. 

What We Need & What You Get

There are a lot of expenses involved in putting on a regatta.  The hosting yacht club is run by volunteers, which means there are a bunch of awesome people working hard to make this happen without getting a cent.  I do, however, still need to pay for the following:

  • Venue rental for the Charity Auction & after party
  • Moorage for participating boats
  • Up-front costs associated with tshirts and other merchandise
  • Trophies and other awards
  • Music/entertainment during the party
  • Catering & provisions for spectator boats
  • Other miscellaneous costs that always tend to sneak up

The Impact

Bottom line: Research Helps Save Lives.

I challenge any of you to think of someone who hasn't been affected by breast cancer.  BCRF is the highest rated (A+) breast cancer organization in the country.  91 cents of every dollar goes directly to research and awareness. 

We have already proven this event a success and are taking it to the next level. 

Note*: Your contribuation to this campaign goes to the sole purpose of covering costs associated with this event because I am convinced it needs to move forward and has the potential to make a huge difference in ours and any community.  Any money which exceeds our costs will be donated to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, however, contributions to this campaign are otherwise not tax deductible.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. If you're in/near Seattle - Volunteer!!  Yes!  Oh what FUN!  There are a million ways for you to help both right now, and on race day.
  2. If you're anywhere, and regardless of whether or not you're able to contribute - SHARE!  Spread!  Shout from mountaintops! 
  3. Donate items (tax deductible) for the charity auction!

Seriously, people.  Let's DO this thing!

story:
Summary

Hi! We're Ryan and Kip, and we've been working for next to nothing recording local musicians and helping to promote them for four years now.  We are now ready to expand to be able to help more musicians get their music out into the world without the hassle of all the contracts and legalities found when you have to go through a record label.

We are trying to raise $125,000 to move to a new facility and build a live room, drum booth, and vocal booth, and equip the facility with some new gear, expanding our capabilities.

By helping us realize this dream, you'll be helping hundreds of musicians to achieve their dreams, who may otherwise never have the chance.

 

What We Need

So where is this $125,000 going?

$3,200 will get us in the door of a new facility. Then we need permits.

$1,000 worth of permits.  Then we can buy materials.

$12,000 worth of materials.  Soundproofing isn't cheap.  Neither is the team that builds it.

$17,000 goes to construction costs. Painted walls and all.  Now we need computers! 3 of 'em, and some pretty expensive software.

$10,000 covers it.  With software it could be worse.  And the golden egg?

$69,000 to expand and upgrade our equipment. Wow. 

We left just enough extra ($12,800) in what we're asking for to cover the fees on indiegogo should we get just a dollar less than exactly what we need.

But don't worry, any extra money just goes to improve the studio further.  Every dollar makes a big difference.

We came up with some great perks to say thanks for all the help in helping others pursue their dreams.

If we can't reach the entire goal, we'll use what we get to do as much of this as possible, and keep trying to raise more money so we can help independent musicians share their music with the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute.  We're pretty broke too!  Help by running into the streets and screaming our name, posting links on facebook and twitter and tumblr and grandma's forehead.  The more people that know, hopefully the more that are willing to help.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
HAVE YOU EVER BEEN A VICTIM OR KNOW SOMEONE THAT HAS BEEN OF A VICTIM  ABUSE???  THEN YOU WILL UNDERSTAND WHAT I AM GOING THROUGH.

After purchasing my house, giving birth to my son, preparing for my upcoming wedding my finances are gone to pay my lawyer to keep my abusive ex from MY daughter. I thought I had paid her in full, but with more paper work and a postponement the bill has gone up again. I go back to court the April 29th, now remember this has been going on for over a year, postponement after another, costing ME lots of money and I still owe my attorney. He has had 3 different attorneys and never paid one of them in full.  His last one terminated their relationship due to non payment, so now he will get a new attorney, and there will probably be yet another continuance.  My attorney suggested I bring in a guardian  to help with this, and my ex was to pay half, which may I add he hasn't, so I had to pay the full bill for her. He doesn't pay his child support, when he adds anything to her account it's a small amount like 38.00. Since leaving him I found out he was NOT the person he pretended to be. I have now found out he has at LEAST 7 children that he doesn't take care of, most he has never seen nor acknowledges.  But yet he wants mine.  He has not laid eyes on her for over 4 years, and she is just 5 now.. I have an order of protection against him for domestic abuse, but again, he thinks he can come back into my life and get his abusive hands on MY daughter???? He doesn't care about her, this is all about me.  Pay back. He told me after he threatened to kill me that I would never get rid of him he would always be in my life. I pray the courts see the truth, but you never know.  I really need to pay off my attorney and this guardian so she can start her investigation Please help me help keep my daughter safe..

 

Thank you,

Jessica

UPDATE

This is the 2nd time I had to ask for help due to what he is putting me through. I have spent 10s of thousands of dollars in the last 5 years due to him. One of his reasons is to break me, but he still will never touch my child.  Thank you all for all of your help. xoxoxoxoxox

story:
The Clinton Hell’s Kitchen Coalition for Pedestrian Safety (CHEKPEDS), Hell’s Kitchen Neighborhood Association (HKNA), Clinton Housing Development Company (CHDC) and representatives of adjoining buildings and organizations have joined forces to create a 7,000 sq. ft. park by reclaiming unused roadway on the east side of Dyer Avenue between 34th and 35th Streets in Manhattan. We are seeking your help in executing this three-phase project. The first phase will take place in March 2013 and will cost $ 20,000.

Christine Berthet and Martin Treat are the cofounders of CHEKPEDS. Since 2005 we have advocated to calm the traffic in Hell's Kitchen through various initiatives including installing bike lanes and trees in the area and reclaiming excessive highway space, which helps reduce crashes. 

Kathleen Treat is the Chair of the Hell’s Kitchen Neighborhood Association, which since 1995 has advocated for affordable housing, improved quality of life and improved health. We experience the third highest asthma hospitalization rate In Manhattan.

Shanti Nagel, is the director of Cultivation for CHDC. Since 1973 CHDC has developed hundreds of affordable residences in the neighborhood with an eye toward conservation, restoration and beautification. 

Jeffrey Peyser represents over 200 residents adjacent to the park.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $15,000 in funding to remove a traffic light island in order to free up a contiguous three-lane area to build the park on the east. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has expressed its willingness to free up the unused lanes of traffic, but the traffic island must be removed first and we have to pay for it. 

Later in the year there will be two hearings to collect input from the community at large and finalize the park design and we anticipate the City will fund the construction of the whole park. 

Give one , we get two ! All contributions up to $ 7,500 are being matched by a generous donor ! Give one we get three! If your employer matches  donations, get the matching for our park.  Your and your company's contributions are tax deductible: we are registered as a charity with 501(c)(3) status. 

You will be invited to the Benefit Party in early January. in addition your contribution will be recognized once the park is installed by listing your name prominently on the web, and with plaques at the entrance, on furniture, benches and tables.

IF we do not reach our goal, we will return the funds to you (net of fees).

 

The Impact

Our community ranks in the city’s bottom 2% in terms of green space per residents.  This is a terrific opportunity to remedy this problem in Hell’s Kitchen South, home to a large population of low-income tenants, a school without a schoolyard and a growing residential population with no green space or parks easily accessible. We hope you will be able to help us overcome this first hurdle and give life to the project.

Transportation Infrastructure occupies  50% of the land, thus roadway is the only land available to convert to park. Reducing the roadway is also a very effective way to reduce speed and crashes. 

Our organizations have successfully raised funds to create the 9th Avenue Renaissance, to fund a 4 -year Engineering study of the traffic in Hell's kitchen which led to the installation of bike lanes on 8th and 9th Avenues in our neighborhood. 

We need your help to overcome this first obstacle and win park space for this park-starved community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help: You deserve the gift of a park 

Ask your family and friends to donate to the park in your name! We hope you will be able to contribute, but also encourage your corporation, your family and friend to gift to you a little piece of a park for the holiday and the New Year. You deserve it! 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Ask friends and family to make a donation in your name, as a holiday gift. 
  • Use the share tools!

 See you in the park !

story:
Update (21/02/13):

only one week left to get your hands on some exclusively priced goodies!! We've been busy making and photographing awesome new things - check out the photos below!

And NEWS:

We've been selected for UK Handmade's Spring Showcase - we'll be featured along with some other excellent crafters for 6 weeks, starting Feb 25!! 

We'll have a stall at Dotty Sparkles Vintage and Handmade Fair on March 2nd (https://www.facebook.com/dotty.sparkle) and another at The Hockley & Rochford Crafter's Market on March 16th (https://www.facebook.com/events/225082070957833/).

We've applied for the upcoming Secret Vintage Fair at an undisclosed location in Colchester on March 30th (https://www.facebook.com/events/426066414133207/) - this one is HUGE and we've got our fingers crossed HARD! 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Update (03/02/13): Rather than hiding the link to our shop wayyyy down at the bottom, we are moving it up here: You can find us at Etsy.com/shop/getpainted

 ------------------------------------------------------------------

Update (01/02/13): Yesterday, we passed 10% of our funding goal thanks to very generous sponsors AND we were mentioned in Nerdy With Children's Roundup for Great Indiegogo Fundraisers. We also have a Facebook fan page and a brand new blog! 

 

Kate has been sewing for herself and her friends for nearly two decades (and knitting, cross-stitching, and embroidering, too). Always, at the back of her mind was a voice: “this is what I was born to do”. Through experiments as a writer, an art student, a business student, a marketer, a shop girl, a retail manager, and a mother (an experiment that has stuck), she kept stitching.

Andrew's sensibility, inventiveness, business background and practicality balance Kate's talents so well that they have been collaborating for over a decade. 

This is where YOU come in. We need your help to get from our tiny bedroom studio in Essex into busy craft markets and onto the interwebs. Our first push will be behind our children's brand, Painted Bunting. We will be making and selling:

  • recycled wool stuffed toys

  • simple, durable, clothes and accessories

  • whimsical decor items made from recycled books

  • dress up and imagination toys

 

Our goal is to be trading weekly in Essex and London markets by May of 2013. Concurrently, we'll continue to grow our Etsy (http://etsy.com/shop/getpainted) and Folksy (http://folksy.com/shops/idyllia) shops and develop a stand-alone online shop complete with a marketing budget and beautiful business cards and marketing materials from Moo.com.

 What We Need & What You Get

We have the talent, dedication and flair to succeed. What we don't have are the funds. 

You know we aren't about to ask for money for nothing! Our perks are awesome ----> check them out!

All perks have a bespoke component - you are assured that what your gift is one of a kind and handmade with love and care. Everything is created by us in our home studio in beautiful Southend-on-Sea, Essex. 

The Impact

Every bit helps a small family business get off the ground:

  • We keep as much of the money we spend as we can in the local community, we buy from local suppliers and charity shops as much as possible.

  • Your help means that food stays on the table and a roof stays over our heads during the daunting and difficult beginning of our start-up's lifecycle.

  • We are committed to ethics in manufacturing and selling, we use quality materials, sourced ethically and locally.

  • We will market our children's goods without resorting to out of date and offensive gender stereotyping.

  • We design our products with kids in mind - all kids, but especially kids like ours: kids on the Autism spectrum, kids with Sensory Processing issues and kids in glasses - the kids who high street shops tend to ignore.

A Very Detailed Breakdown of How We Plan to Use the Money

  • One-time business registration fees
  • Public Liability Insurance (Premium for 2013)
  • Web hosting package (Feb-May)
  • Domain Name Registration (Fees for 2013)
  • Rental cost of Studio Space (Feb-May)
  • Utility Costs for Studio Space (Feb-May)
  • Market Stall/Table fees (Feb-May)
  • Transportation (We'll use Public Transit whenever possible!)
  • Studio Supplies (Feb-May)
  • Etsy and Folksy fees (Fees are per listing and that number's been estimated)
  • Advertising Online and in a popular Quarterly magazine
  • Marketing Materials (Business Cards, Postcards, Flyers, Stickers - printed locally or through Moo.com)
  • Small living allowance for Andrew, Kate, and their two kids Seb and Rigby.

And what happens if we don't reach our goal? Well, it depends what portion we do raise, but the idea is that we will use what we receive FIRST to cover studio, supplies and equipment costs. THEN to cover transport costs, market fees and insurance (a requirement of many daily markets). And FINALLY, everything else. 

Every pound we get counts, please consider giving anything you can. And please use the buttons under the video to share our project with your social networks.

Thank You

♥ Kate Harris & Andrew Forsyth (and Rigby & Seb!)
story_txt:
Update (21/02/13):
only one week left to get your hands on some exclusively priced goodies!! We've been busy making and photographing awesome new things - check out the photos below!
And NEWS:
We've been selected for UK Handmade's Spring Showcase - we'll be featured along with some other excellent crafters for 6 weeks, starting Feb 25!! 
We'll have a stall at Dotty Sparkles Vintage and Handmade Fair on March 2nd (https://www.facebook.com/dotty.sparkle) and another at The Hockley & Rochford Crafter's Market on March 16th (https://www.facebook.com/events/225082070957833/).
We've applied for the upcoming Secret Vintage Fair at an undisclosed location in Colchester on March 30th (https://www.facebook.com/events/426066414133207/) - this one is HUGE and we've got our fingers crossed HARD! 
------------------------------------------------------------------
Update (03/02/13): Rather than hiding the link to our shop wayyyy down at the bottom, we are moving it up here: You can find us at Etsy.com/shop/getpainted
 ------------------------------------------------------------------
Update (01/02/13): Yesterday, we passed 10% of our funding goal thanks to very generous sponsors AND we were mentioned in Nerdy With Children's Roundup for Great Indiegogo Fundraisers. We also have a Facebook fan page and a brand new blog!

story:
Jeff Larsen

HELLO EVERYONE,

MY NAME IS JEFF LARSEN, AND I AM AN INVENTOR! I WORK HARD AND I WORK A LOT. I DON’T LIE, CHEAT, OR STEAL. I STARTED WORKING IN THE LANDSCAPE INDUSTRY AS A SEASONAL LABOR EMPLOYEE AND CLIMBED THE RANKS OF SOME OF LARGEST LANDSCAPE COMPANIES IN THE NATION. I DO HAVE EXTENSIVE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATIONS IN THE LANDSCAPE AND IRRIGATION INDUSTRY. 

 OVER THE LAST 10 MONTHS, I HAVE DEVELOPED A LAWN AND GARDEN EDGING SYSTEM WITH ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES. I HAVE NAMED IT KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING BECAUSE OF ONE OF ITS DESIGN FEATURES--NOT TO MENTION THAT IT IS SIMPLE ENOUGH THAT ANY KNUCKLEHEAD CAN INSTALL IT (AND IT WAS DEFINITELY CREATED BY A KNUCKLEHEAD;) .

Knucklehead Edging

KNUCKLEHEAD TM EDGING IS MY SOLUTION TO MULTIPLE ISSUES THAT CURRENT LANDSCAPE EDGING AND CURBING PRODUCTS DO NOT ADDRESS, AS WELL AS THE PRODUCTS THEMSELVES.  CONCRETE CURBING, STEEL AND ALUMINUM EDGING, AND VARIOUS STYLES OF PLASTIC BENDABLE EDGING PROVIDE ONLY A DEFINING LINE BETWEEN DIFFERENT LANDSCAPED SURFACES.  TURF GRASS, BECAUSE IT HAS DEEP ROOTS, WILL GROW UNDERNEATH ANY OF THE CURRENT PRODUCTS AVAILABLE TODAY.  THE ONLY WAY TO SECURE A WEED BARRIER TO THE GROUND IS WITH FABRIC PINS. THIS PROCEDURE IS INEFFECTIVE AND ALLOWS GRASS TO INVADE UNWANTED AREAS.

MADE FROM 80-100% RECYCLED PLASTIC AND 100% RECYCLABLE. KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING FEATURES A DOUBLE WIDE STEPPED DESIGN (AN INCH AND A HALF WIDE), A TONGUE AND GROOVE WEED FABRIC RETAINING SYSTEM, AND HOUSING TO PROTECT YOUR LOW VOLTAGE LANDSCAPE LIGHTING WIRE AND DRIP IRRIGATION TUBING.

 

THE FINAL STEP 

I HAVE SET MY FUNDING GOAL AT 95,000 DOLLARS TO COVER MY FIRST 40,000 LINEAR FEET OF BLOWN HIGH DENSITY POLYETHYLENE STOCK (1 SEMI-LOAD), 72K SQAURE FEET OF WEED BARRIER MATERIAL, CUSTOM COLORED PLASTIC WELDING ROD, AND MANUFACTURING EXPENSES.

  • 44% GOAL BUDGET HDPE STOCK 41.6/95
  • 11% GOAL BUDGET WEED FABRIC 10.6/95
  • 1% GOAL BUDGET PLASTIC WELDING ROD 1.2/95
  • 5%MANUFACTURING TOOLS 5/95
  • 25%MANUFACTURING LABOR 24/95
  • 10% CROWD FUNDING 9.5/95

THIS IS ALL I NEED TO GET KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING MOVING AROUND THE WORLD! EVERYTHING ELSE IS READY!

  • PATENT PENDING...CHECK.
  • PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT...CHECK.
  • HAND BUILD CUSTOM MILLING STATION....CHECK.
  • PRODUCT TRADE MARK....CHECK.
  • UTILITY PATENT PROCESS.....CHECK.
  • MANUFACTURING AND ASSEMBLY FACILITY.....CHECK
  • INCORPORATE....CHECK
  • PERSONALLY TRAIN EMPLOYEES....CHECK
  • CUSTOM BUILD FORMS 25+....CHECK.
  • PRODUCT LITERATURE....CHECK.
  • PRODUCT MARKETING AND SALES....CHE....STARTING!

 YOU WILL BE REWARDED WITH KNUCKLEHEAD

YOU GET THE LATEST AND GREATEST DEVELOPMENT IN THE LANDSCAPE INDUSTRY FOR DECADES, KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING!

I HAVE ESTABLISHED MULTIPLE LEVELS TO REWARD DIFFERENT DONATIONS. EVERYONE RECEIVES MY PERSONAL THANK YOU! HIGHER DONATIONS RECEIVE KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING PACKAGES. PLEASE BE AWARE THAT SOME REWARDS ARE INTENDED FOR LOCAL PICK-UP ONLY AND DO NOT INCLUDE SHIPPING. WE ARE ONLY PREPARED FOR U.S. SHIPPING ON THE ITEMS THAT SPECIFY SHIPPING. ALL REWARDS ARE BELOW RETAIL PRICING FOR THIS CAMPAIGN ONLY! 

KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING IS AVAILABLE IN UN-ASSEMBLED AND PRE-FORMED ARCS AND SHAPES. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NOTHING ON THE MARKET TODAY THAT WILL COMPARE WITH THE EFFORTLESS INSTALLATION OF OUR PREFORMED SHAPES. KNUCKLEHEAD PRE-FORMED ARCS AND SHAPES ALL HAVE CORRESPONDING LEFT AND RIGHT SIDES AND WHEN USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER PRE-FORMED ARCS YOU HAVE ENDLESS DESIGN POSSIBILITIES. 

UNLIKE CONCRETE CURBING, KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING CAN BE INSTALLED BY ANY HOMEOWNER. KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING AS THE UN-ASSEMBLED OR PRE-FORMED SHAPES WILL NOT HAVE THE "WOBBLE" EFFECT THAT THIN METAL AND PLASTIC EDGING PRODUCE. THESE FEATURES ALONE MAKE OUR EDGING FAR SUPERIOR, AND WITH OUR PATENTED WEED FABRIC RETAINING SYSTEM, LANDSCAPE LIGHTING WIRE AND DRIP TUBING HOUSING, KNUCKLEHEAD EDGING TRULY WILL SET THE STANDARDS FOR YEARS TO COME!

CURRENTLY, I AM PURCHASING MATERIALS AT WHOLESALE LEVELS. IN ORDER TO RECEIVE DISTRIBUTOR LEVEL PRICING FROM MY VENDOR, I NEED TO PURCHASE BY THE SEMI LOAD.  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IS LISTED UNDER THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES SECTION. 

CHALLENGES I'VE ENCOUNTERED

Knucklehead Edging as a product line is astronomical in size and the same to the landscape industry. Since Knucklehead Edging benefits the aspects of lighting, drip irrigation, weed barrier material, and overall appearance, it will set the standard in the industry for years to come! Surprisingly, I have had very few problems with Knucklehead Edging until just recently.

Prior to August 2012 I thought I was going to be able to build this product one foot at a time! When I had a order to fill, I would: Place a "will call" order with my supplier, pick up the order, and mill the material into our finished product. Edgeworks USA was scheduled to have a grand opening and wanted to have inventory on hand for this event. Like usual, I placed my order and upon loading noticed that it was thinner than the prior product purchased. After contacting a sales representative we discovered that this was the new product available. The current manufacturer of my polyethylene stock has changed the dimensions of their product, thus resulting in a product that will not be sufficient for the features of Knucklehead Edging.  I have been informed that any materials specific to Knucklehead Edging from this point forward, will need to be a custom order and will need to be purchased in semi load quantities for the best pricing. 

Knucklehead Edging as pre-formed shapes are collapsable so most pieces are no more than 6-8 feet long. This size fits perfectly into most automobiles, but not so well in boxes for shipping. Edgeworks USA is currently shipping products from Utah anywhere in the United States. Like any other products, shipping is a significant cost associated with Knucklehead Edging products. We try to package orders in the most efficient way possible but depending on the order, this may not always be possible.  Edgeworks USA is looking into setting up multiple location (possibly franchises) throughout the United States specifically to lower cost associated with shipping. Ideally, Edgeworks USA locations will supply local distributors with products for residential use and wholesale purchases in their region.

The whole Knucklehead Edging process starts as blank stock at 1.25 pounds per foot. Once the blank stock is milled into Knucklehead Edging the total linear foot weight drops by 33%. This is beneficial because it directly relates to shipping cost. This process alone increases shipping volume by 33%, and produces 33% of shavings that are 100% recyclable. Edgeworks USA Chicago will be the next facility established. All Knucklehead Edging will be produced at this location and shipped to Edgeworks USA and either sold as un-assembled or assembled pre-formed shapes.

The manufacturing process of Knucklehead Edging from blank stock to finished product, is complete in ONE step. This ONE step produces Knucklehead Edging ready to be installed in the field or pre-formed as a second process in house. Step #1 consists of a single pass through a nine tooled saw assembly at a rate of 1000 linear feet per hour. Step #2, (in-house pre-forming) is where Knucklehead Edging becomes specific shapes and has weed barrier options installed. This step is completed in-house and has production rates in the 20-30 linear feet per hour.

My first semi load of blank stock will be a huge risk because it is more material than I currently have orders for. It will be a challenge funding the initial large purchases necessary for best pricing. It will be a challenge getting people aware of the "Awesomeness" of Knucklehead Edging. I love a good challenge!

The feed back and response from the public has been great! KnuckleHead Edging debuted at the salt lake city spring home and garden show in March of 2012. This was a new experience for myself, but after 3 and a half days and over 750 potential customers and 2 without positive feedback, I feel it was a great success.

JEFF LARSEN BIO

Edgeworks USA, llc is the result of a lifetime of providing landscaping and irrigation services throughout the Wasatch Front. Beginning as a young child, Jeff Larsen developed a strong work ethic working in a relative's greenhouse and farming business. As young adult, Jeff felt a desire to build a career in the landscape industry. By earning multiple certifications in irrigation, he climbed the ranks of some of the largest landscape and irrigation companies.

Mid-summer 2007, an opportunity arrived to pursue the dream of being his own boss and small business owner. Keep it Green Sprinkling by Jeff Larsen Inc. was founded. Working and contracting with homeowners, Jeff realized that his clients all had similar needs and dislikes with current landscape edging available. Four years later, onsite with extra material on hand, two pieces of polyboard edging screwed together gave Jeff the idea that has turned into KNUCKLEHEAD TM EDGING. Realizing the potential of the product, Jeff spent a couple hours with a router in his garage to build the first tongue and groove version with weed fabric prototype for patenting. Early 2012, post filing for patent pending, Jeff built a custom profile milling station specific for Knucklehead Edging. After months of trial and error, experimenting and numerous new developments, Knucklehead TM Edging is what we see today! Featuring our patented double-wide stepped look, tongue and groove weed fabric retaining system, low voltage landscape lighting wire and drip irrigation tubing housing!

story:
LAUNCH DAY SPECIAL! - $15 OFF FIRST 10 PURCHASES and A FREE LENNOX SIGNATURE TEA MUG!! JUST CLICK FACEBOOK SPECIAL OR TWITTER SPECIAL! THANK YOU!

 

The first night I dated my wife, I promised her that she’d never crave another cup of decaf coffee after drinking a cup of my tea.  I’m not a arrogant man so I wasn't being cocky, but after years of serving my signature blends to very satisfied friends, family and coworkers, I am just that sure that anyone, (hopefully everyone!) will love my tea as much as I love blending them. After drinking a cup of one of my Signature Flavor Blends, one of the things that set off explosions of joy in my soul is watching the look of surprise and appreciation on the faces of coffee enthusiasts, or those perplexing beings that claim nonchalance towards tea. (I know, I know—I can’t believe they exist either!)

 

Using the highest quality loose tea leaves (which are so much better than those suffocating in tea bags), my tea blends pack such a flavorful punch it will make your head snap back. My teas taste as creamy as a smoothie, are as decadent as a cup of hot chocolate, and look as pleasing to the eye as an iced caramel mocha frappe latte from one of those large coffee chains. You’re REALLY going to love this tea!!

 

One of my biggest dreams is to open up my own tea shop in New York City—Lennox’s Tea Room (what do you think of the name?  My wife isn’t too fond of it o_O ), but for now I’d LOVE to get my teas into select markets, coffee houses, and tea rooms across the country. Or at least in New York City. (Or maybe just one of the five boroughs—I don’t know. It’s really up to you!)

 

WHAT WE NEED:

To market my teas, I need packaging, ingredients, and upgraded kitchen supplies.  To supply your rewards, I'll need to pay for additional packaging and shipping costs.  To accomplish the first run of teas, our accountant pinpointed our funding goal down to the dollar, totaling $1,285.   

So here is where you come in, my WONDERFUL TEA-LOVING INDIEGOGO SUPPORTERS!

This summer, why not try my delicious teas, and help this High School Advocate Counselor by day transform into “The Tea Man” I am in my heart? One of the things I tell my students, and my own two kids, is that dreams become reality.  It may be a cliché, but it’s a good one because it’s true. Not trying to go overboard by pulling at your heart strings, but I want my kids—ALL of my kids—to see me accomplish one of my dreams, so that they’ll know that they can achieve theirs—no matter how unlikely, or crazy, or unattainable they may seem.

So what can you do to help about 300 high school kids to dream big? How can you help me communicate the message to my four year old and almost two year old daughters that they can achieve their dreams because Daddy achieved his?

TRY MY TEAS! EVERYONE WINS! ;)

WHAT YOU GET:

If you are so kind as to pledge $5 dollars, I will personally email you a copy of my tea recipe book. Ok, I will probably try to guilt my wife into emailing it for me, but either way you’ll receive it.  You’ll love this book.  In it, I’ll show you how to make delicious, delectable teas with no more than what you already have stocked in your kitchen! This reward is available to ALL INDIEGOGO SUPPORTERS as a token of my sincerest thanks for helping me achieve my dream!

If you are generous enough to pledge $7, you will receive TWO OUNCES of my Signature Flavor Blends.That’s enough to make 16 cups of regular strength tea!

Pledge $15, and receive THREE OUNCES of my Signature Flavor Blends. Enjoy those 24 cups of deliciousness with your very own LENNOX SIGNATURE TEA INFUSER. The Signature Tea Infuser will only be available to INDIEGOGO SUPPORTERS.

Pledge $20 and receive the FACEBOOK SPECIAL! Not only will you receive a discount of $15, you’ll also enjoy 80 cups of my Signature Flavor Blends, sent to you in a delicious Signature Sample Pack. One ounce of each flavor, ten ounces of Lennox SignatureTea in all! This is only available to the first 100 supporters as a huge thank you for your support!

Pledge $35.  Receive my SIGNATURE SAMPLE PACK that includes an ounce of every Signature Tea Blend. You’re gonna LOVE these teas!

Double up your pledge to $65 and receive double the samples, and a $5 discount!

A $100 pledge warrants a special thanks. You’ll receive a big fat huge smiley face, smiled from behind the computer of one grateful Tea Man, AND 40 OUNCES OF TEA plus 2 SIGNATURE TEA INFUSERS, plus TWO SIGNATURE MUGS!! This is truly a haul to be shared with a friend! On the other hand, 320 cups of tea would make every one of your days delicious for almost the whole of next year!  WOW!

As I tell my students, anything worth having comes with challenges that will make you appreciate your goal once you achieve it. Your support of my exciting dream is worth having, and I will sure appreciate you trusting me enough to give it. That said, I look forward to meeting any challenges this endeavor will bring, and since this is new territory for me, I can only guess what those challenges will be. But with almost 300 young eyes watching my every move, you better believe you will receive your teas, beautifully packaged and preserved, and just as delicious and satisfying as you imagine them to be.

Thank you for believing in me enough to try my tea! I won't disappoint you!
 

 

Note: The video music, "Moment of Green" is by Anthony Raijek.  Thanks for providing the perfect song!

Other Ways You Can Help

My dream will only become reality with your support, and the support of everyone you know!  So please tell EVERYONE, and I mean EVERYONE about my teas! Convince them to come to INDIEGOGO to show their support! Tweet, Facebook, text and email the ones you love about Lennox Signature Teas, and share the decadent deliciousness you're sure to enjoy! Thank you :)

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Stephanie Cleary and I've been suffering from Alopecia Areata since I was 3 years old.  I've had a rough time with it most of my life but I am finally becoming comfortable with it.  I started modeling at age 14 and have never looked back!  I am hoping that funds raised from this campaign will help to produce an event to generate more awareness and even more money to the Alopecia Cause.

With your help you can make a fun event that will help a lot of kids deal with a disease that very few people have heard of.

Alopecia areata is a auto-immune disease that causes a sudden loss of patches of hair on the scalp and sometimes other parts of the body. It is nonscarring, which means that there is no permanent damage to the hair follicle. In most people, new hair eventually grows back in the affected areas, although this process can take months. Approximately 50 percent of people with mild alopecia areata recover within a year; however, most people will experience more than one episode during their lifetime.

The estimated prevalence of alopecia areata is approximately 1 in 1000 people, with a lifetime risk of approximately 2 percent. About one person in 50 will suffer from alopecia areata at some point in their life (or 6 Million people in the US at the current census). For most patients the onset is before age 30; it occurs in men and women of all races equally. The condition can develop at any age, although most people develop alopecia areata for the first time during childhood.

Alopecia areata is not life threatening, and does not cause physical pain. However, the cosmetic effects of hair loss can be devastating.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will be going towards the event production and whatever is left after the completion of the event will be donated to the cause.

With this unique disease we can offer a unique gift with your donation of $10 or more, you will get a complimentary bracelet that is being sold in a local craft store, and swag bag with goodies from the event.  If you donate $20 or more you will get the bracelet, and swag bag!  And lastly if you donate $35 or more you will get all the stuff above and 2 free tickets to the event!

The Impact

This cause helps bring a disease that may not be directly life threatening it can however be in-directly life threatening.  These kids need hope to know that one day there will be a cure for this disease.

Losing one’s hair can be a devastating experience, particularly because it develops suddenly and the loss is difficult to hide. Women and children frequently struggle with depression or low self-esteem as a result of their hair loss.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this as often as you can!  Also please go on to facebook and like:

Facebook: Global Alopecia Mission

Facebook: Starry Eyes Candles

story:
New Alternatives for Children,Inc. (NAC), a New York City based child welfare and healthcare agency specifically serving children with complex medical needs. NAC families have experienced or are at risk of abuse and/or neglect.  Annually NAC serves children with special healthcare needs, their siblings and family members in one of our five core programs – NAC’s Foster Care & Adoption program, The Post Legal Adoption Network (PLAN), Preventive Services, Partners In Parenting (PIP) after care program, and the Bridges to Health (B2H) program. NAC estimates that 70% of our families live below the poverty line, and a total of 91% of our families live below 200% of the poverty line.

NAC holds an annual Book Fair coordinated by the Learning Project to reach a large number of families and facilitate a love for reading. Books are provided by various donors including Scholastic, McGraw Hill and the Society of Illustrators. Infants through adults are able to choose new, enticing books engaging them in the agency and reading. Many of these families would not be able to purchase these books on their own. More that 200 families attend the Book Fair participating in a reading circle, literacy related crafts and food bank distribution creating a day when the whole family can explore their interest in reading.

The Book Fair food pantry distribution is a key part of this day. Parents often depend on these bags of food to feed their families and is often the key to their attendance of the Book Fair. Due to a reduction in our Food Pantry annual grant, we are not able to guarentee funds in November for the Book Fair food distribution. We are in need of YOUR HELP to feed our families!

Your donation will go directly to the distributor when ordering for the November Book Fair food distribution. Simillary, the more money we have, the more fresh produce we can purchase for our families. If we have additional donations, we will provide snacks at the event for children as well.

story:
About Us and Our Project:

Historic Albany Foundation needs to raise $10,000 for immediate repairs to the roof of the Van Ostrande-Radliff House at 48 Hudson Avenue.  Historic Albany recently acquired the Van Ostrande-Radliff House at 48 Hudson Avenue in Albany, New York.  Built in 1728, it is documented to be the oldest surviving building in the city. It has been vacant since the 1990’s and is in immediate need of roof repairs. Water is cascading through the east wall through a leak in the roof and is causing substantial damage to this precious resource. Historic Albany must repair the roof so that the building will continue to stand while a plan to restore the building is developed.

Historic Albany Foundation is a private, not-for-profit membership organization established in 1974. The Foundation was formed by a small group of concerned neighbors and citizens after New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller began one of the largest urban renewal projects: the South Mall/Empire State Plaza, that wiped out over 1,500 buildings and displaced hundreds of families.

HAF fulfills its mandate through public education, promotion and membership, provision of design and technical assistance, community projects, advocacy for endangered buildings, publications, tours, lectures and operation of an architectural parts warehouse. 

Our mission is to preserve and protect buildings that have architectural, historic or civic value, by providing technical assistance, education, and advocacy.


How You're Helping & the "Perks" You'll Receive:

With each level of giving, our supporters (you!) will receive a different perk!  Each level of higher giving, adds another perk onto what you will already be receiving.

All of the funds raised from this campaign will go towards the repairs of the roof for the Van Ostrande-Radliff House.  Sadly, if we don't reach our goal, we will still put all of your generous donations towards this project.


The Impact & A Bit of History:

The Van Ostrande-Radliff House is one of only a handful of North American urban Dutch houses to survive into the twenty-first century, but even greater rarities exist within its construction. The modified anchor beam framing for the side jambless fireplace is the only surviving example of this construction type in the United States, and represents a type of construction that was common in both New York City and Albany throughout most of the period of Dutch cultural dominance. In addition, the molded anchor beam that adorns the front of the building is one of only two in this country to survive in situ. Additional material of particular importance and extreme rarity include the original un-tapered weather board siding, which exists on the west side of the building, and survives in much the same condition as it did when the neighboring structure was built in the early years of the nineteenth century.

The Van Ostrande-Radliff House was built in 1728 during Albany’s culturally Dutch period beginning in 1624 that extended long after the official end of Dutch rule in the region in 1664. The house’s date of construction has been ascertained through documentary sources and corroborated by tree ring dating, or dendrochronology, performed on its framing members. Careful inspection of the building, coupled with its canted front wall, built to conform to Albany’s meandering post-medieval street pattern, leave little doubt that the Van Ostrande-Radliff House was originally built on its current site outside of the stockade as it then existed.

While it is not known exactly how the Van Ostrande-Radliff House appeared during the Dutch cultural period, it is known that the first substantial alteration to the exterior of the house was an enlargement that occurred after the Revolution around 1790. These modifications coincided, as is typical, with the marriage of one of its occupants.

It was at a time of great change in the region, that Albanian Jared Holt purchased the then 100-year-old Van Ostrande-Radliff House and moved his residence there in 1835. Two years later, Holt moved his wax-making business there from another location nearby, and enlarged his new building around 1838 with a masonry wing for his manufacturing process added to the south. This company, which lasted into the 1990s, specialized early on, in making stitching wax to sell to shoe makers in the immediate vicinity. The company left the Van Ostrande-Radliff House in 1892 to another location just outside the core of the city.

In 1848, a substantial area of the Albany riverfront was wiped out in a fire, but 48 Hudson was spared. After the departure of Holt’s company in 1892, a variety of commercial establishments were housed in this building, and in 1935, the building was sold to members of the Saul family, who operated a restaurant supply store in the building until the 1990s, at which time it became vacant.  Historic Albany Foundation acquired the building in June 2013.

Please help Historic Albany Foundation make crucial repairs to the Van Ostrande-Radliff House. Your support, in any amount, is key to the survival of this important piece of America’s Dutch history and a rare and tangible link to one of the country’s earliest urban settlements.


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to donate funds or just want to help out further, please help us spread the word about our project and campaign! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Also, you can follow Historic Albany Foundation on Facebook and Twitter! 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Historic-Albany-Foundation/124957917535671

https://twitter.com/historicalbany


A special thank you to Jeremy Boyce for his musical talents!

story:
My Story:

Hi, my name is Chef Vicki Mancuso and my earliest memory of cooking was standing on a chair in front of the stove with my mother Josie when I was 7 years old and learning how to make what the Italians call "Sunday Gravy". (otherwise known to non italian individuals as Marinara  sauce). This and other times like it instilled in me a love of food that bore a passion to become a chef.

Since age 19 I have been in the culinary industry for upwards of 20 years, holding every position from deli sandwich maker to corporate food service manager with food service companies such as Flik International and Host America Corp.

With age brings wisdom and a true self-awareness - after being touched so deeply by my parents' brave battle with cancer and them passing within 4 months of each other, I  have a heightened appreciation of life itself so I decided to follow my dreams of owning my own business.

I hope to bring some of the joy to others that I was lucky enough to get in my mom's kitchen - good food made from scratch and served from the heart with love and laughter.

The success of Mancuso's Mobile Italian Kitchen will allow me, via my contributors and customers, to donate some of the proceeds to the American Cancer Society to do a small part in ensuring the great work of that organization continues.

What I Need:

A  used Food Truck will cost between $15,000.00 to $25,000.00. In addition to the food truck I will need the following listed below...

  • Permits - $500
  • Licsences - $500 
  • Equipment - $1000.00
  • Marketing - $1000.00
  • Generator - $1200.00
  • Conveyor Oven - $1200.00

Other Ways You Can Help: 

Please get the word out of what I'm trying to accomplish by either word of mouth or Twitter and Facebook. Any advertising would be greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
My Story:
Hi, my name is Chef Vicki Mancuso and my earliest memory of cooking was standing on a chair in front of the stove with my mother Josie when I was 7 years old and learning how to make what the Italians call "Sunday Gravy". (otherwise known to non italian individuals as Marinara  sauce). This and other times like it instilled in me a love of food that bore a passion to become a chef.
Since age 19 I have been in the culinary industry for upwards of 20 years, holding every position from deli sandwich maker to corporate food service manager with food service companies such as Flik International and Host America Corp.
With age brings wisdom and a true self-awareness - after being touched so deeply by my parents' brave battle with cancer and them passing within 4 months of each other, I  have a heightened appreciation of life itself so I decided to follow my dreams of owning my own business.
I hope to bring some of the joy to others that I was lucky enough to get in my mom's kitchen - good food made from scratch and served from the heart with love and laughter.
The success of Mancuso's Mobile Italian Kitchen will allow me, via my contributors and customers, to donate some of the proceeds to the American Cancer Society to do a small part in ensuring the great work of that organization continues.
What I Need:


A  used Food Truck will cost between $15,000.00 to $25,000.00. In addition to the food truck I will need the following listed below...

Permits - $500
Licsences - $500 
Equipment - $1000.00
Marketing - $1000.00
Generator - $1200.00
Conveyor Oven - $1200.00



Other Ways You Can Help: 
Please get the word out of what I'm trying to accomplish by either word of mouth or Twitter and Facebook. Any advertising would be greatly appreciated.
